Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Kristin M
Reviews.Content: I had a Wonderful experience at the W in New Orleans on Poydras. The staff was Friendly and professional. The rooms were Comfortable and the beds felt like heaven! I love the hip, fun vibe in the lobby too. I recommend you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Huge let down”
Reviews.Author: K1r8y
Reviews.Content: Looks nice via web page however it seems as if those photos were taken years ago. Located right next to Harrahs casino the valet parking was extremely congested waited out in the street holding up traffic for 10 minutes just trying to get in. Noticed poor upkeep upon entering lobby. Beverages discarded on tables in the lobby, in corners on the ground ( from the clubers). Loud vulgar people sitting at the bar across from check in counter ( I had my 4 yr old and wife with me). Drunk people stumbling around here and there. Elevator was filthy, the one that worked out the four had a mixed drink that was spilled across the buttons and allowed to dry which made the buttons very sticky the elevator floor mat was in dire need of a serious cleaning. Entering our room, we immediately noticed water stains on the desk area, loose and shakey faucet, wobbly shower head, dirty carpet, hair in the bathtub lipstick on the wall in the bathroom. Rooms are extremely thin walled you can hear everything that takes place in the next room and you can everything taking place in the hallways. Room service menu was silly. Seriously nothing to eat after 11. Not even a burger. Hotel is non smoking, so when I wanted to smoke I had to wait for the one elevator to navigate 20+ floors to pick me up from the 9th floor to go downstairs and smoke in the filthy courtyard. Discarded beverages, vomit, spilled drinks all over seating areas etc. 2 hours later I made the journey back down to smoke again and nothing had been cleaned although more trash had accumulated. For the price, the hotel was a joke. I definitely would have been better off staying at a holiday inn

Reviews.Title: “Confused by earlier reviews”
Reviews.Author: MiamiDrew
Reviews.Content: Just back from a nice weekend at this hotel immediately following hurricane Isaac. Hotel was fully functioning, with the exception of room service. Due to limited staff, it took about 20 minutes to check in. The front desk, whatever whenever, and bell staff were all very friendly and helpful. My room was clean, spacious and well maintained. The public spaces were gorgeous and the gym rocks! It doesn't have the wow factor associated with newer w's but you will be well taken care of by friendly staff! Don't hesitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - great service”
Reviews.Author: Rich R
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights while in NOLA. Room was OK and comfortable but could use some updating, especially the bathroom with the tiny sink. Water splashes everywhere when you try to use the tiny sink. Food was decent but pricey, service was great in the restaurant. Concierge was very professional, very helpful and was very accommodating in my request to have a last minute document printed. Parking was valet only and was pricey, I guess that's par for the course in the district. I used the public lot across the street which was $29 for 24 hours with in/out ( August 2012). Great location with close proximity to the Riverfront, and streetcar - an easy 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DestinFlCouple
Reviews.Content: The staff was great from the moment we pulled up to valet our vehicles and from when we left the hotel. The rooms could use rennovation, but from what I was told the hotel is going through a product change next year. We had a flat tire and the valet manager was very helpful with helping me find a Firestone down the street that could fix my tire. The Whiskey Blue Bar was great. The drinks were a bit pricey, but not watered down like most places in New Orleans. My Breakfast was a bit cold at Zoe, but they corrected that issue real quick. They also had Bliss Products in the room which was pretty cool. Also the Acura service is great I believe our driver name was Darren. He was cool as hell. The location is great being right across from Harrahs, and mothers for those who like that place. When I come back to New Orleans I will be back at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel; good location ridiculous food prices”
Reviews.Author: doberman32
Reviews.Content: Am from NOLA and have stayed here a couple of times. Room prices are reasonable, and the rooms themselves are pretty good, save for the bathrooms, which are small and need to be updated. Location is convenient, next to casino and a couple of blocks from the French Quarter. Food is decent, but absolutely ridiculously priced--circa 15 dollars for a hamburger is exploitation. Will not stay here again, as there are newer and nicer hotels all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “No insulation between rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite with friends and we were very excited to be in New Orleans. The suites are in the corners of the buildings and are typical W style, sheek, trendy, etc. The problem is you can hear EVERYTHING in the other rooms. Specifically I am talking about room# 1822, do not stay there. I couldn't sleep nights because specifically room 1821 and 1823 had endless people going in and out of it and I can hear everything. And by everything I mean I can hear the music, their conversations, even when they turn the water on for the shower. Seriously?? When I asked about it at the front desk, the responses were "oh yea, those rooms you can hear everything". So why was I put in that room then or that room even available? No offers of changing to another suite, or even room from them. Honestly I expect a W to be a more party type hotel, but that usually stays in the lobby areas / bars. Not up in your suite room. My recommendation: a) Stay at any other hotel, there are many great ones nearby or b) if you must stay at this hotel, do not choose a corner suite, you will hear everything and they will hear you.

Reviews.Title: “Yep, as bad as everyone else says, but...”
Reviews.Author: RobertGrunnah
Reviews.Content: You have to give these guys credit. They're in a market in which hotel rooms average under $100/nt. I'm sure the economics of the business are such that at that rate, you can't afford to clean the hotel frequently, or upgrade it to the typical W Standard. So for that reason, I'd say this hotel was pretty much what I expected when I booked it and read the reviews. Nothing more and nothing less. The cons are many: paper thin walls that I could hear every conversation from neighbors on both sides of me including slamming doors and housekeepers that sung songs (poorly) while cleaning the rooms. Surly parking attendants. Run down appearance (sort of befits New Orleans, though). Impersonalized service. Phones that didn't work (in the room and the hallways). Starwood should probably re-brand this a Sheraton; but alas, like I say, I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, quiet and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamClaire
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the W and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. A special (and unique!) highlight was stepping out of the hotel just as President Obama was driving past!! Very exciting! Back to the hotel - it was lovely to step into the cool reception from the heat outside. Reception is pretty dark (which means it doesn't look like the photos on their website) but it is very modern in its furnishing and the concierges and receptionists were helpful. We had twin double beds on the third floor (I think). The room was a good size (not huge but we didn't intend to spend much time there) and clean with a nice bathroom . The position of the hotel is excellent - very close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite W standard”
Reviews.Author: Nigella78
Reviews.Content: If you get this hotel for a good price, you can consider staying there. But do not expect the same service and standard as you would get in a W normally. The pros: The hotel is in a safe area. We walked to and from the French Quarter by day and night, there are a lot of people walking around, no worries there. And it only takes a few minutes. Many members of staff were very nice, the breakfast was also fine. The cons: One day our room was not cleaned at all, another day no towels, another day a few towels only. When we informed reception, all they could say was sorry. Not helpful at all. We had to cancel a restaurant reservation one day, no towels for our shower and it took a few calls to finally get them. One day we looked for information from "whatever whenever", they gave us a phone number and told us to ring the place ourselves... All we could do was laugh after all that. Hence our advice not to pay big money for this place. One afternoon we were walking pass the bar and lots of take away boxes and glasses were left there from the night before, anybody could have seen it from the street. Cleanliness is obviously an issue, the carpets in the halls and elevators are hoovered...sometimes. Also we could here very clearly the conversation of the people next door. We had to speak low if we did not want them to hear us. So if you are a light sleeper, ask not to be put in an adjoining room. One last thing, the bar area is freezing, bring something to put over your shoulders. So basically, yes you could consider staying there if you get a good deal and lower your expectations. ( By the way, if it is your first stay in New Orleans, like us and you love jazz and blues no doubt you will love it there. There is a lot more to New orleans than Bourbon street. Try Frenchmen street if you want really good music, it is so much better. We loved New Orleans, the people were so friendly and welcoming. They are many beautiful streets. We felt absolutely safe, but of course we did not go to dodgy neighbourhoods. We loved the French quarter, Treme, the Garden District... If you are interested in walking tours, we would recommend Historic New Orleans Tours. Their tours are good value and very interesting. They seem to be a very serious company).

Reviews.Title: “Just doesn't make it!”
Reviews.Author: babypeterblue
Reviews.Content: This hotel definately needs a good cleaning and a makeover. It doesnt even come close to the W in NYC. Lets not even get started on the price of breakfast. 3 adults and 1 child cost $150.00 with the tip, for eggs and toast, are you Joking. Its rowdy, loud and filled with low lifes. I chose this hotel thinking it would reach the standard of the W in NYC, not the case. On a positive note the young women at the front desk was friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, great vibe! But no housekeeping?”
Reviews.Author: Fussy123
Reviews.Content: The W New Orleans is great value for money - not being in the French Quarter it is a bit cheaper, but you are so close to the French Quarter and other attractions it really is not a disadvantage at all. Upon check in we were warmly greeted by Nikki, who was a delight and made us feel welcome. We were give a choice of a high or low floor room. The room itself was great, very big room with a king bed as well as a sofa. Bathroom big enough, not enormous but certainly adequate. Big TV, Mr Coffee with Starbucks coffee and a well stocked mini bar. As we arrived late, our first night we order room service from the extensive menu - po-boys that were fresh and tasty, delived swiftly. The room was clean, but we had issues with housekeeping "missing" us two days running. Both days we arrived back to our room after 5pm or later and our room had not been serviced. We had to call reception to arrange service. We definitely did not leave the DND sign on the door. This was a bit disappointing as after a long day you want to come back and relax a bit before heading out to dinner, having to pop out again while they fix up the room was a bit of a pain. It did give us a chance to have a drink at the lively bar downstairs - great cocktails and friendly service. Location wise, the W is about 5 minutes stroll to the edge of the French Quarter, it is directly over the road from the Shops at Canal Place (Saks Fifth Avenue has tax free shopping for international shoppers - you collect the tax refund at the airport), literally a few steps from the trolley stop and only 5 mins walk to the WW2 Museum. Plenty of dining options in the vicinity, including the famous Mother's Restaurant just 30 seconds away. Aside from the housekeeping thing, we had a good stay at the W and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon ever!!”
Reviews.Author: salina m
Reviews.Content: My newly husband and I had the best experience we ever had at a hotel with the help of Christie T. who is the W insider for the hotel. We walked into a fantastic room that had rose petals, champagne, and chocolates!! We were treated so nice during the entire week we stayed there. We were only supposed to stay for 5 days but decided to stay for 2 more. We are excited to go back every year for our anniversary : ).

Reviews.Title: “Not up to W standards”
Reviews.Author: Wes1535
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of W hotels and have stayed at the W poydras before but this hotel has gone downhill fast. Mind you, it was a while ago we first stayed there but this hotel USED to be a great one. We recently stayed there and the hotel was awful. Our room was dirty.. Dirty bathroom, bathtub, chaise lounge had cigarette burns in it. Floor was dirty. There was also a moldy/smoky smell despite us requesting a non smoking room. We left a message for the general manager and called the front desk. We did not receive a call back. Unfortunately we had booked another night there for future visit (booked both at once) but do not want to go back. Would rather lose our money that we prepaid than return.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service, central location and wonderful amenities!”
Reviews.Author: DebPyeThompson
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE The W!!! This is the only hotel my husband and I stay at when visiting New Orleans. I even introduced my girlfriends to the hotel last month for our Annual Girl's Trip, and they loved it too!!!! We received OUTSTANDING service from everyone we encountered - from the front desk, to housekeeping, Engineering Dept., servers at Zoe, bartenders at the Living Room! And, I definitely can't forget the personalized attention we received from the Manager, Joseph! The complimentary Acura experience was an added bonus! A true WOW experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just average convention hotel not stepping up”
Reviews.Author: globaltravelkid
Reviews.Content: If you want a great location, modern hotel that almost looks new, stay here. If you want great SERVICE and be RECOGNIZED as a traveler, SKIP it. Pool area is quiet but then occasional music BLASTS, then quits. No water at pool available in 100 scorching heat. No phones or service staff, so I dialed front desk from my cellphone and placed an order, which came in the promised 30 minutes in a brown paper bag to go. No plate, silverware, or even plastic glass....my smoothie came without a straw in a styrofoam cup next to the pool which is GREEN. Seriously? The male attendant at 4:10pm was visibly overworked and telling us his shift was over at 4, but threw attitude to guests instead of calling for assistance. "Can I order a wine to go please," I asked. "When I'm ready to take your order after working on these drinks first," was his snap. And then I am PAYING for this? My nemesis treat me this way for free. Checkin was dismal with a five hour wait for my room. Checking in, not one white-shirt clad staff in front greeted me, acknowledged me with eye contact, or even offered to assist w/luggage. Travis the Concierge is the saving grace of the property. For SPG/Starwood/W, this clearly needs some staff training on genuine love and appreciation. No wonder guests aren't returning to New Orleans if this is the hospitality they receive.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-Star”
Reviews.Author: Tracy D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location..The employees are nice..Our room was just big enough for sleep and hitting the streets, but then again that's why we came to New Orleans..My issues were the bathroom had what I think were water stains that were brown on the sink and floor..my coffee pot had old coffee in the cups already when we arrived & the tub drained slowly. I wouldnt really stay there for more than a weekend because the closets are REALLY small & there is no dresser for clothing and really no where to store luggage out of the way..we had to leave them out on the floors and the pool was a bit small for a hotel pool. If you're a decor person, the lobby is really pretty & the furnishings are nice..

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service; Bathroom Issues”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Aside from an extreme amount of noise due to a party in the lobby area of the hotel during check-in of my recent stay, the lobby was nicely appointed. Location was also decent for conference-goers. It was nicely positioned between Bourbon Street festivities and the conference center with a convenience store close by. Also, right next to Mothers if you are a breakfast fan. The room was decent but I did encounter 2 issues: 1. Bathroom: white tile was broken in spots and had hair from previous tenants on it (perhaps from a mop?). Housekeeping didn't appear to want to replace the shampoo/conditioner when they were running low. I had to leave them open and in plain view on the counter when almost empty to get new ones. Even then, they didn't remove the old ones. 2. Service: I used the mini-bar for water and diet coke. It was re-stocked after the first night but not after the next 4 nights - even after reaching out to the front desk twice. The second time I called (5th day of stay), I was instantly placed on hold. I waited for a while and got frustrated so I hung up, went to the convenience store close-by, and got my beverages for the next day. It was cheaper, of course, but I enjoy the benefits of in-room amenities and was disappointing by the lack of attention given to my requests for re-stocking of the mini bar. Also, I was entitled to a free water every day as a Starwood member. I got only 1.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nelsn K
Reviews.Content: I was in NOLA this past weekend and stayed at the W Hotel. The hotel was Holiday Inn before and I had stayed there 12 yrs ago. The hotel had changed to W, but the room is on the small size, but it was clean. The sheets was nicely pressed and the towels was soft. They used Bliss product, which was nice. The hotel was a little run down, but I heard they will be doing renovation soon. The staffs was the best.!!! Everyone was helpful and friendly. We used the Acura program to go locally everyday, and they were pleased to served. They had moved the Harrads casino across the street where it was at the Riverwalk before. Too close for temptation.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: cwgator
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience w/the W from check in to check out. Granted, the rooms aren't aging well, but the bed was comfortable & the ac was nice & cool. What made our stay so great was the customer service. Everyone was very friendly & helpful, especially Danny, the concierge. The Acura experience was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, rooms & location!”
Reviews.Author: CJL1987
Reviews.Content: Have a very enjoyable stay at this hotel! The two ladies at the desk during our check-in were WONDERFUL! They gave us great recommendations, were very friendly and efficient. The room was very nice and very clean! I wish the rooms had balconies, but still very nice without. The hotel is located in a great area where you can walk to Burbon St... without being too close. Only negative was that it took 24 minutes for two smoothies in the breakfast restaurant. The server didn't charge us because we had to wait so long (without us even saying anything) but it would have been nice to not wait so long. Overall a very nice stay and will certainly choose this hotel again when I return.

Reviews.Title: “I now know what the "W" stands for- WTF?!”
Reviews.Author: TiffT
Reviews.Content: I hate to be so crass, but this truly was the worse hotel experience that I've had in YEARS, especially considering I just spent almost $1,000 at this dump. And "dump" is putting in mildly. Sadly, I've never stayed at a W before and this hotel did nothing to make me ever want to try them again. Where do I start.... I checked in to my (king bed) room the day after a large music festival wrapped up, to find a smeared substance on my bench and white spots on the carpet beside the bed and on the chaise lounge. YUCK!!! I called down to the lobby and the staff agreed to move me to another room. Unfortunately, the only available rooms had double beds. Sigh.. But two doubles in a clean room is better than one big king in a nasty one to me, so I took them up on their offer. The W has this "whenever, whatever" motto around customer service. That said, the staff was great. A gentlemen promptly came up with a key to a neighboring room and even proceeded to help me move my items over. Only problem was, that room was gross, too!! I mean, it was certainly better than the "love shack" I just left, but uh... 1. there was toothpaste on the shutter 2. women's foundation smeared on the closet door 3. a half drunken water bottle under the bed 4. black spots on the bathroom floor 5. drip stains all over the bathroom wall 6. lotion on the mirror 7. white stuff on the shower curtain and bed spread (if i had to guess, i'd say it was lotion, as well) 8. a nasty smell of smoke in the air (despite the hotel having a no-smoking policy) 9. drips all over the wood of the bathroom sink 10. and to top it all off, the hotel was booked solid the next day. UGH! I GIVE UP! I was in town for a conference that was starting the next morning and had to get ready for it, so I gritted my teeth and made due, but c'mon... is this the best the W can do?! On top of the obvious cleanliness issues, the wall are like paper. I heard the conversations of the people in the adjoining rooms so well that I could have sworn they were standing in front of me. "Whatever, whenever" may very well describe the level of service you can expect if you dare to stay here, but "Disappointing and disgusting" describe the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: gem21
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to New Orleans and my first stay at a W Hotel. I was here on business and spent the first two days of my stay working with colleagues in a small conference room on the second floor. The small, boutique environment was a welcome change from giant hotel-plexes where I usually stay for business. PROS: * Acura car service was a nice touch and alternative to taking a taxi (I'm a generous tipper, so I probably spent as much as I would have on a cab -- very worth it because the driver was fantastic and the ride very comfortable) * Complimentary coffee on the second floor each morning -- good coffee, too, not the usual awful Nescafe that large hotels often serve * Bliss Spa toiletries in the bathroom * The "zen" courtyard in front with lounge furniture * Friendly and helpful staff ... complimentary bottles of water were often offered! :-) CONS: * Small rooms (but typical for a city property), a bit tired and worn -- as another reviewer remarked, the velvet settee looked a bit unsavory and therefore something I wouldn't want to sit on! * Bathroom sub-par for a hotel of this caliber. While adequately clean, its small size, lighting, and flimsy shower curtain is something I would expect in a Hampton Inn, not a groovy W Hotel. * Lounge music is pleasant at first, but after spending a very long work day late into the evening in the conference room and hearing the loop repeat itself a few times, it got to be a bit much. To be fair, I'm sure we could have called to request it be shut off, but we were too engrossed in our work to do so. My stay was paid for by my company since it was a business trip; I might have rated one star less if I was paying for it myself, depending on the room rate. That said, I would recommend this hotel and would consider staying here if I'm fortunate enough to have the opportunity to return to New Orleans! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Houstonian2011
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Convenient location to Harrahs, the river walk and the French Quarter. Pool is small but nice. Staff is very service oriented. Cold water is always waiting at the door and fresh apples at the counter. Great vibe. Have stayed here many times and never an issue. If you visit New Orleans catch an airboat swamp tour. Vans will pick up at the W. It is a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Pick a different place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: texastravler00
Reviews.Content: I will NEVER RETURN to this OLD, DIRTY, OVER PRICED HOTEL. We pulled in to have our baggage taken and the hotel looked very nice. We walked into the hotel to check in and yet again the hotel looked very nice. The hotel looked very modern/contemporary. I thought I had made a good choice. We exit the elevator and are taken to our room. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT. The room was very old and I donâ€™t mean vintage I mean OLD. They have not made any upgrades whatsovere. The room felt dark very small and DIRTY. I was happy to know that my tea cup Yorkie was able to stay with us and they offered a great menu. We paid the one time pet fee just to be kicked out the next day literally!!!! Without even getting our pet fee back. We booked our room through a third party and somehow, someone, really screwed up but no one was willing to take responsibility. We returned exahusted from the sun from the french quarter just to find security trying to pack our belongings. They did not move a single finger to try to help accomadate us or help find a different room or hotel since we had 2 sepperate rooms booked for consecutive nights. We will never book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok W but not wowed”
Reviews.Author: CalagryJusthelping
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a university conference in April 2012. Got to the hotel and check in was 3 deep. Got into our room quickly. Room was decent but nothing exceptional. Paying for internet was annoying but I know most upscale hotels charge for this. Location is the best part of the hotel. We walked to everywhere we wanted to be. Reasonably safe area. Our room faced the street and the city decided to jack hammer the road below all night. We phoned front desk but was told all they could do was provide ear plugs. Perhaps a different room would have helped!? Anyway overall was a little disappointed as my impression of the W hotels is much higher end. Would probably stay at a different hotel as there are two right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: crazzi1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of fine hotels and resorts, they were all very NICE to me especially when they knew I bookedi with fine hotels and resorts, they gave us 100 off for room service which was nice, and two 80 dollar coupons for breakfast, the problem is I didn't hear them say that you had to USE the coupons because uusally with fine hotels and resorts they just give you the discount at check out. I noticed the coupon after i ordered room service and it said YOU HAVE TO GIVE at time of service, so I lost out on that. They did upgrade us, and did I say they were very nice? It was a typical W hotel, a little dark and nighclubbyish. I can't really reommend this place but if they had a good rate it was kind of cool, I guess I am conflicted

Reviews.Title: “W New Orleans on Poydras”
Reviews.Author: Molly B
Reviews.Content: DO NOT bring children to this hotel. The rooms are too small and the walls are paper thin-- you can hear (ahem) everything next door. And the breakfasts were overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: 400CPW
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for a long weekend with friends and found the hotel to be a mix of postives and negatives. The hotel is located in a fairly convenient location and while not in the French Quarter, it is only a few blocks away and one can easily travel there by foot or pedicab. The area around the hotel is fairly generic and a bit of a yawn, but does have some decent restaurants and easy access to cable cars,shopping and sight-seeing. Perhaps the best attribute is that the location allows you to easily escape the craziness of the French Quarter when needed. A nice touch is free cold water bottles and apples in the lobby. The hotel itself does stay fairly true to the W brand - contemporary and modern, generic, almost a bit dated at this point. No nod to the culture or style of New Orleans - this hotel could be found in any mid-size city in the usa. The lobby is rather small and get crowded when groups are checking in and out. The lobby bar and concerierge desk were also small and lost when more than a handful of people gathered in the lobby. The hotel pool is located on the roof and is slightly larger than a spa tub and the pool deck itself it also very, very small. Very crowded with very limited chairs. People were laying on towels on the hot concrete floor for lack of room and seating options. There was a bar set up the first day, none on any other day. There was also no waiter or attendent. Food orders were placed via a phone on the wall and the food was delivered in paper shopping bags hours later, cold and usually with something missing. The rooms were average and a bit shabby and run down. Scuffed walls, stained carpets, mini-fridge oddly placed in room. One day housekeeping did not show up to the room. Calls to the manager assured us that the room would be cleaned by the time we arrived back from dinner. Didn't happen and we had to wait an additional hour for clean towels. Our friends also had a day when housekeeping did not show up until 5pm. We also had issues in booking the rooms directly with the hotel. The original price quoted and confirmed by email was not honored when we called back to confirm the room. The manage told us they did not know who provided the price quote and therefore did not have to honor it. Many hours of phone time did finally help us get the original price but also became a huge headache. All in all, this is a very generic hotel that could provide an easy, if mediocre, home base for a visit to Nola.

Reviews.Title: “Jekyll and Hyde Stay”
Reviews.Author: BoomBoom1005
Reviews.Content: It was like two different stays. The first half was ordinary - staff was pleasant, room was typical. We had one of their "Wonderful" rooms with a lovely view of the building next door, and while I would have preferred a river view, it wasn't that big of a deal for this stay. All was well for the first two days, and the Acura car for local trips was a very nice touch. Then it all changed... The jackhammers outside started about 2 a.m. (not the hotel's fault, just part of the fun), then the concierge called - and woke us up - to inquire why we were late for our car reservation (it had been the day before). Housekeeping knocked twice, once very loudly and again waking us up and then weren't there when we opened the door, just the cart. Then maintenance knocked (he was told we had checked out). When we we left for the day we stopped at the desk and told them it was okay to let him do whatever repairs were necessary, although we hadn't noticed anything or called about it, and housekeeping could also make up the room. Upon our return late that evening the room had not been cleaned and things had been moved around (I assume maintenance) and not put back. While the front desk found the request in the computer no answer or solution was suggested and I had to ask to have fresh towels, which they finally brought up. Forgot about fresh coffee supplies though - guess that was my fault. On our final morning housekeeping knocked again - again waking us up. Apparently putting the "do not disturb" sign out doesn't really mean anything. It was as if there were two different crews/management working during our stay and was very disappointing for a hotel of this caliber. One final note - the cafe is on the second floor, not on the first like it says on their signs and walls.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GWBland
Reviews.Content: What happened to W? It used to be the cool cousin to the luxury brands like Lowe's or Ritz. The public space felt corporate and like it had been decorated by Restoration Hardware. The room was cramped, dark and the bathroom needed an extreme makeover. I am a member of Starwood's club and admittedly was using points for our stay, but I felt cheated... And it was 'free'!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel adjacent to the Harrahs Casino nearby shopping center, which makes it a great location to visit New Orleans. The hotel was clean and modern and provided good custom service. They provide free vehicle service to take you to your destination with in 5miles. They gave us a semi suite with a great view. The wooden shutters is a nice touch but did not keep the light out as well as curtains. They did not have a restaurant during our stay, but enjoyed the Harrahs for brunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “The most aweful W experience so far in my life! Beware!”
Reviews.Author: SimplyEasyNYC
Reviews.Content: If you want a staff call to your room for an amazingly ridiculas reason at 7:30am saying that you don't have a credit card on file, you should stay there. If you want a room cleaning service *knock knock* at 9:00am when you forget to put the *get out of my way* sign at the door lever, you should stay there. If you want a staff of getting you a cab while he is busy with taking care of guests cars and let you wait, you should stay there. I consider myself as a pretty easy guy and typically don't complain when situation is not that bad. BUT once again - If you want your credit card being charged for almost $200 for internet service while I choose to have complimentary internet as a SPG gold member offer, you should ABSOLUTELY stay there. Basically this hotel's staffs are lack of professional training and the hotel itself is not so well mantained. The good thing is the occupancy is not high so that it's easy to get a high floor room per your request. That way you can avoid hearing the music from the lower level. The pool is small but very descent. To go staying at the pool without any oarty groups is the best thing there. Take whatever chair you want or even a cabana without any charge is another thing we enjoy since you don't see any staff working there. Finally, if you already booked your stay there and planned to keep your reservation, GOOD LUCK!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is way overrated!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole0102
Reviews.Content: The lobby is nice, the rooms are small, very humid and stale feeling. The A/C would not cool, didn't get below 73 degrees. There is dust on everything and rust on everything in the bathroom. The plumbing is awful, very little water presdure, leaky faucet, outdated tub/faucets. Paper thin walls, and horrible feather pillows. Have always wanted to stay here, will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else”
Reviews.Author: NYC102005
Reviews.Content: House keeping standards for rooms and hallways were poor, walls were paper thin (I thought the wake up call from next door was mine and I could hear the conversations from adjacent rooms). The furniture in the room seemed to be just old furniture painted black. I had a corner room and the windows were high up so room was dark....bathroom was extremely smalll. The lobby was nice and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “W should upgrade this property”
Reviews.Author: Nick S
Reviews.Content: Had points and a dog so this ended up home for a few days. My wife and I went away for a vacation and decided the W's had been great in the past. We use the one in DC for the spa very often as well as others. The staff and lobby are both great, but the level of quality stops there. The room on the 23rd floor was rusty, paint peeling, fridge looked like a hot mess behind the cooler, and the internet is SUPER expensive. The room quality literally was worse than most lower-Tier hotels we stay in. We had to request they clean our room and provide supplies and the quality of the housekeeping left lots to be desired. Its not RIGHT ON the French Quarter (expected for us, but others seemed surprised), but its near the river walk and warehouse district. I'd say stay here if you got a dog and a helluva good deal on the rate. Other wise there are so many nicer places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a nice escape.”
Reviews.Author: Richard Z
Reviews.Content: Let's face it: New Orleans is HOT (in every sense). W Hotels are consistently nicely designed, and pleasing to look at/reside in. This hotel is no exception. The main downside (which might not be THAT down for you) is that it's not SUPER close to the French Quarter. The FQ is a few blocks away, as opposed to the Marriott, which is right off Canal at the entrance. But, if you want to get away from the debauchery, and just run to a clean, sharp hotel, this is a good choice. A Major pro for this place is that it is next to two important New Orleans landmarks: (1) Mother's Restaurant, arguably one of the best local-favored places to eat in/near the FQ. It's excellent, and across the street. Also (2) on the OTHER side of the hotel is Harrah's Casino. Even if you're just wanting to play penny slots, the place is air-conditioned to EXTREME comfort. Or, just cut through the city-block-sized casino to get to the FQ, and enjoy the coolness.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: TJWolf
Reviews.Content: Booked through the "Fine Hotels and Resorts" program. This hotel should not be a part of that program. Small rooms, not very clean. Front desk that doesn't offer benefits that were available from the FHR program. Called room service, could barely hear her with all the loud background noise. In room movie doesn't work. Food in the Zoe Restaurant was ok, not great. Not impressed. Won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: LoveTaxidia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W while in New Orleans on business travel. It is conveniently located to the French Quarter, Harrah's casino and the Business District - but it is just far enough away that you should use your common sense if you plan to walk around by yourself. If you are a Starwood member, the W offers a car service for drop-offs within the area that sounded great, although you do need to book it ahead of time and during business hours. Rooms were pretty standard and a great rate given the price of other W properties. Bathroom seemed clean but not spotless. I agree with the other comments that housekeeping didn't seem to replenish everything and did the bare minimum cleaning. One huge pet peeve of mine as a frequent (and female) business traveler is the embarrassingly old and ridiculously weak hair-dryer they had in the bathroom - which died after a few minutes of use. I would not recommend this hotel for families but it is a good option if you are traveling to New Orleans for business or fun. I did not eat here or go to the bar but there were always people milling around and looked like a great place for a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, house cleaning was lacking”
Reviews.Author: awesometraveling
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during Easter Break (April 4-9). I loved the lobby and the overall hotel decor. I didn't enjoy the couch in my room and wish it wasn't there. It was made out of a velvet material that looked used and abused over the years. I found that my sink was dirty upon arrival, there was dirt spots in some areas of the room and my tv converter had guck on it. I thought this was a shame since I could tell the I enjoyed the gym facilities and found the staff hospitable, friendly and helpful. It was a good location in this city in my opinion. I think they shouldn't charge for wifi and just provide free wifi access to hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: BKW_LA
Reviews.Content: The room was clean enough, however the shower water pressure kept vacillating from strong to minimal water which was annoying while in the shower. The housekeeper did not replenish all items when the room was supposed to be cleaned. If you go on a holiday weekend, just be aware that it is a party hotel and you may not be able to sleep. The guests were loud throughout most of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping needs some work”
Reviews.Author: bella160
Reviews.Content: We checked into the W New Orleans late Friday night of Memorial Day weekend. I was aware that the rooms would be on the smaller side, but was a little disappointed that there was virtually no walking room. We had three girls in one room and another two in an adjoining room. The three of us that were in the double room had very limited space. When we tried to open the door that connected the two rooms, we realized it was painted shut--engineering came to the rescue. While the beds were very comfortable, the mattresses kept sliding off the beds. The main reason for my low score was housekeeping--she barely did anything to clean the rooms. She left all of the used shampoo, body wash and conditioner bottles in the bathtub, didn't take the dirty wash clothes from the shower, didn't change the sheets are do any organizing around the room. Having stayed in Starwood properties all over the world, this was definitely the worst housekeeping job I've encountered. Other than that, the staff at the front desk and bell desk were lovely. The pool was VERY small and there is hardly any seating. Most of the equipment in the gym was broken, the water cooler was out of water on a 100 plus degree day. I stayed at the hotel because I'm a loyal Starwood member, but I think during my next stay I'll have to try the Ritz or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located downtown with a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TsteveT
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is conveniently located downtown and the staff was super friendly. The casino and club is right across the street. The amenities such as the pool and gym was really nice, one of the bigger ones I've seen in NOLA hotels. Also, for those who like to go running in the morning, the hotel is nice enough to provide water bottles near the valet services. all in all great staff and hotel. Thanks to the concierges for making the say a wonderful experience. The only tip is to have your room not facing the casino/waterfront because at night before midnight, a train comes through and you may hear it if you are a light sleeper. Other than the first, night, I was not in my room to hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Phillygirl3140
Reviews.Content: I'm not accustomed to W hotels, so I'm not sure if some of the reviewers are right about this not being up to par, but as someone who enjoys luxury hotels, I had no complaints. The hotel is obviously not brand-new, but my room was gorgeous, the bathroom spacious and beautiful, love the ipod dock and the Bliss products. Spent a few hours at the pool on a Sunday morning and basically had it all to myself. The walls are on the thin side - during the afternoon I heard people chatting if they were standing right at the wall - but the bed was incredibly comfortable and I had a great night's sleep. Wish I could have stayed longer, and plan to return on my next Nola trip.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel New Orleans rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Bill G
Reviews.Content: We typically stay at W Hotels regardless of where we travel, but the Poydras Street W well exceeded all expectations. From the Bell Captains (Lawrence, Kevin & Tony) to both the Consierges to the Welcome Desk Manager (Joseph), everyone totally makes you feel at home! The gym has great excercise equipment including a hanging bag. And the pool/cabana's rocks! Love the sheek, sexy vibe. We've already scheduled to return to this property in July AND Sept! Bill

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jillbozz
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Loved the poolside cabanas. Room was comped so excellent value. Great location. Walk to quarter, trolley stop steps away and casino across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wow for W!”
Reviews.Author: DivaNorthernVirginia
Reviews.Content: My first visit to the big Easy and I am so glad i chose to stay at the Whatever Whenever "W" Hotel in New Orleans. From arrival to departure eveyone I encountered was professional and extremely pleasant. From Paul giving me and my associates the Acura Experience to Danny who printed my boarding passes, I was impressed. though the font desk is super busy alot, the concierge and bellman are on the ball to pick up all requests. I would definatlley recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Chic Hotel near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: coloradobetta
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in May 2012. Hotel lobby, registration, and bars were funky, modern and sleek. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and had a great view of the Mississippi River. The hotel is located within a few blocks of the warehouse district, two malls and the French Quarter. The gym (cleverly called Sweat) has tons of equipment and looks out at the roof-top pool. Each treadmill has a TV built in it, so bring your earbuds!

Reviews.Title: “3d time staying here”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: I extended my last trip and spent the last night at the W New Orleans. Always first rate with a friendly and helpful staff; big, quiet rooms and a central location. It was midweek so not too packed at the pool or the bars/restaurants which is what I was looking for. Walked through on the prior Saturday night though and the whole place was a bit of a scene but not too bad (supposedly Leo DeCaprio was at the lounge with friends, but I stayed at the lobby bar). Fitness room is good and overlooks the pool and it is overall just a very relaxing place in what can be a crazy place. Will definitely return !

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Donna M
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, with an awesome lobby and sitting areas. Very friendly staff. Great valet staff Kevin, Tony & Paul very friendly and knowlegeable. Great location. We had a great time and will be back. Thanks, Terry & Donna Motes May 2012

Reviews.Title: “Trendy years ago”
Reviews.Author: Cali1728
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at quite a few W hotels and this one seems to have seen better days. We were upgraded to a suite with AMEX Platinum - it had a great view but the bathroom was horrible. It had a jacuuzzi tub in it that looked like it was from the 80's. Shower wasn't clean and toilet had smell to it. Food and drinks were mediocre. Nice location since its out of the French Quarter. Dissppointed no begniets on their menu! Car service was nice but it doesn't pick you up and we had to take a $40 cab back to the hotel from the garden district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Even Better Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sandy M
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the W for a couple of nights because the other hotels Harrahs uses were booked because of the Jazz fest. We had stayed at other hotels in the area and were not quite sure what to expect with the W. As it turns out we were quite impressed with the look and feel of the hotel. We loved the decor and layout of the place. But the highlight for me was the staff. They were especially friendly, attentive, helpful, and professional. Special thanks to Toni, the manager on duty and the supporting staff members, Haywood - a great greeter and all around "go to" guy, as well as Jimmy Ramirez, Arrian Chapman, Paul R., and Tony D. They made our stay most enjoyable and handled any little request we made. We had a few glitches with the room (no shower curtain) and no King size bed available. But we did arrived at 3am. We were greeted by the most pleasant and helpful folks you could want to find anywhere. We found the food prices at the restaurant to be a bit high but the food was good. We would recommend the hotel to friends and family. And would certainly stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “My Home Away From Home In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: allblues2003
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel on Poydras St. is my favorite place to stay when I visit New Orleans. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable, with bath amenities by Bliss Spa and the most comfortable bed I have slept in, except for my own. The lobby is both inspiring and relaxing at the same time. There are many public areas in which to relax on the main level along with the Whiskey Blue bar, which is the most beautiful bar I have ever seen! At night, the room is lit by candlelight that creates a soothing atmosphere. The Fitness Studio is one of the largest and best equipped that I have seen at a hotel. It receives abundant natural light and is kept very clean. The Fitness Studio is located on the same level as the outdoor pool, which is situated on a landscaped and lovely upper level of the hotel. The pool is great for relaxation and is heated on chilly days, but is so wonderful to get into for a refreshing dip after a day of exploring the charms of New Orleans. The pool is complemented with an array of new, comfortable lounging furniture that is perfect for sunning, napping, reading or catching up on email. The sun deck area also boasts 4 private cabanas that are outfitted with cable TV. If you get hungry or thirsty while in this area, food and beverages may be ordered from Room Service. The lobby has unique and artistic fresh flower arrangements that are changed frequently. The front of the hotel has a lovely, private bamboo garden equipped with couches. Unfortunately, on my most recent visit, I noticed that some of the guests have taken to defacing these beautiful plants with their initials. Coffee on the second floor in the A.M. is complementary to guests. The restaurant is also on the second floor and offers excellent choices for all three meals and great service. Room service is fast and reasonably priced. The offerings are all quite delicious. As this hotel is pet-friendly, the menu even features dinner and treats for Fido or Fifi! The laundry service at this hotel is also excellent. My clothing was returned when promised and it was as clean as if Mom had done it for me. It also was the same size, too - no shrinking! The staff at The W Hotel on Poydras Street is wonderful! They are courteous, informed, helpful, and professional. I have stayed at this hotel for several years and the staff always remembers my name. The front desk is efficient and quickly checks you in. The concierge desk is helpful in all aspects of their duty. The Room Stylists provide excellent service. The Valet service is always on the ball. I especially want to thank Mr. Lawrence L., Mr. Paul R., and Tony (?) for their excellent service and their courtesy. The employees at The W New Orleans are what really put this place over the top! Thank you all for a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me”
Reviews.Author: TMC408
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for a convention and our company chose to stay at the W. I don't have experience with this brand so don't have specific expectations. My room was clean, nice bedspreads and sheets, wall-mounted flatscreen tv, good wired and wireless internet service. I like the "go green" option to opt out of daily room cleaning so my man-cave would be just like I left it. PaulR, the driver who would take us almost anywhere, was great. Knows the city and his way around it, and gives great service with a smile. Saved a lot on taxis with Paul! Great service. Only bad was the slow breakfast service our first day. Wish there was a continental breakfast so I could serve myself rather than waiting so long. Other days we just opted for breakfast at other places.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: guyledouche
Reviews.Content: After hearing great reviews of this hotel from friends, I decided to check it out while attending a convention in New Orleans. The lobby looks great and modern. The rest (specially the rooms and aisles) looks very tired and run down. For a brand that markets itself as being hip and modern, this hotel was really disappointing. You still get a great sleep in a very confortable bed in a clean hotel, but you can get that in cheaper and newer hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you don't look too close”
Reviews.Author: ktattai
Reviews.Content: Overall nice hotel. Great lobby. Across the street from Harrahs and 5 minutes from French Quarter. The pool is small but nice. I've had the same complaint about the 4 W's I've stayed in...very trendy and modern but looks a little run down if you look closely (discoloration on walls, stains on carpet, bathroom tub/sink faucets not working perfectly). The hotel doesn't look outdated but it looks run down. Reminds me of a Drunk Model (pretty but rough around the edges).

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull concierge service”
Reviews.Author: neurologista
Reviews.Content: the hotel is good, but the concierge service is outstanding; very helpfull, always happy to assist you, really something to notice! And for a place like New Orleans, full of options on dining and music, that is an important matter!

Reviews.Title: “It is pretty sad.”
Reviews.Author: dostrovs
Reviews.Content: Good location. Smily staff. Unpleasant rooms. Dirty. Poor maintains. Felt very uncomfortable there. So would not stay again and would not recommend to others. The first room I was given, as an upgrade for a gold starwood preferred member, was facing the wall!!! I could not believe that it is an upgraded room!

Reviews.Title: “Overall an average stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Lavonne S
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel is the staff (Kevin,Tony, and Lawrence - the bellhops; Travis - the concierge), the location in proximity to major New Orleans activities (the hotel is directly across the street from Harrah's Casino and not far from the French Quarter), and the trendy lobby. Otherwise, this hotel is overpriced. I came to town for a conference and specifically chose the W because as a brand, these hotels are known to be upscale and trendy. The lobby is party central for the 20-30's crowd on Friday and Saturday nights - if you're into that sort of thing. The staff are extremely friendly and knowlegeable about the city and were immensely helpful to me during my stay. The negatives: It was irritating that a hotel of this price-point would apply a daily charge for wi-fi! Please know that you will be able to obtain wi-fi for free, only on the 1st and 2nd floors for 30 minutes daily, otherwise be charged 15/day. If you're thinking you're going to get a room as nice as the lobby - you are sadly mistaken. Unfortunately, what I found was a poorly renovated hotel room with sub-par beds. If you come to New Orleans to party and don't plan on spending much time in your room - stay here. Otherwise, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travel43_11
Reviews.Content: LIke most recent reviewers, I had a very negative and very similar experience at the W. We were so excited to stay at a W - we travel quite a bit but have never actually stayed at a W and I convinced our group of 5 to try one this time. We got a great rate through AAA that included breakfast and assumed it was some type of breakfast buffet or continental breakfast. When we checked in and inquired about the breakfast, we were told to eat in the restaurant and order whatever we wanted and it would be removed from the bill. Sounded a little too good to be true so, we inquired at the restaurant as well and were told the same thing. So, we ordered a regular breakfast - we weren't greedy - oatmeal and fruit or the egg plate - one item each. The food was so expensive that it came out to about $55 per couple (or room) per day. When we checked out, I noticed the breakfasts were on our bill. When I questioned the man at the front desk, he was incredibly rude and told me that we were only entitled to a $45 credit. I explained that we were not told this in advance and he removed the charges. But, the one from that morning had not shown up yet. He promised to remove the charge and email me the bill. I never received an email. I called and they finally sent an email but the final breakfast was still not removed. I called 3 times before it was cleared up. Very poor service. On top of that, the walls were paper thin. Not only could I hear everything going on in the rooms around me, but I could hear everything outside - and we were 10 floors up. We could hear people on the street just having normal conversations. Housekeeping was atrocious and non-existent. I asked for foam pillows instead of the feather ones. We came home to change for dinner and someone had come into my room and moved my feather pillow over to the lounging chair. And then left. They put no new pillows on the bed - just moved my current ones. Huh? So, I explained at the front desk and was told it would be done right away. When we came home later that night, no new pillows but a message on the phone asking if we got our pillows. I said no and they were finally brought up. We had to ask for our room to be cleaned 3 times. And when it was finally done, housekeeping had not left new toilet paper, bath products or towels. They folded our dirty towels and left them - and the coffee maker had leaked and we had used the towels to clean it up so they left filthy towels. The phone next to the bed didn't work and neither did the Ipod player. There were a couple of bright spots - the common areas - lobby, restaurant, etc - were very nice. Modern and sleek. When we checked in, the front desk woman was very nice (but when we checked out, the man at the front desk was extremely rude - and I swear his name tag said he was a manager). The poor woman in the restaurant was overworked but great. She really tried and was polite and helpful. I believe her name was Annie. We were also very impressed with the concierge, Danny. He was helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. He was really the only bright spot in our stay. I truly could not recommend that anyone stay here. Again, we are well traveled and have very reasonable expectations - we often stay in 2 or 3 star hotels so we really don't expect too much - but toilet paper and clean towels are high on the list!!!

Reviews.Title: “Party Time all the Time!”
Reviews.Author: TheGlamorousLife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Essence Music Festival for one night because we came in town earlier than planned. This was truly a party central location during that time. If you want to go the fun parties and rub elbows with the chic & hip who's who this is the place to stay. It reminded us of an upscale Frat House. Though I've had dinner here during while in town during none festival times and it seemed to be very nice, quiet and upscale. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Really cool but not what I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: norajay
Reviews.Content: I am sorry that my first W experience had to be this one. For years I've wanted to stay at a W but when I travel with friends, we can't afford it, and when I travel with my mother, she prefers more traditional hotels. So after a lot of effort, I convinced my mother to stay at the W for a week during a congress that she was attending. Lobby The area is called Living Room and I loved it. With its cool design and awesome music (nothing mainstream) it was an awesome place to hang out. (As much as I loved the music, my mother hated it and thought it was too loud). This is the only place in the hotel here you can get free wifi (I hate that) and it is only for 30 mins. After that, you get logged out and have to start over. Whiskey bar At weekend nights this is a popular place, and all the cool music that I liked gets replaced by annoying dance hits. Rooms We were staying on the 10th floor. The room had a typical hotel size with a spatious sitting area and a soffa. Don't know why people complain about the sizes. I really liked the dark walls and the purple details, my mother hated it. The room comes with a coffe maker (Starbucks coffe), dvd-player and an Iphone dock with speaker. I loved that last part but was disappointed to find out that the speaker was blown out and you could barely hear any sound. The bed was nice but I hate it when I check in a hotel with what obviously is my mother, only to be placed in a room with a king sized bed. I loved the Bliss amenities in the bathroom. Unfortunatelly the rooms have paperthin walls and you can hear everything going on at the neighbours and the hallway. On top of that, the room was overlooking Poydras street and you could hear sirens all the time. One night, the city of New Orleans decided to re-do the asfalt on the street at 12 am!! Housekeeping If they come, the room gets cleaned. The first day we returned to our room at about 6:30 p.m. and found the room undone. We called and were told that it would be fixed right away. 30 minutes later nothing had happened so I went to speak with the reception desk and they said they would send someone right away. Some time later the receptionist called me and said that we were part of some green points program which meant that we get preferred guest points if we don't get the room cleaned daily. My mother had become a Starwood Preferred guest at the check in but nobody had explained the meaning of the points. I explaned that there was a missundertanding and we would never opt for such a deal. At this point what really pissed me off was that, instead of appologizing and fixing the problem right away, 2 receptionists started explaining in a quite unfriendly way that this was all our fault. It seem like they were trained to never admit a fault. Their attitude was very superior and treated you like you were stupid just because you didn't know their chains weird rules and service names. I imagine I must have looked like a mess after spending the day riding an airboat but a hotel receptioninist at a luxery hotel should never treat a guest that way. I remember a couple of years ago, when we stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in NYC, at check in the manager wanted to see if our room was OK. To appologize for the 10 minute wait, they gave us two 20USD vouchers for drinks at the lobby bar. There ware no appologies or anything at the W. Eventually the room got cleaned, we got rid of the green points program and were promised that from now on, we would get daily cleaning. Imagine the joy the next day, when we returned to the room in the late afternoon, only to find it unclean. A call to housekeeping - and the green points issue comes up again!!! They finally sent someone and remembered to come every day for the remainder of our stay. I wish that I could say that it worked smoothly for the rest of the days, but I can't. They would forget to restock on bathroom amenities, sometimes we would get only one bath robe, sometimes none. I had to call them once a day to remind them of things they had forgotten to bring. Also, on the first day, the only bath robe in the room had coffe stains on it... Pool It is very small, with a few sun beds. In the morning you can get a place easly. In the afternoon, it is almost impossible. At about 4 p.m., the sun gets hidden behind a really tall skyscraper and from then on, there is only shade in the pool area. You should forget all tanning. The pool is also full with lovebugs and other drowned insects. Other services In the morning you can get free coffe on the second floor. By the valet parking, you can pick up small bottles with cold water. The complimentary Acura drive is really nice, they will take you anywhere in a 6 miles radious, as long as you book in advance. We used the car twice. The first time we got a driver that told is interesting facts about the local area. He was great. The second time we got a another guy who was most interested to drive the next clients in line, who he had met the day before. They were 2 american women that would not shut up and we ended up sharing the car with them, driving them to their destination first. The WiFi is outragiously expensive. For a hotel that pretends to be trendy and modern, free WiFi in all areas must be a given. Over all, this hotel should not be a part of the W family and is extremely overpriced for the service provided. For the same price you can get much better hotels in New Orleans. Here you are paying for a brand but the hotel does not live up to the standard. This would not keep me from staying at a W, but I don't think I will be able to convice my mother to do it. To finish - the remainder of the hotel staff was really friendly. There was only the issue with those 2 receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “Such a huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: SanFranLeah
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying I've always been a big fan of W hotels. Perhaps that's why this experience was so disappointing. I noticed huge problems, both with facilities and with the staff. The first night of the stay, the room was so horribly filled with smoke that we had to switch rooms. The sink in the first room was broken (i.e. unusable). The shower in the second room we moved to had such awful water pressure that it barely functioned. Overall, it felt like money had been spent on the public areas of the hotel, but the rooms were in desperate need of renovation. A 24 hour gym is nice but 3 of 5 treadmills were broken. Housekeeping didn't bother to clear room service dishes or replenish the soft drinks and waters in our minibar. The room felt dingy. The front desk staff was probably the biggest staffing problem. I interacted with around 5 different people and didn't see any of them smile. We stopped at the desk last night to ask which direction we should head to get to Morton's for dinner. We were literally greeted with an annoyed, "Yeah?" It was unreal. The ONE bright spot in our stay was Paul R., who drove the Acura car service shuttle that the hotel is promoting. I got the sense that he works for the W, not for Acura, so I feel compelled to note here for any management reading this review that Paul was absolutely great. Helpful, friendly, gave great suggestions for dining, was always ready on time... he was the one person who made us feel welcome and was a huge contrast to the rest of the staff. He needs to be promoted to something with more customer interaction/service (the hotel desperately needs him). I will wrap up this review by noting that I travel often (flew almost 100,000 miles last year) and stay in hotels several times a month, so I assure you that I have realistic standards and expectations for hotels at every level of service. This is probably the worst hotel experience I've had in the past 2 years. Unless management dramatically improves their customer service and their facilities, I'd advise others to avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Seems like there are consistent housekeeping issues at the W”
Reviews.Author: wks
Reviews.Content: We requested and early check in and a corner room (an upgrade) was ready. The check-in staff was very helpful as was the concierge. The room had adequate space, as I have found with other W's their is always something stange about the room, this one there were no towel racks in the bathroom. Notable was the somewhat unfinished appearance of the housekeeping. We opted to have our room cleaned. The 1st day we left the room late about 11:30 and I told the housekeeper we were leaving. When we returned at 5 the room was not made up. we told them to forget it and bring some towels. The next day an attempt was made to clean the room, but the dirty glasses remained, no new coffee cups were supplied only some towels were replaced. The room did not reflect any proper maintenance. Lastly the fitness room has great equipment, but they neglected to check for cleaning supplies and hand hygiene products. The container with wipes was empty and there was no hand cleaning supplies in one container and the other was almost empty. Clearly no on had check these items during the day. I have written a complaint and expect to be compendated with points. This was a cash and points reservation so at least I wasn't paying over $200 for this service.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Mboj
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and out 2 children stayed at this hotel the day before our cruise. We arrived early (at about 11:00) and our room was ready. That was great, i thought that we were going to have to leave our bags and not be able to check in that early. The room was very nice but a little on the small side. The bathroom needed some updating. The handle in the shower that turns the water on and off fell off. I had no problem sleeping but my husband said it was pretty loud. The location was great. Easily walked everywhere. The French quarter, Bourbon street, the aquarium and was also very close tothe cruise port. The concierge was helpful and friendly and they drove us to the cruise port for no charge. when we go back to New Orleans (without kids) I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...watch out for paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: RunnerJac
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, I commend the concierge staff; Kevin was particularly helpful and alerted me to the French Quarter Music Festival (which I had no idea it was going on). The location is great; close enough to the French Quarter but not in the heart of the craziness! The rooms were small but nicely decorated and contained a coffee maker (which many of the W hotels don't). The pool area looked nice and the gym was well appointed with strengthening and cardio equipment. All was going well until the noisy guys in room 2005 returned from the bar at 3am, pumped up the music and proceeded to digest their night; the problem is the walls between rooms 2004 and 2005 are paper thin and I could hear everything. For the first time in all my travels, I moved rooms at 3.30am since in spite of security chapping on their door, they continued 5 minutes later. Kudos to the staff for moving me to another room - unfortunately, I had to pack up (couldn't quite understand why I couldn't leave my items there until the morning and then move them since I don't imagine the cleaning staff were going to clean the room at 3.30am). The room they moved me to was meant to be a non smoking room but it was clear someone had been smoking (a lot). I should have requested a different room but was too tired and ended up with a sore throat/cough from breathing in the smoke fumes (also having to wash out my entire laundry since my clothes have picked up the smoke). Overall, an average experience marred by noisy neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love and Love. Did I say Love?”
Reviews.Author: MsSmall
Reviews.Content: I love New Orleans and have stayed at the Intercontinental, Ritz and Westin but this W Hotel takes the cake. It's a short walk to Bourbon Street but luckily far enough from the craziness and grime that you're actually thankful for the option. The hotel is definitely an oasis...from the minute you walk in the door you feel like you've stepped into a chic, hip world so different from it's surroundings. Amazing front desk staff, customer service and rooms! They even offer free transportation in a $50k Acura within 6 miles. Truly a W at it's best. PERFECT for couples. I'll never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: harvey j
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just a couple of blocks from the french quarter and the river as well as the downtown business district. The staff is of the highest quality and all of them strive to supply your every need quickly and professionally. The rooms are nice and the amenities very nice. However, this property is aging and the bathrooms and some other areas are in need of renovation and updating. The bathrooms are very small and the fawcet in my bathtub dripped the entire stay. A renovation of the bathrooms and plumbing is all it would take to make this hotel a 5 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality, W style”
Reviews.Author: jhatax
Reviews.Content: This is one of the top 3 W properties I have stayed at. All the Ws are great, but this one stands out because of the staff's friendliness and genuine desire to make your stay memorable. Brian and Christie - the W insiders at this property - reached out to me prior to my arrival, and exceeded my expectations with the way my room was setup. Their recommendations for things to do were on-point, and they directed us to gems off the beaten path. The staff at Zoe, the restaurant at this W, helped me concoct vegetarian versions of dishes features on the menu. The food was reasonably priced (by hotel standards), and the service was exceptional. Location-wise, the hotel is slightly off Canal street, which shields you from the hustle-bustle, yet not far enough to detract you from getting a true New Orleans experience. If I am to return to New Orleans, the choice of hotel will not be one I lose sleep over!

Reviews.Title: “NOLA Motorsports and NO Hornets game”
Reviews.Author: Christopher R
Reviews.Content: I was in town to perform a demo at the NOLA Motorsports Complex and a New Orleans Hornets game. I was in town for days and stayed at the NO W for the duration of our trip. The Valet was very quick and precise, never having to wait for our vehicle. Everyone at the front desk was very helpful and the manager took time to help us straighten out a couple of booking issues with our room. The room was more than to be expected and all of the staff were very courteous and helpful. Overall I would say some of the best service I have had in a hotel in a long time. I would highly recommend staying here and will absolutely be staying here on my return trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tidy”
Reviews.Author: Tom P
Reviews.Content: Check in was a little bit slow, but hotel was very busy for Conference (which I was attending). Staff were very helpful. Hotel is in a good location, a 5 minute walk from bourbon street. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not really up to "W" standards, but discount more than compensated”
Reviews.Author: uursw
Reviews.Content: Lows: Typical OVERPRICED W Bar, Small Rooms Highs: Location. Close to French Quarter but much quieter than hotels on Canal. Special discount for our group due to ongoing renovations. Overall, a pleasant stay. I wasn't in my room most of the day to be bothered by the renovations. Was here for a conference and they did a good job accommodating us. Beds were fairly comfortable, other than a wandering bed pad on one of the beds. Warning, though: they use Bliss Products, which I (and my skin) do not like, as they give me rashes and I also dislike smelling like a lemon drop afterwards. Fortunately I brought my own products this time so set their products aside.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sam A
Reviews.Content: As a platinum member who travels a lot, I always pay close attention to the amount of oversight and effort the staff puts into my stays at their respective properties. I have always been happy with the way I've been treated at this location. Late checkout is always cheerfully granted, the platinum amenities are great, the room I've booked has always been upgraded, the valet service is unbelievably fast considering the large volume they have to deal with, and the location of this hotel is unbelievably convenient. There are a vast number of hotels in this area, but each time I've had to book a room, I've always looked to the W first. The last time I stayed there, we were celebrating a special occasion, and everything from check-in to the drink service at Whiskey Blue was top notch. The room we got was a huge suite with a separate living area on a floor with beautiful views of the Mississippi River and the downtown area. I'll definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday get away”
Reviews.Author: JacQulineT
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say that I really did enjoy my stay this weekend (March 23-25). The staff was amazing! I was able to check in extremely early! Out of all the hotels I have stayed in, this hotel was beyond my expectations! I can't wait to come back to the city, and yet alone stay at your hotel again! Once aging this was the BEST birthday I had! Sincerely an extreme happy customer, JacQuline Turner

Reviews.Title: “Great concierge”
Reviews.Author: d f
Reviews.Content: We had the distinct pleasure of having Danny Alford as our concierge during our stay at the W hotel in New Orleans (Poydras St) during March, 2012. Danny had all the information I needed at the tip of his tongue and with a few quick strokes on his computer he provided necessary printed material. He was well informed, efficient, friendly, courteous, impeccably groomed and dressed and a complete sweetheart. Most importantly, he won the heart of my dog Jolie. He treated her as though she were his own beloved pet. He gave her plenty of love, attention and far too many treats; a puppyâ€™s idea of utopia. I hope that I encounter Danny during my next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a duo doing New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ptgt20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, right next to Harrah's Casino and a short ten minute walk from Bourbon Street. The rooms are fine sizes, although our room had an odd smell to it. Our shower also dripped, and the handle was loose. You expect these small details to be executed better at the W. Also, the pool was awesome looking, but the ground got incredibly hot. You'd thnk they'd be able to find a surface that held heat better. Overall, this is a good hotel in a good location, opening right up to some of the best restaurants in NOLA. Whiskey Blue was empty during the day, but at night, it was the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans at the W”
Reviews.Author: 170Laura
Reviews.Content: We visited your hotel 3/16-3/18/12. Customer service was great. Especially Tony, who handled our bags and arranged for a ride. He was proactive, friendly, and helpful. Great representative of your company!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa B
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, the condition of the rooms is a bit disappointing. The common areas (lobby, pool area, restaraunts) are well appointed, however the rooms are definitely past due for a renovation and are not up to par with other W properties. The staff is the true shining spot here. You will be treated warmly by professional staff that are more than willing to make your stay enjoyable. Travis and Paul are two staff members who stand out as always being helpful and going up and beyond to make my group feel at home in New Orleans! They truly helped make this one of the best New Orleans trip I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the service”
Reviews.Author: cxworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: As others have pointed out, there seem to be some negative reviews here. I did read them before I left and was prepared for the worse. The worse never happened. I felt I was treated well, not over the top but I prefer it that way. The room was nice and had everything I needed.
