I choose the 'green' option (extra starpoints) and never felt I needed anything else. Location is good if you want to be outside the 'action'. Quick walk to anywhere you want to be. I dont plan to return to New Orleans but If I did the W would be high on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing - Not up to "W Standards"”
Reviews.Author: LexBeach
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of most W hotels. However, this hotel was not even close to the standard I expect from a W. I was initially given a room on the 15th floor, and it had a very strong, toxic paint odor. I called the front desk and informed them of this. The guy who answered wasn't helpful and said that the area had not been painted recently and that the hotel was "fully commited" (i.e., booked). I then asked if all guests had actually checked in and noted that the scent was toxic and strong. At this point he went to talk to a manager. When he came back, he stated that perhaps a previous guest caused damaged to the room that necessitated painting. (Also note that this room appeared to be missing a sofa or lounge chair because there was a large empty space where you would expect a sofa.) He then offered a room on the 7th floor. The 7th floor room smelled like cigarette smoke. However, I didn't complain since it was a better alternative than toxic paint fumes and I didn't want to deal with the front desk person that was reluctant to help. A bit later I spoke with another front desk person (a much friendlier person ) on a separate matter, but I asked if our room on the 7th floor was a smoking room. She informed me that the whole building was non-smoking and offered to move me. Since we were only staying there one night, I declined, opting not to continue running around the hotel for a suitable room. Later my husband noted a cigarette burn on the chaise lounge in the room. I am attaching a picture of it. With all the options in New Orleans, I would suggest finding another hotel. The W New Orleans on Poydras Street is RUN DOWN, DARK, and DREARY!! The only nice things about the hotel is the lobby - very cool looking. Also, they provide complimentary water bottles and snacks near the front desk, which is very nice. So the 1 star goes to the nice lady who offered to move me from the room that smelled like smoke and the pretty lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foxegurl266
Reviews.Content: I was instantly impressed with this hotel the moment I drove up and was immediately helped with my luggage. The decor is very modern which I really liked. My cool corner room was equipped with a very expansive desk, a mini-fridge and bar, 2 honeycomb bathrobes, a wall-mounted flat-screen TV with a wide variety of channels including Sundance, DVD/CD player (there was also a CD sampler with music to listen to in the room, two telephones (one cordless), a twin bed-size comfy lounger, a coffee table with local magazines and coffee table book, pillows that feel like clouds, and neat shutter-style window coverings. Outside the hotel room, I was greeted by great service from the luggage attendants to the valets (Note: this hotel is valet only. It is $35 per day and there is no self parking.) There is a really nice gym that includes punching bags, lots of treadmills and ellipticals, weight machines, balance balls and blocks, magazines, holders for iPods, spa towelettes, towels and complimentary headphones to watch the TVs connected to the machines. The hotel is well located near many of the sites. It is immediately next to Harrah's casino. You can catch a free ride in an Audi to anywhere within 6 miles of the hotel (It is only outbound. They don't take you back to the hotel.) Just as an additional note, internet is not free. Overall, though, I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel, but rough around some edges.”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the W New Orleans, and maybe the first stay involved too many Hurricanes or something, because it just didn't feel up to par. The only thing that was FABULOUS was the late night check-in crew, who noted my dilapidated state upon arrival and brought me a gorgeous vodka gimlet from the bar right directly. Y'all know who you are and y'all are divine. The room was in ok condition...the bathroom was in eeek condition...I chose the "green option" but promptly went three days without housekeeping despite two requests (GROSS). I still can't ding 'em too much because of the ambiance, location, and genuine, genuine hospitality of every single person who works their but please, people, make friends with Fantastic and Febreeze and I'll still see y'all next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: Like others, I am surprised at the relatively harsh reviews here. We were quite pleased with every aspect of our stay. Our Cool Corner Room (817) was spacious, nicely appointed and in good condition. Bathroom was huge, bed was divinely comfortable (a Starwood hallmark) and the room was well designed with a large entry hall. Service was outstanding; everyone from the front desk staff to the concierge, phone operators and valet were courteous and efficient. My SPG Platinum status was noted and all amenities were properly offered. The 24 hour room service menu was surprisingly extensive and food was brought quickly by cheerful waitstaff. We made good use of the very nice gym. Location is superb; the French Quarter, convention center and casino are all steps away. Common areas are in good condition considering the harsh NO climate and this W avoids the cheap, over-designed look of others in the chain like San Francisco. A great stay and a surprisingly good value considering the time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice W, why so harsh reviews?!”
Reviews.Author: freiburg13
Reviews.Content: Now, as a frequent guest in Starwood hotels and Gold Preferred guest, I am a bit puzzled by fairly negative reviews. This is my type of hotel, modern, funky, good location, nice Whiskey Blue lounge, quite adequate gym, cheerful service. Concierge was helpful, nice large room, good bathroom. Not a bad value either, could be a bit cheaper, plus I cannot give hotel the highest rating if they charge for Internet. Rather than those few mishaps, I couldn't find any serious faults and mishaps, so it is solid 4 out of 5.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Concierge Makes the W Worth a Visit”
Reviews.Author: EasyBigEasy
Reviews.Content: Since service is paramount to me when I travel today, I was happy to meet W New Orleans concierge, Travis Frye. He is one of the best resources you'll find in New Orleans. His recommendations for restaurants, attractions and music were first rate, second only to his charming personality and total service orientation.

Reviews.Title: “W New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: dflores1123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a standard W property, but it tries too. The customer service is great and the property was clean. This is a property that has been many different hotels prior to this one. It doesn't have the new feel as other W properties have that were built from the ground up. We did enjoy our stay and would even go back. The beds and showers were great and the Acura experience rocked.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard”
Reviews.Author: StevenG2
Reviews.Content: Trying is a good summation, everything is ok but not great. It is located close to all things, rooms clean staff not as attentative as desired, service in bars slow.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't feel like a W”
Reviews.Author: RaleighHendersons
Reviews.Content: Not sure if this used to be another hotel, but it feels like a dressed up Ramada. Staff was helpful and attentive and location is fine, but rooms are dated. Not a place to avoid, but I would not pay a typical W rate.

Reviews.Title: “I just don't get the W concept”
Reviews.Author: srmills78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because Harrahs didn't have any rooms available. This was the only place available. When I walked in, I thought I was in some wanna be hip night lounge. The person at the front desk was ok. The rooms are extremely small and I had no idea what all those symbols, words, etc meant on the phone to get services. There was a basketball tourney going on in town and since the walls are paper thin, you could hear everything. I smelled marijuana smoke throughout the hallways and the elevators and the staff didn't seem too concerned when I reported it. The valets outside seemed like they were there to pick up women. One even asked me if I wanted to hang out when he got off! Needless to say, I didn't feel real safe staying there knowing ppl with access to room keys are looking for action with the guests. This place is cool for hip party goers in their 20's and early 30's. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to W standards”
Reviews.Author: corbin t
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only okay... definitely NOT on par with other hotels in the W chain. We were guaranteed a king, but they gave us double beds in a smoking room (or a room in which someone had clearly, and recently, smoked). We asked repeatedly to switch to a king and were finally given an accessible room. (This meant: no chaise/chairs, a removable shower head that didn't fit its clasp, no room in the closet for longer clothing items -- all of which would've been okay had they told us in advance. Instead, they said there was "absolutely no difference" between a regular and an accessible room.) Because they only use a flat sheet on the bed, the sheets came undone after a few hours of sleeping. The carpeting, paint jobs, and bathroom floor were all extremely old, ragged, and chipping. The hair dryers were the really useless 1200w kind -- a nice little remnant of the 1980s. I thought at least the service would be okay, but even that was lacking: any time we asked for advice about the Acura experience or getting a taxi to the hotel, we were told that the parades meant we'd have to arrange other plans. Can the W really not arrange for a taxi to pick up a block away (which is where the parade zone ended)? Also, housekeeping knocked on our door at 9am every morning. The weekend before mardi gras. They didn't provide our room with a "do not disturb" sign, so we got woken up every day. The whole hotel was unkempt and noisy. Our neighbors left 8 empty pizza boxes outside their door and they were there for at least 12 hours (!!). Same with a lot of room service food items. The touch screen of the treadmills didn't work. We heard all of our neighbors' activity. Etc, etc. This place is fine, but don't come here expecting a W.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: cdelucia
Reviews.Content: I was pretty disappointed with this hotel -- it's fine, but for a W and for what you're paying, it should have been better. The staff are great and it's got a hip vibe (great hotel bars, etc), but the room was surprisingly gross (particularly the bathroom, including various stains on the floor, lots of dust, and unexplainable stains on the bathrobe) and it just didn't seem up to par. Rooms were very noisy as well. Other people seem to like this hotel but I definitely will stay elsewhere next time in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but two staff people made this great”
Reviews.Author: traveler60601
Reviews.Content: Typical identity crisis with this W. Used to be something else in a former life, now puts on lipstick and turns up the stereo. Rumor has it will become a Le Meridien soon. Anyway the room was standard W -- comfortable and fairly stylish. Room service food was not good: cold omelette and lukewarm oat meal which lacked the advertised toppings. BUT the concierge service (Kristi) was awesome! Free shoe shine; complimentary shaving kit when I realized I forgot mine, etc. And at the main bar downstairs, where I thought I'd just have a quick drink with a friend, we stayed for a couple hours talking with Brittany Boudreau behind the bar -- witty, smart, and beautiful. That brought the New Orleans charm forward that had been missing so far from this spot. Location is an easy walk to French Quarter. GREAT restaurant one block away -- August (John Besh); beautiful room and excellent food. Laissez les bontemps roulez!

Reviews.Title: “W must stand for WOW”
Reviews.Author: RiufanLeeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights before going on a cruise on the Voyager of the Seas. Hotel was great. Just outside the French Quarter, so a bit quieter at night, but very close by. Great room and very clean. Concierge staff, especially Tyler & Danny, were exceptional. Nothing was too much trouble and their recommedations and suggestions were just right. The Acura was available when needed and thanks to Paul for driving us around. As for New Orleans........we love you and can't wait to return, but it's not that simple for us Brits. Just wish we'd stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast”
Reviews.Author: Rich2809
Reviews.Content: I visited New Orleans with two colleagues who had flown in from Kiev. We just had a fantastic time. Great food, even better cocktails and good rooms. The atmosphere in the hotel is...vibrant. Loud, brash and lots of fun. It makes the stay so different from nearly all hotels I have stayed in. Don't go if yo are looking for a quiet time, you will not get it in this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: BandDT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at the W. We have never stayed at a W before so didnt know what to expect. We found that the staff from the valet attendants, bellboys, front desk, and restaurant staff were outstanding in every way! It actually was a surprise. We have never had that consistent professional service in our many years of travel. Though it is going to be unfair to those staff members whose name we dont recall, we would especially like to thank Hayward, our bellhop who took such good care of us. You can rest assured that when we return to New Orleans we will be staying here, and will be staying at W at other locations as well.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: Liz D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W New Orleans for a relaxing weekend away from the kids in mid January. It is hip and modern, if a little tired in some rooms. The staff was uniformly fantastic from the front desk to housekeeping to bellmen. Management is to be commended on maintaining such a positive, courteous and service oriented staff. We were originally give a corner room on the 21st floor. Tiny and the "feather" bed topper had been reduced to nothing but the spines of the feathers. The real problem was the noise from the other 3 doors that met ours. Every time they opened or closed it woke us up. I went to the front desk and they cheerfully moved me to a room a few doors down that was very quiet and the bed was excellent. The workout facility is nice and clean with modern equipment. It is unbelievable that the W still charges for wi-fi access.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, great service”
Reviews.Author: irbflyfish
Reviews.Content: I don't often find a favorite hotel in my travels based upon service, but this one wins the award for changing my mind. Frankly, it is right across the street from the casino, so it wins the geographic award too. But, what brings me back time and again is the comfortable, no make that very comfortable beds. Very nice lounge and large sitting area with a little secluded corner here and there. Even the outside patio is smoker freindly. I know there are bigger names in New Orleans, ignore the noise, stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doug_Doodle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W while on a business trip to New Orleans. It was two blocks from the Mississippi River (on the other side of Harrah's) and about five blocks to Bourbon Street. The rooms were modern and stylish and service impeccable. Everything about the W was a class act.

Reviews.Title: “All style, but not much substance”
Reviews.Author: ladawna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hotel on Pydras Street for four nights in January 2012. The lobby, bar, gym and restaurant look nice, but the room was only so so. Several of my colleagues stayed here too (for a work conference nearby) and we had similar experiences. Here are details: * Shower was crazy! The water would fluctuate during the shower between tepid and HOT and no matter how I set the control, it would always end up burning me. Some of my colleagues had same problem with their showers, so it wasn't just one random room. * Not the cleanest room I've stayed in, though not the worst. I took my own hand wipe to the bathroom counter. The room generally seemed like it had seen better days. * Mini bars were unpredictable. Some of us had water bottles available, and others didn't, some had food items available and others didn't. And, it was never restocked for my stay, so I had to remember to buy water bottles each day somewhere else if I didn't want to drink the tap. * The Bliss cosmetics are really nice but they were also erratically restocked. For example, I used the body lotion tube the first day. It was never restocked in my four days there. The shampoo/conditioner I used every day but they restocked the small containers only once, so I ran out my last morning :( * Most other people staying there were there for fun. A lot of coming and going late in the night/early morning and I could hear my neighbors through the walls. Not fun for my work schedule :( * On the plus side, the HD TV was nice, the bed seemed clean with lots of comfy pillows, internet (both wired and wireless) worked well in the room and was reliable, and it's a pretty good location close to casino, other hotels, riverwalk/aquarium, and French Quarter. In short, I will look for something that is a better value the next time I travel to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 2of7
Reviews.Content: The W New Orleans on Poydras is situated next door to Harrah's casino and midway between the Convention Center and the French Quarter. While it is a bit of a walk to each (5 blocks), it allows you to attend a conference, and spend time in the Quarter without taxis. The hotel staff is very welcoming, friendly and helpful - starting right as you arrive. The bell hops greeting you have great local flair. Rooms are a little tired, but not as terrible as some of the other posts might suggest. Bedding is quite nice, and some of the street noise can be a bit bothersome. But that is what you get in downtown New Orleans. The hotel bar is lively, and a nice place to settle down for a drink and conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: yaadee
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walking distance to restaurants, shopping & the casino. Very busy weekend so the Valet parking was "interesting". One of the attendents determined my valet fee by the size of my car (which was more than what I was told when I called the hotel) so I parked across the street. The hotel has a very contemporary feel and the bar downstairs was fun! The rooms are nice but "slightly compact" but the bed are comfortable. The staff was very helpful and the concierge was awesome! The gym is one of the best I've seen in a hotel in a long time. I would consider other properties in the area before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: yfdff852
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May for Jazzfest weekend... Great place to stay, convenient to waterfront, Bourbon St, and casino.

Reviews.Title: “THe Awesomeness that is Jamie Moonlight”
Reviews.Author: kingstonVice
Reviews.Content: Jamie-Moonlight provided exemplary service by turning my wake up call into party by playing some of New Orleans' finest urban music. I really appreciate her meeting my totally rediculous request. Im still smiling because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, nice room”
Reviews.Author: GGMAC55
Reviews.Content: Great location for staying over while attending events at the Superdome -- which is in walking distance. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Room decor was nice, great light from windows. The bathroom, however, had an old, low wattage hair dryer and the bathtub drain stopper was broken. Did not try their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, good food, great service”
Reviews.Author: Ariane R
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell the hotel stay was awesome! Their restaurant Zoe's has great food, our service people were really nice, on Fridays the restaurant turns into a bar/lounge the only thing I was disappointed with was that they did not have an indoor pool or whirlpool, other than that great!

Reviews.Title: “High Class College Dorm”
Reviews.Author: Bijouxmama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the W through American Express Fine hotels program for NYE weekend. We always enjoy the fine hotels selection so we didn't think twice about booking the W. But, let's just say there was nothing "fine" about this hotel. The lobby is small a noisy and more like a night club but the reception was warm and welcoming. I was surprised to discover that they also did not have a club lounge which is usually standard in a luxury hotel. We received our luggage quickly and the bellman was very friendly. When we arrived in the room I was shocked, our UPGRADED king room was tiny. It reminded me of the rich kid on campus' dorm room. Low ceilings, grey paint, small window, old bathroom and a flat screen tv directly over the desk. Not to mention you could hear everything in the hallway and the entire hotel seemed more like a club than a place to relax. That wasn't even the worst part... It stank like cheap perfume and mold. When we arrived my throat immediately started hurting and I started coughing. After I a while I realized I was allergic to the W signature sent and I knew I couldn't stay there. We called the manager and they were very helpful trying to find another room but since they were booked there were no options. But, since I was so uncomfortable they graciously allowed us to check out without penalty and change hotels. So we went across the street to the Lowes and had a great experience in a much larger room at $10 less a night.

Reviews.Title: “Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenTay1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of attending a local convention. This hotel is NOT somewhere you want to stay if you want peace and quiet. The walls are extremely thin and you can hear just two people talking down the hall. With that being said, I think that the minimum amount of people I heard walking passed our room was at least 4-5 all day and all night! It was terrible. The double bed rooms were extremely small and the beds were just as bad. Everything in the room was very cramped, even the windows were only half the size. The one thing that I can say that was great about this hotel was that there was very modern decor which was put together very well. Also, the staff was very friendly and accommodating but overall I would not choose to stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: The entire staff at the W Hotel in New Orleans were very guest focused. Kevin and Tony were exceptionally helpful. We stayed there for the Sugar Bowl and had a wonderful experience. The location is perfect, within walking distance of the French Quarter, Riverwalk, and the Superdome. A rental car was not a needed.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Randy H
Reviews.Content: This property did everything right. They paid attention to the little details. e.g. the floor mats in the elevators said "Good morning","Good afternoon", or "Good evening" depending on what time of day it was. Not a big deal but a nice example of the level of care they give. The coolest thing was the free car fleet. All Acuras with very friendly drivers. If you put your name on the schedule they would take you anywhere in six miles for free. One morning they messed up out reservation for the car and double booked. The concierge apologized and got us a cab and told us if we brought back a recite they would reimburse us for not only the trip there but the cab back as well. The lead driver was Paul Reed. He was very friendly and wonderfully entertaining. He got us around on time and was very safe in his driving habits. Everything was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not the best W”
Reviews.Author: SalNToronto
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in a few Ws across North America and this one was not up to the standards of the others. Rooms looked modern and stylish but if you look closely they are not clean. Its easy to tell this hotel has had better days. The Pool area is very small and can be difficult to find a seat during peak hours. The location is good and the staff are friendly. Very easy to walk around and some great restaurants nearby. The Street Car is located close by as well which makes it easy to get to the other areas of New Orleans. Overall, a good experience but would try a different option the next time.

Reviews.Title: “W for Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ChiBri
Reviews.Content: First time in New Orleans and at the W and both were Amazing.. We had a Marvelous suite that had a parlor room off to the side.. it was perfect with 2 people.. made it feel like a home away from home.. all the talent were helpful with thier southern charm. The location is perfect.. you are not placed in the middle of the action, but it is just a short walk to get to the restaurants and bars that New Orleans is known for. We had an interaction with Joseph from the Welcome Desk and he was very helpful and kind.. keep it up! we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: z p
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our W stay on a recent family trip to NOLA. All of the staff went out of their way to accommodate us, which was important as we were traveling with a toddler. In particular, both Paul Reed and Alvin were very helpful. Hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa1213
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W on Poydras Street for my birthday in December. What a nice hotel! The hotel staff were friendly, the room was clean and modern and the location of the W was ideal - we were able to walk everywhere from the hotel. The hotel even had a pleasant smell. We ordered room service our first morning there, and the food was delicious. I loved the look and atmosphere of the hotel, and would love to visit again when it is warmer and the pool is open. The French Quarter is just a few blocks from the W, and Harrah's Casino (and separate hotel) are right across the street. If you walk a few blocks in the opposite direction of the casino you can pick up one of the street cars and head to the Garden District. We enjoyed our visit to New Orleans and our stay and the W - check it out!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: JrGovtExec
Reviews.Content: Pros: Three blocks from the French quarter and next door to Harrahs, uber-comfortable beds, modern decor, courteous staff. Cons: $42/day valet parking, $14/day internet access, wasn't allowed to use hotel luggage cart to self-transport sensitive items to room. I love staying in W hotels but compared to some of the other locations, this one seems a little plain.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: CaptD516
Reviews.Content: We thought the rooms were spacious and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. Especially appreciated Kevin C. Tony D., Krystal B. and Travis F. Food was good as was health club. We enjoyed the lobby bar. Location is perfect. It was busy at Christmas but we always felt at home. Not sure why others don't like it but we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JamesC458
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a complete let down. My wife and I feel totally ripped off. The place is really a high priced dump. Really! The entire place is dirty as if it had not been cleaned in years. There is grime everywhere; on the walls, floors, and, windows. Itâ€™s hard to believe they could have an entire department devoted to housekeeping. The dust on the headboard of the bed in our room was so thick I could write my name in it and I had to request that someone re-service the room when we left for dinner because the carpet didnâ€™t look as if it was vacuumed since the last guest checked out. All the furniture appears to be purchased from a garage sale. There was not one piece in our room that was not chipped or scratched. The W thinks you can paint over it and no one will notice. We would not even consider sitting on the couch There were obvious stains on the cushions that did not look as if anyone ever tried to remove them. The bathroom was a joke. The walls needed to be wiped down and the wallpaper was peeling from the wall. The sink is so small you would get water all over the counter every time you used it. Good thing though, because it forced you to wipe it off as it was stained also. Even the place mat to set your â€œcleanâ€� drinking glasses on was obviously used before and not changed after the last guest. You couldnâ€™t take a decent shower because the hot and cold water was very difficult to adjust and the curtain keeps blowing inward because there isnâ€™t an arched curtain rod to prevent it from doing so. Even a 2-star hotel would have one installed. You can have cool music and a martini bar in the lobby but, it will not make up for the worn out and run down condition of this hotel. Save your money and stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary hotel with great location, a bit expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: azalie
Reviews.Content: My first experience at a W hotel, staying five nights ostensibly for business with nightly expeditions for local fare and libations. I've known this hotel chain by reputation, and by look at least, it was every bit as expected. Relentlessly contemporary, the decor is sophistication veering dangerously close to tacky. Saved a bit by a sense of fun (e.g., the "Good Morning" and "Good Evening" mats that greet you when you enter the elevators, changed twice daily apparently). From the street, you pass through a glowing white portal with a single Red "W" on it, looking suspiciously like a transplant from a sci-fi film. Concierge and check-in as soon as you walk in, excellent and attentive service all around, consistent throughout the stay. The rest of the first level is to the left, where there are two computer terminals (pay to use, probably free to print boarding passes but did not do it here), a bar area, and their Living Room, with multiple seating and table choices. Across from this are the huge doors to the in-house whiskey bar, Whiskey Blue. Did not patronize but on several occasions passing through the side street exit by here, spied a sleek-looking bar. I stayed in a King room. Very spacious room, with chaise and large desk; no vanity but space in the nightstands. Good quality bedsheets and comfortable bed. Gigantic mirror angled against the wall by the bed; it looked awkward but sufficient space to make use of. Most of the room furniture besides the bed need an update; not high quality make. Unlike the garish colors sometimes on display elsewhere in the hotel, this room was subdued, in dark grey, mustard, and white. Bathroom likewise very roomy, lots of counter space, all amenities available, Bliss products, in cool white, black, and grey; tub shower and wobbly fixtures can use an update, also needs a vent. Very quiet in the room. Wifi is a paid-for amenity. They offer free wifi in their Living Room area but that, unfortunately, didn't work during the days I was there. Free coffee offered at their second floor restaurant Zoe in the mornings. The W's location was perfect for me. Although walking to the NOLA convention center is a bit of a hike, its still a very walkable 20 minutes. Likewise, it is less than 10 minutes to walk to the border of the French Quarter, at Canal St. In a quiet area, no clubs or bars nearby with late night crowds. And quiet despite sitting between the famous Mother's restaurant and the Harrah's casino, albeit a side entrance. If you come back late, it will be relatively quiet on the streets; although I never felt unsafe, I didn't linger either. Overall, it was a solid stay, with highlights being the very comfortable bed, excellent location for what I was in town for, and great service. Rating held down by room rates that don't match the overall quality of the room, with no free wifi in their communal area as advertised. I liked the fun vibe, but can live without paying a premium for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hloriol
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans for a wedding, and this was the perfect hotel for a visit to New Orleans. The staff was so nice, and accommodating to my family. Upon check in, they were so helpful and wanted to ensure we had everything in our room. The hotel is more of a business / convention center style hotel, but is pretty good if you don't want to stay in / on the Quarter. Not much in terms of restaurants, but the whisky blue bar was very good. All in all, a pretty good stay, with the class of the 'W' hotel brand that I'm used to getting. I recommend, but suggest that you look for the french quarter location if you're looking for wild action. This property is right next to the Casino, in case you want to make a quick visit to the tables, which I found was pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: jholmes25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W hotel for New Year's Eve, and we were both happy with our stay. The hotel is in a good location being just a block away from a Canal Street and only a few blocks away from the French Quarter. Our room was small but nice. However, it was not as nice as the rooms I've stayed in at other W hotels. I think this is because the building used to house a different hotel and was remoled into a W. The hotel appears to be going under additional renovations currently so hopefully the rooms will get upgraded. If you can get a good rate at this hotel (under $170 for the weekend) then i would suggest staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Tracy R
Reviews.Content: I reserved one of the their Wonderful two queen bed room "as they call it", and I also call the day before check in and confirmed my stay, but when me and my family arrived we were given A King size bed for 2 adults and 2 children. This was the worse hotel experience I have ever had!!!! Front desk was so rude and not helpful with no accommodations. This hotel says their customers come first if you call the hotel direct and no special privileges if made from the Internet " as most people do now days!!!!! The pictures online of hotel are deceiving. Hotel and rooms doesn't look that good.

Reviews.Title: “Try Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garretttrahan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older remodel by the W chain. We stayed on the very top floor which was to be the best floor in the place. Room had two FULL sized beds, room was very small and odd shaped. Great downtown location, however with all the choices to pick from in NO, this would be close to last on my list. Too old of a Hotel for a W.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas in NOLA - hotel and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: JamieJ2423
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend Xmas 2011 in NOLA this year, and chose the W Hotel on Poydras. We travel to NOLA often and have stayed all over, we chose the W this time because we like the modern elegance and fun atmosphere (couple in early 40's). Over all I would certainly recommend it. The hotel is in need of some updating to bring it back to its luster and reputation, but you will enjoy it. Pros...great atmosphere, very comfortable rooms and beds, VERY attentive staff, Acura provides local transport in a new MDX, walking distance from the French Quarter and Harrah's Casino is across the street, room key required to ride the elevator offered nice security, very nice fitness room and pool..... Cons...no spa at the hotel, maid service was lacking (though I think this was because of the holiday week), windows in rooms were strangely high, which limited light and almost any view (rm 1704). Must eats while your in town though....and I am being serious....go try these...! Red Fish Grill....Bread Pudding to die for Royal House Oyster Bar....Chargrilled Oysters Gumbo Shop....Gumbo and Crab Cakes Oceana Grill.....Jambalaya (try the sampler) Rib Room....Rack of Lamb

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Kevin E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all "W"... Until you leave the lobby. Then it degrades into a (probably) once trendily decorated hotel that sorely needs an update. Cramped, oddly shaped rooms, shabby furnishings...and VERY thin walls. Close to the quarter, but not close enough to be this pricey and this rundown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: pchang637
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here over Christmas weekend. The location was definitely, as other reviewers have mentioned, in a nice, more quiet location (within walking distance to French Quarter, right across the street from Harrah's and the Shops at Canal). The walls are on the thin side - we could hear nearby rooms' doors being closed, despite the TV being on in our room. As with most hotels in the French Quarter area, the hotel is a bit older - the common areas like the lobby, pool area and gym are well kept, clean and updated, but I would say that our bathroom could use a major cleaning. The tiles on the floor were dirty, as was the sink area. This W Hotel offers the Acura Experience, although our family did not use it. I'm a Gold Starwood member, so I was advised upon check-in that the bottled water in our rooms were complimentary. Therefore, I was a little disappointed to find that, a few days after our departure, there was a "minibar" charge to my credit card. I had to call the hotel to get it removed.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy. Great staff. Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: itsfitz911
Reviews.Content: Very trendy and nice hotel. They did a good job with making over a older hotel. There are small things they do to make you notice the attention to detail. The bed was comfortable, room was clean very nice stay. Across the street to the casino. The only down fall is the the walls are thin. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: bengals09
Reviews.Content: Good service with nice rooms. Very close to the french quarter, the casino and the convention center. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at W New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: starwood6589
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had a good stay at the W New Orleans in August 2011. The check-in area in the lobby was extremely crowded if there were more than 4 people in line because you would be practically standing outside the door. The concierge was not very helpful in assisting us with brunch reservations and the W SUV (Acura) was not available when we requested in. Also, in the morning, there was complementary coffee but they ran out of lids. This was a good hotel by New Orleans standards, but definitely not up to the quality of a W in NYC. It is almost impossible to compare the two since the customer service was quite slow in New Orleans. The pool was very nice and the fitness center was great. I enjoyed both amenities. We didn't go to the bar or restaurant at the W. The location is a bit farther from the French Quarter but it was convenient to use the trolley. I wouldn't want to walk around the area by myself at night but it was alright. I would be interested in staying at the W New Orleans - French Quarter on my next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Another all time favorite”
Reviews.Author: stephanie j
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed here twice on two different occasions... I love this hotel. Its right in the middle of where I need to be when in New Orleans. Casino's, restaurants, shopping, bars, and nightclubs are all either in walking distance or taxi cab assessable. If you are with traveling with kids the Audubon Zoo, Aqurium, IMX, River Walk and all in the area. I LOVE W NEW ORLEANS. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Chic and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: nadja s
Reviews.Content: I have never been to New Orleans before and went with my son to visit Tulane. New Orleans is a terrific city, but one of my favorite parts was our hotel. It was very chic and hip. But unlike many other places with that description the service there was excellent. Every member of the staff made us feel that their only interest was in making sure we were happy and enjoying our stay. Quentin drove us in the Acura to Tulane. He was informative, polite and not intrusive. So many of the staff in the lobby treated us like royalty, but when we were hungry mid day we had the fortune to speak with Paul. He directed us across the street to Mothers. That was an experience I would not have wanted to miss. Our room was clean, comfortable and glamorous. Anyone can build a nice hotel, but very few can provide the level of service that we experienced at the W. It was so exceptional I asked to speak to the manager when we checked out, just to let him know what a terrific team he had put together. I cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “W - What a letdown”
Reviews.Author: Love_Mountains_08
Reviews.Content: If you're only looking for a hotel that is conveniently located about halfway between the French Quarter and the Garden District, and next door to the casino, then this W in New Orleans is for you. However, you must know that you'll be sacrificing quite a bit of money from your wallet, possibly your sanity, probably your standards for room cleanliness, and definitely a good night's sleep. A friend and I stayed here over the long Thanksgiving weekend. While the staff were always friendly, we were very disappointed with most other services offered by the hotel. The rooms weren't cleaned properly, there was oddly no soundproofing between the hallways and the rooms, and in this day and age, it was unpleasantly surprising to be told to pay for wireless internet while staying there as a hotel guest. I know that we should let the good times roll when in NOLA, but I would have expected a hotel like the W to be prepared to deal with the aftermath! Overall, not an enjoyable stay at the hotel; my impression of the W hotel chain has fallen considerably. Never fear, NOLA, I'll be back - but I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I stay here everytime I come to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Emily E
Reviews.Content: I come to New Orleans every month and always stay at the W on Poydras. Is it the newest building with the most renovated rooms? No. But the staff more than make up for it. Concierges Danny and Travis are really great at what they do -- they recommend great restaurants (ones you wouldn't know about as a tourist) and take care of getting you booked there. They always seem so happy to help take care of you. If you call in advance of coming they also take care of booking the Acura for you. This is a huge convenience -- having a free car ride for early morning meetings is such a big help. The people that work here really stand out; Hayward brings you anything you need and always goes the extra mile. He clearly loves his job. Kevin, Quentin and others get you where you need to in the Acura and always have a great attitude. Tony, Krystal, Brian and Jaime are always very helpful as well. For people seeking a formal, quiet hotel with a more classic feel, this may not be the right fit for you. J.W. Marriott, Roosevelt, or Intercontinental might be a better fit. But if you are looking for great service and to be treated like you are home when you are away for work, come here.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, Dirty, and Cold”
Reviews.Author: simonweird
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels around the world and many Starwood properties. This was one of the worst. People that gave good reviews must have been paid, or they are deaf and blind.The staff was friendly and the location was great, but those were the only positives. It looks nice when you walk in, but it is just a cover up. I stayed for one week in December 2011. Luckily I spent my second week in Courtyard Marriott on St Charles. The Courtyard is currently being renovated, but it is much nicer that the W Poydras. Complaints: 1) No hot water my first day. My stay was during the cold snap that New Orleans had in December 2011. 2) Heater was broken. Unacceptable when it was freezing at night. 3) The windows were thin, let the cold in, and I could hear every sound outside. Do not stay here if you are a light sleeper. 4) The walls were super thin. It sounded like the people in the next room were in my room. I could hear every move they made. Not private at all. 5) Overall, the hotel was dirty and poorly maintained. The bed comforter was filthy. Dirty glasses, dirty walls, and broken floor tiles in the bathroom. Broken shower diverters. I switched rooms and it was mostly the same in both rooms. 6) They charged someoneâ€™s dinner to my account. Unacceptable. They should check names/IDs before charging my room. 7) My coworker requested wakeup calls every morning, but only received one the first day. 8) The internet was very expensive and so slow it was almost unusable. Do not pay for it. 9) The alarm clocks and phones were unplugged and you had to move the bed to plug them in. Also the alarm clock was not digital and so small you could read it anyway. Worthless.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel; nice rooms and good service. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: doberman32
Reviews.Content: I am from New Orleans and recently came back and stayed here. I used to hang out here all the time, but never stayed here when I lived here. Rooms are nice, but a bit small. Service is good. One of the better bars in the city and very hip. Prices are reasonable and beds are great. Good staff--charge way too much to park, however. Bathrooms are small and really need to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever”
Reviews.Author: Angelina_Serra
Reviews.Content: I will start off with the positive aspects of the hotel. The decor is modern and stylish. Nice lobby with outside seating area with bamboo trees. The swimming pool area is on the 4th floor. again great design. The room furniture was beautiful. The hotel is 15 minutes from the French Quarter. They also had an shuttle service that drives you around to close by places. The concierge was quite helpful Things I didn't like about the place. The room was a bit small. More fit for a hotel in NYC than NOLA. No coffee maker. No place to lay out your luggage. You can probably get a better breakfast in Starbucks than here. The computers in the lobby were down 3 out of four days I was there. Room service did not replenish the soap/shampoo/etc. In the morning my neighbor had the TV on it woke me up. The walls are quite thin The hotel greets you by saying "Whatever, whenever, what is your wish" and I just didn't feel like the service was that great. The hotel is ok but I didn't love it....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay, gorgeous amenities”
Reviews.Author: StephanieJoplin
Reviews.Content: Our suite was truly spectacular. I LOVED the Bliss amenities also. The pool was quiet and serene, a huge difference from the bustling business that is NOLA just outside the front gates. The staff was more than helpful. I have been corresponding with your twitter manager, and she seems like just the perfect fit for a W employee. What a wonderful staff. Highly recommended! I will definitely be suggesting the W to my friends for their future NOLA stays.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service?”
Reviews.Author: LaryS6143
Reviews.Content: I actually ended up leaving and staying elsewhere after my arrival here...they didn't have the room that I had reserved and was not giving an amicable alternative as they were running at full capacity. The manager was not helpful in resolving this issue and actually wouldn't even speak with me until it was decided between myself and the desk clerk that the wouldn't be able to accommodate me..her suggestion was that I simply go stay somewhere else. I have stayed here prior and did not have the same encounter, but I recall the rooms being incredible small and hard to navigate, snooty staff at the bar and underwhelming room service should you have to utilize it...but your in NoLa- dining is not an issue. For the cost of the W resorts I would keep looking or at least stay in the W in the french quarter

Reviews.Title: “Superior”
Reviews.Author: Katiagrist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel while in New Orleans this week. We truly enjoyed every moment of our stay in this hotel. The staff were all extra friendly and went above and beyond to assist and accommodate the guests. The rooms were extremely clean and the entire hotel had a wonderful fresh smell throughout. The hotel is within walking distance to the French Quarter, as well as restaurants and shopping. We will certainly choose the W hotel for our next visit to New Orleans any other city that we visit. Cudos to the staff and management for creating such an enjoyable environment.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Place.”
Reviews.Author: quetzal61
Reviews.Content: This place is hip, the rooms are fantastic, the service is good, not great. LOCATION WAS GREAT! The lobby is constantly crowded with 20 somethings and bridal parties. The Acura car amenity was NEVER available, even when trying to book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that was it.”
Reviews.Author: Shread
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice but service requests were not met. Telephone did not work and took four days to fix. I missed wake-up calls and calls from associates I was there to meet. Also, small issues with missing room amenities and cleanliness. I had poor service from one concierge and then the next day's concierge was excellent so keep trying and they will get it right. Once these issues were dealt with, the location is great (parking is $35 per day) so I walked or cabbed everywhere. The few blocks to the French Quarter is excellent. The beds and pillow at W Hotel is always great so I did sleep well. I am going back in a few weeks but will stay elsewhere for now. The rate is higher but the finish is missing so the value is low.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans trip”
Reviews.Author: Pedro C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under construction and the rooms small for the price. Beds were great and it was quiet. Peoplep were pleasant and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City!”
Reviews.Author: Thinkalot
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a science teacher's convention in New Orleans. It was a perfect stay for so many reasons. One, I just returned from a month in Asia and my last stay there was at the W Hong Kong in Kowloon. The hotels are completely different in many ways--the W Hong Kong probably cost 10 times more, but as a very frequent business traveler, I can say that both provided what matters to me most. Great ambiance, service and staff at every level who really do mean "whatever, whenever!

Reviews.Title: “Trip to W Poydras Street, New Orleans last week”
Reviews.Author: Kathy J
Reviews.Content: Dear Ms. Thompson, I was impressed, as usual, with the service provided at the W. The Poydras Street location lived up to my expectations and is why I choose W whenever I can do so. I didnâ€™t get names for everyone that was kind, helpful, gracious and went out of their way to make sure our trip was everything we wanted it to be: however, I do want to give special props to Madeline â€“ a perfect example of the type of employee that one would want to represent a brand. Kevin, Paris, Tony and Brian â€“ all went above and beyond whether it was to make sure whatever needs we had were met, offer a friendly suggestion or simply at warm, â€œHelloâ€�. As I have come to expect, your staff is above and beyond so you are lucky to have them as part of the W Poydras Family. See you in March 2012! Sincerely, Kathy Jones President Equus/Standardbred Station Inc. Lexington, KY 40511 11/16/11 PS - I stayed the first night at the W French Quarter but moved - there is not comparison so I have to wonder if the reviews previous posted refer to that property and not the Poydras one?

Reviews.Title: “Makes the Big Easy so easy!”
Reviews.Author: upgrademe81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend to attend a close friend's wedding. When I arrived, my biggest concern was that the property wasn't as nice as the other W and that the location was inconvenient. Fortunately, my fears were never realized as I had a wonderful time at this property. Check-In was smooth. Even though I had to wait a few minutes due to several guests being present in the lobby, While I waited, I enjoyed some complimentary flavored water and snacks. I was recognized for my Gold status and even though the attendant didnt' inform me of an upgrade, the view of the river was clearly a step up. However, what really was outstanding was when I arrived at my room, the maid asked if I needed any extra water, towels or toiletries completely unprompted. The property's perks overall was exactly what I needed. From the quality of the common spaces where I lounged and people watched to the great service from bartenders at both of their bars, I really enjoyed feeling greeted and treated respectfully. The complimentary coffee bar in the morning was heaven sent, and the Acura service was perfect since I was able to reserve it to get me wherever I needed to go in town without ever any hassle! The only draw back was the pool area where the key card often doesn't work, even for registered guests. On weekdays it was quiet and well maintained. However, on Saturday, I went for an afternoon workout at the gym next to the pool and while the gym was more than adequate, there was a very raucous party going on which included people drinking heavily, diving into the very shallow pool head first and wearing fewer clothes than they should for their age and body type. Nonetheless, it's N'Awlins so I rolled with it but didn't stick around fearing I might be thrown in the pool myself.Still, having used cash + points to stay here and having access to amenities that I used daily, I really felt this was a haven from the hustle and bustle of Bourbon St. and the French Quarter. If I did want to get there quickly though, it was a 10-15 minute walk or just a very quick and cheap cab ride. This is a great property because of the extremely friendly and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worst staff ever”
Reviews.Author: Johnbre
Reviews.Content: My stay at the WNewOrleans was horrible. My wife and I were staying in the city for a wedding. I don't know which was worst; the dirty room, front desk staff,or the housekeeping MOD. I checked into a dirty room on the 14th floor ( I forget exact room number). I asked to switch rooms and was told that there were none available. I asked for a manager and a very nice (so I thought) lady showed and introduced herself to me as Kenya housekeeping supervisor. She reassured me that she would take care of all my concerns. When she left my room: I overheard her speaking with a male employee in the halls about her aggravation with my wife and I. I was distraught! I will be reporting this to Corporate Headquarters. WNO should hire staff members that enjoy their job.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not very service friendly”
Reviews.Author: Chodell
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on Starwood points so fair enough I can't comment on the value but for the number of points we used I was disappointed. We arrived on a Thursday night at 9pm and our room was ready but it wasn't the room we reserved. Instead of a king sized bed we had 2 doubles crammed into a room too full for the beds and day lounger. We were not told this until we called down that they didn't have our king room available that night but would move us the next day. We left at 10am and confirmed our room change but when we got back at 3:30 they still hadn't located a room for us. At that point we had to change for early dinner plans and while we were in our old room changing we were interrupted twice by both the porter and housekeeping as I guess they had just "found" a room for us the minute we got back. Our first room showed lots of wear and tear with chipped bathroom tile, rusty mirror hardware and old bath fixtures. The worst was we had hoped to charge our iPhones on the adaptor for the fancy tivoli radio but it was too old to support our device. We found the concierge less than helpful and infact used our Open Table app more helpful. We did like the use of an Acura car service to be a nice peek and loved the driver. The lobby bar was cold and impersonal with very expensive drinks. I would not come back and as a Starwood member go with the Westin across the way.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, modern hotel in this classic, old North American city”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: Very hip and trendy hotel. Great colors and decor. Lots of nice touches. The only slight negative were the staff. They were fine, but a little snooty and aloof. Not friendly at all. When I asked for help with recommendations on places to eat, things to do, they seemed annoyed at my request.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: hugz415
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the W for business and was not impressed. The front desk staff was very friendly at check in but after that things were downhill. My bathroom didn't seem very clean and the room was on the small side with no view - just a cement wall. My overall impression was that they want to convey a modern feel but are missing the execution. The couches in the Whiskey Blue bar are very dingy and full of burn holes. Someone threw up in the elevator and it was still there in the morning. Another associate of mine had to call two days in a row bc his room was not serviced (they did give a $50 credit for this). Just seems like they need to beef up the management a tad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: likestogo817
Reviews.Content: I got a really good deal on Priceline for this property for a two night stay. We arrived into N.O. by Amtrak on Halloween night. Check in was effortless and staff was friendly and helpful at all times, even making great suggestions on where to take our 4 yr. grandaughter trick or treating. The W was clean, big enough for the three of us, and close to all the family attractions like the aquarium, insectarium, steamboat Natchez and Riverwalk Park. Harrah's casino was right acrooss the street very easy to make a contribution to lol. The hotel provides nice bathrobes to wear for after showering and before bed. All in all it was a great place and convenient for our stay with our grandaughter. Will stay again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “An adequate stay”
Reviews.Author: TreeFrogCreative
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in New Orleans at the end of October of this year. I had heard about W Hotels being funky and high-end, so I checked in with great anticipation. The reception gal was very friendly and helpful, and fast. We were early, but they had a room ready for us, so we went directly to the room to drop off our bags. My husband is a Starwood Member but this particular hotel didn't seem to give any of the perks that Starwood members get elsewhere. Entering the room from the hallway was a challenge because the door is angled into the room such that you almost have to step into the bathroom to get around the door - strange and awkward. Just as challenging when leaving the room. Inside, the room smelled fresh and clean. But I immediately noticed that there was no in-room coffee service. OMG - how was I going to start the day without coffee??? This is a serious situation for me, and a definite negative in my books! The windows had wooden louvered shutters rather than curtains. I wanted to see the view, and tried to swing the shutters open, but they have so much furniture in front of them, that I could only open one of the four easily, and had to move lights and the fridge/minibar in order to open the others. Frustrating. Our first night was comfortable, we had to turn off the air conditioning because it blows right at the bed. In the morning Kelly (husband) had to go downstairs and find me coffee!! Thank goodness we were traveling together. The saving grace was that the coffee he found on the second floor was excellent coffee (but doesn't make up for not having it in the room!). We were gone almost the whole day (at a conference) and got back to the room at about 4:45 pm, and housekeeping had still not made it to our room. At this point we didn't want to be disturbed, so put the Do Not Disturb sign on the door and went without housekeeping for the day. The next day, we arrived back at our room at about 5pm, and the housekeeping cart was parked outside our door, and our door was ajar. We pushed it open and went in, but no one was there, and although the beds were made, and towels replaced, the empty toilet paper hadn't been filled and there was still trash in the bins, so we assumed they weren't finished. Kelly called to the gal that was in the room across the hall to ask if she was done in our room, and she answered that our room wasn't hers. So Kelly mentioned that the door was open when we got there, and she was quite rude about it not being her problem. When we found the gal who had cleaned our room, she was very apologetic about the door being left open. Although noting was missing from our possessions, it was a bit frustrating. We didn't eat in the hotel, so I can't comment on the food services. The lobby and hallways were always freezing cold, and I found the lobby (where they had the free internet) to be very uncomfortable. Not my style i guess, but there was loud music, and a strong smell of some kind of air freshener (too strong), maybe to cover smoke from the adjacent bar??? I don't know if there was smoking in the bar, but the air had a stale smell behind the sickly air freshener. We paid for internet in the room, but it was a bit slow. When we tried to switch from one computer to another, it wanted a second payment, so we just used one machine in the room. My final comments are regarding the bathroom. It was clean, but in places starting to show wear (pealing seal around the sink etc.). What I didn't like was that the bathtub didn't drain very well so part way through a shower you are standing in about 3 inches of soapy water. The other frustrating thing was that the vanity mirror (the one attached to the wall that gives you a scary enlargement of your face) was stuck in the corner such that, in order to get close enough to do my make-up, I was standing crammed beside the toilet. Bummer! So - overallâ€”It wasn't an unpleasant stay, but given the large selection of hotels at that price point in New Orleans, I don't plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff put the "w" in aWesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zenobia_11
Reviews.Content: Dedicated to helping their guest enjoy the total hotel experience. Confident. Enthusiastic. Organized. Knowledgeable. Efficient. Very graceful leaders! If these attributes are important to you and your stay at a hotel, I highly recommend the W New Orleans! It goes without saying, the hotel is ceilings, walls and floors. The above mentioned all occurred by the frontline partners (employees) that made this a wonderful experience.I would like to personal thank Jamie "Halle" Berry for making the trip start off right by having a long line, but greeted every customer with a smile. I will never forget the personalization given to our luggage and us from "Mr. W" himself, Hayward Angeletta. 20 years with your company showed so well in the coustomer service Angela Thompson gave when we visit your restaurant. Just when we thought it could not get any better, while checking out of the W Hotel, Jarrod "Jae" Little end on a wonderful note of giving experience service and had us join your club for easily service. At the end of the day I am proud to highly recommend the W Hotel because of the Wonderful staff there. Thank you, Zenobia E. Brown

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel for cleanliness I have seen”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: This place has you fooled, but we spent 3 nights there and would have left but used Starpoinrs. GM and staff were amiable but the place is filthy! Stay away from room 1916 which has a closet as a bathroom...

Reviews.Title: “A Surprised Conventioneer”
Reviews.Author: recklessweimie
Reviews.Content: I approached my visit to New Orleans with dread. My last visit there, I had stayed in a French Quarter hotel while attending a PMAI convention. It was terrible - unsafe, unfriendly, and unappealing. Trashy people, scary city preying on its visitors. This time, I loved it. True, I stayed away from Bourbon St. But the city was friendly, the folks chatty and accommodating, and architecture (especially in the Warehouse District) well preserved and wonderful. I finally get why people love New Orleans. One of my worries were the spotty reviews on my chosen hotel. I chose the W as a hopefully well designed, slightly up-market, and hopefully convenient venue. On arrival, I was greeted well. I was identified by the computer as Starwood gold member (I had no idea!) and upgraded to a corner room. I asked if it would be quiet and the warm young woman at the desk assured me ti would be. She was right - my room was spacious and quiet. Comfortable. Nothing seemed tired and worn out. Almost everything worked perfectly. I have no complaints. It wasn't a 4 star experience, but I wasn't expecting one. It was comfortable, quiet, safe, and tasteful. I should mention the extremely authentic and all around wonderful restaurant one block north on Poydras called Mother's. Don't miss it. I had my first nights dinner there and then went back for breakfast. I also ate across the street at the much renowned Cafe Amelie - which wasn't worth the money and at several other expensive eateries. I recommend Mother's as the not to be missed restaurant of the bunch. I should also add that I had the overpriced continental room service breakfast at the W. It was completely okay, but cost about twice or more what it should have. Go downstairs to Mother's instead!

Reviews.Title: “Central and what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Allgoodbugman
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd W I've stayed in. It was very similar to the W in downtown Atlanta. Black slate, techno music. I'm more of a traditionalist, but it wasn't overwhelming. I will say the staff was very nice to me and made me feel very welcome. A workout facility is important to me as well and the Gym here was very well equipped with dumbbells, machines, treadmills, bikes and elliptical. So many downtown hotels just jam an exercise room into one of their hotel rooms but this was a separate facility off the pool. I also like to swim laps, but this pool was too small. Happening bar downstairs off the lobby with a good selection of beers as well. My room had a computer and a printer. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Team at the W New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Misti M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels, some so wonderful and upscale, and some not so wonderful. The W was fine. Pretty average, could use some "attention" to detail. However, the reason for this review was the service. I stayed at the hotel this past week for a convention. Upon my arrival I was greeted and taken care of by Kevin Chemlam, he was so wonderful. He took my luggage up and expalined where everything was, made suggestions on things to see, and when he knew I needed something, he called the store to make sure they had it prior to me going all that way. He remembered my name, and made sure daily when he saw me that I was taken care of, THAT is service! The help of Paul Reed to get us where we needed to go, he was so sweet and kind, I needed a ride to the store, and so that I wouldn't get lost or turned around, he personally spoke to the taxi driver and made sure they waited for me. Christie Tomalson, took care of all of our needs for reservations and made such wonderful suggestions for dinner! I was traveling with another sales person who was going to be away from home for her 21 wedding anniversary, Kristi and Travis made arrangements for a dessert and glass of wine to be delivered to her on her special day. Parris Hurst couldn't have been more kind during my check in and questions throughout my stay. If I had to base my stay on the hotel itself, I couldn't say that I would come back for a visit and stay there, because the hotel seems old, and superficially "fixed" up with art/deco decor. The bathrooms are too tiny, and had no ventilation, and the water from the faucet ran all over the counter while trying to wash my face. The walls/doors are too thin and I could hear everything going on in each room on either side of me, and the shutters were broken. But, if I had to base my decision to come back because of the service, the wonderful people that I had the pleasure of meeting, I would in an instant! It is all about the service, and all about the people that make the "hotel". Thank you Kevin, Paul, Christie and Paris for making my stay so wonderful! Best of luck.

Reviews.Title: “"Whatever" happened to decent service”
Reviews.Author: glbltrotter
Reviews.Content: I'm a platinum with Starwood and have been for several years. So I usually am pretty loyal, and try to ignore some shortcomings when they come up. However, my three night stay has been horrible at this hotel. First of all, my wife and I came here for a wedding, and decided to make a 3 night stay of the weekend. We thought the W would be a great break for us. We generally like the brand and our experience. We thought being just outside of the French Quarter would be quieter, since we were traveling with a baby. However, this has got to be the Worst W and worse Starwood hotel we have ever stayed at. This is more Hampton Inn, then W, except Hamptons generally have better service! The hotel looks like it was either an office building or a holiday Inn before they put the W lipstick on this hotel - and it's run as if Whatever and Whenever justify's the staff's attitude of apathy. Room/ bathroom construction was sloppy and cheap. The room was tidy, but dirty, redish mold in the bathroom, dirty walls and bathroom floor. The bathroom sink is about 9" wide, witih a big "12" faucet right in the middle so that you can't wash your face without getting water all over the counters. The wireless internet worked sporadically, and we discovered there was no ventilation fan in the bathroom, nor operable windows (isn't that against code)? Needless to say the room would get steamy and muggy after using the shower. The service was an even bigger disapointment. After we checked in, they said they would put us in another king room the next day with a river view. Before going out in the morning, I double checked with the front desk to make sure they were going to do the switch. We packed up and went into town. We came back around 8 hours later to get our new keys, the front desk had no idea what I was tallking about and tried to find another king room for us. We went back to our old room, our stuff was right were we left it. It was late, our baby was upset and decided not to bother to try and get another room that night. By that time it was slim pickings. I told the front desk how frustrated I was that we went through that effort, and they didn't follow through. The front deks apologized, and said they would get back to me to 'set things right' I never heard back. The next morning my wife put the tag on the door for privacy. Between 9-12 AM, housekeeping knocked three times even though the sign was out. My wife explained we had a sleeping baby, and to come back any time after 12. She came back three times before noon, knocking each time, explaining that if she didn't clean, she'd get in trouble, my wife explained each time that we had a sleeping baby, and to please come back at 12. however 12 came, and she never came back. Even when we came back after the wedding the room later that night, the room was as it was left. No cleaning, no nothing. This was also day three, and they hadn't brought back more bottled water since our first night..... The main reason we chose the W, was we thought the Acura shuttle would be great. The first day, it worked like a charm. We got dropped off in the french quarter without a problem and we made our luncheon with time to spare. The driver couldn't have been more friendly. He had two girls of his own, and was so pleasant with our baby. However, the third day when we went down to get shuttled to the wedding, it showed up 15 minutes late, and we missed the first part of the service. The worse part about the hotel was the air circulation. It's stuffy and the air is heavily recycled. Without operating windows, bathroom fans, we found ourself bothered by the stale or muggy air. We definitely won't be back, and have serious doubts about ever trusting the W brand for service and quality rooms. I wish I had picked up on other review, that this was not W standards or quality. I can't believe I wasted three nights and 4 days at this place, and dealing with complete apathy when it came to service. Problem after problem, and no follow through.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Arielle12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with another couple this past August. This was our 1st time staying at a W and I can't think of any complaints.. the rooms were very clean, beds comfortable. The bars and sitting areas on the main floor were nice for a relaxing drink before going out into the heat. Good location - right near Riverwalk, the trolley and walking distance to french quarter/restaurants/bars. They also have an acura suv that will drive you places for free until 8 or 9pm. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Really nice rooftop pool (although kinda small) & cabanas that we had to ourselves most of the time. We got a discount on rooms through a friend that works for the chain, so I'm not sure how expensive rooms actually are but I would def recommend this hotel to others. We had a great time and can't wait to go back in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Credit Card !”
Reviews.Author: Chase S
Reviews.Content: Overall good stay . However , I booked through a 3rd party (priceline) and paid through them as well , but found out the 2nd day of my week stay that the W had also charged me for the whole weeks stay ! The front desk manager said "our mistake" we do see you've already paid, so she fixed it and I moved on. Well today after being back home for a week I checked my statement and they charged me for parking TWICE !!! I just called the W and they said they would have someone call me back next week . If you ask me , once is a mistake , but TWICE , something is going on in their accounting department ! If you have stayed there recently I would check your credit/debit statements! On another note the hotel has great customer service but needs some serious updating !!! The pool is a joke !

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet location, but a little updating would go a long way”
Reviews.Author: MomakFlorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a combo anniversary/business trip. Hotel was in a good location, walking distance to trolley, French Quarter, all sites...and the not to be missed, Cafe du Monde. I really liked being close to all the excitement, but very happy that this location was a few blocks away which gave us a quiet room to retire to. Everything was clean, service and staff were friendly and helpful. We have stayed at many W hotels around the world and this one could do with a little TLC and updating. I love the clean, contemporary look and feel, but I felt like we were stuck in the 70's and it's time for the popcorn ceilings to go. The bathrooms is seriously outdated and showing much wear and tear. Also, a simple lunch which consisted of an app & salad set me back about $40- honestly, with all the great food in NOLA, skip eating at the hotel and venture out for some fab dishes. Kudos to the staff for bringing us a comp bottle of bubbly & sweets to help commemorate our anniversary. I also enjoyed the upstairs pool for a little downtime.

Reviews.Title: “Snookie would love it here”
Reviews.Author: princessitaliaI
Reviews.Content: Never again. Normally the W would not be my choice but this was someone else's pick. We will never make this mistake again. The rooms were small and cramped and obviously set up for a one night business stay. The bathroom vent did not work and was rusted and dusty same as the door hinges. No dresser and small closet that was dominated by the in room safe. The only redeeming feature was the mattress. The staff was generally pleasant but did not seem too concerned with overall issues. Parking was outrageous ($45 a day. this is high even by Quarter standards) so had to find off site parking. The lobby bar was a joke and the bartender apparently could only make you a beer. This hotel is a lot of pretension and hype. There are plenty of great places to stay in New Orleans but this is not one of them. Shop around, you can do better. Please visit New Orleans just stay somewhere cleaner and with a little character. Unless you are an actual cast member from the Jersey Shore, you will not be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DDK914
Reviews.Content: Clean, and nice hotel. Great pool (although a small pool area) and walking distance to the Superdome, French Quarter, and all the sites of N.O.

Reviews.Title: “W woes”
Reviews.Author: nicholasevans
Reviews.Content: After a very delayed flight into New Orleans, me and my party arrived the W New Orleans to check in around 1am. There seemed to be some sort of altercation or disagreement in the lobby which was diverting the attention of the one staff member at the check-in desk. My party waited nearly 30 minutes before anyone recognized that we were there. My friends checked-in to their room and then I went up to check into mine. I asked if there were any SPG Platinum upgrades and the woman at the desk said my upgrade was free internet and water. I asked for a coffee maker to be delivered and the woman at the desk said she'd send one right up. We went up to "the best available room" to settle in. We went to our room and immediately questioned the hotel we were in. The room was not up to the W brand standard and quality. It seemed more like a economy brand than a W. After a few minutes in the room we recognized that the A/C unit was rattling and was not fixable for us. We also began to notice the ice machine hum which was right outside our door. Further, we noticed there were no trash cans in the room when I attempted to throw away something from our flight. There wasn't one in site! We then realized that the bathroom was less than clean. There were toothpaste stains on the mirror, what looked like coffee or dirt stains on the wall, the W water glass mat was half yellow and half white and there was rust on the floor where it seems water pools by the cabinet legs. There was also debris on the toilet. I then noticed there were no towels in our room. Not one towel! The coffee maker I had requested never made it up either. I decided that this was not acceptable, and at 2am now, all we wanted was to get some sleep in our favorite hotel brand.
