I entered the hallway to the smell of marijuana and quickly went back to the desk and was met with the same less than thrilled woman at the front desk. I recognize she had a long night with the many events that were happening in the lobby but I needed to share our frustration. I explained the problems with the room and the woman at the desk said she could move me but forgot the type of room I had reserved. I said again that I didn't care what type of room we were in as long as it was clean and ready for us. The woman didn't seem surprised with any of the items I pointed out with our room that were unacceptable. She moved us up one floor and we began to re-pack our belongings to move. We arrived our new room and it was much better. This room was still not up to the W brand standard that we've come to expect and enjoy. The lamp shades were askew, the side tables and fridge were askew, the toilet seat was broken and the carpet was stained. Once we decided to go to bed the biggest surprise was in store. Our bed sheet was covered in a brown substance. We aren't sure what this substance was but it flaked off when we started scraping it. The one thing, now past 2am, we wished to do was to sleep. Now we were faced with cleaning the bed before we could sleep in it. The next morning I attempted to hop online. Unfortunately, the "free platinum internet", actually all hotel internet, had such weak signals I wasn't able to connect at all in our room. What a disappointing experience for me and my friends. We are here for work and I had suggested rather than staying at the Hilton, where our conference is, that we stay at the W because we love the brand so much. Now I find myself apologizing to my friends and colleagues for having told them to stay here. We've stayed at W's all over the world and this hotel does not live up to the brand. The next day I called to the front desk as I had a "welcome message". The gentleman said I needed to go down to the front desk to get it. I also asked for a knife to cut bread that I had in the room and he said he would send one right up. An hour later there was no bread knife delivered. I went to the front desk and asked for the note that was left for me. I was informed there was no note. I let the lady at the desk know that I had received a voice mail saying I had a note at the front desk. She again said I had no note. She then opted to check a different box and saw I did indeed have a note. I again asked for a bread knife. She said she would have it delivered right away. That bread knife never arrived. Our friends who were staying at the W per my recommendation also experienced woes. One friend needed to switch rooms as hers was also dirty. She was given keys to a new room and walked into a couple who were naked on the bed! She went back to the front desk and they said "oh, we thought your last name was Smithâ€¦not Schmidt". Ms. Smith was already comfortable in her room. :) She was given a third room which was cleaner but smelled of pot. On our third night we arrived back to our room and it had never been cleaned (and this was at 1030pm). No new towels, no bed made, nothing. Our friends at the W also reported that their room had not been cleaned either. On check out day I received my portfolio under my door. I opened it up and noticed that my room rate of $130 was instead $489! No wonder the hold on my AmEx was nearly $3000. Also, this was a prepaid rate by my business. I shouldn't have been charged for the room. I went down to the desk and inquired about the bill. I was informed my room rate was indeed $489 a night. I explained that I had a prepaid rate of $130 a night. The front desk agent explained that he didn't know why I had to pay for the room now if it was prepaid. The bill was not able to be finalized before I needed to leave for the airport. I was very much looking forward to my stay at the W New Orleans. However, all I looked forward to once there was checking out. Usually the W experience is flawless and this was just not the case this time.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel which could be a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pedro_SF
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W on Poydras which is at a good location: within walking distance to the French Quarter, Mississippi River, good restaurants (including Emeril's) and the trolley lines. Hotel lobby is very modern, chic, cold (in temperature and decor) and noisy even when there's no one there. Room was clean. Plumbing in the bathtub was not working 100% - drains needed clearing and faucets didn't work quite right. Couldn't figure out why they had comforters on the beds in New Orleans. Pool and pool area is small but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Wonderland”
Reviews.Author: Deana B
Reviews.Content: My weekend trip was excellent due to the fact of the wonderful service we got at the W. Just a regular weekend turned into a great time. The staff at the W were very helpful especailly Paul Reed in giving us the Nawlins hospitality. I recommend everyone to stay there. Hotel was nice clean and very cozy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, superb hispitality”
Reviews.Author: Lostandfound1968
Reviews.Content: Great choice and just close enough to The French Quarter. Perfect place to stay on business.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff- Made A Stressful Business Trip A Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Kim C
Reviews.Content: We came to New Orleans from Los Angeles to conduct casting interviews for a new dating show. The staff at the W Hotel New Orleans made us feel right at home! The bell staff was available at the drop of a hat to help us move and store our camera and lighting equipment at the end of each interview day. Special thanks to Kevin, Brian and Lawrence for all of your assistance. I would also like to give a shout out to Ms. Catherine and the housekeeping staff- I am spoiled rotten and loving it. Thank you for the clean, comfortable room I had the pleasure of slipping into each night. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably terrible”
Reviews.Author: sarfromtexas
Reviews.Content: I only wish I had taken photos; were it not for the signage, you would never in a million years know this was a W. If you like toilets that flush without overflowing and rooms that are cleaned between guests, then do not stay here. Otherwise, be prepared to be greeted by urine stains on the toilet, an unmade bed sans pillow cases, and the ambient sound of a constantly running toilet. (oh, and be sure to bring flip-flops.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MBMEsq
Reviews.Content: The staff is excellent and go out of their way to help you and make sure you enjoy your trip. The Acura service is a plus, but make sure you book it days in advance or you won't be able to get it. Daniel is awesome! The walls are pretty much paper thin and you can hear everything in the halls and rooms next door. If you are a light sleeper, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Hip but...”
Reviews.Author: LJRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: If you want to gamble at Harrah's, this is the place for you. Right across the street. If you like your space and prefer to move around in your room (or the pool for that matter), this is definitly not the place for you. The staff were very friendly and the doormen and concierge had great suggestions for places to eat outside the quarter. The parking situation is crazy. $45 / day for valet or nothing at all. We parked at a public lot two blocks away for $10 / day and it was fine. Overall, the rooms were clean and well kept but small for the price paid and the hotel its self was generally loud. The pool is quite small for the number of people using it and probably should be regulated a bit more as the three different bachelor parties we witnessed were beyond obnoxious. It would not be on my list of top choices....maybe if I was in my 20's and used the word "party" a lot but otherwise, I don't think its worth the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, if you like something a little different, this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: MasterTravelMan
Reviews.Content: I am really not sure how to rate the W in New Orleans. This was my first visit to a W. The decor was a dark, old school cool theme. The lobby area, bar were all really very cool. The place had this certain funky appeal that I can't exactly describe. It had this very cool sitting room off the lobby bar that was very private as well as plenty of common area room to stretch out. The rooms were decorated in a similar decor, but when you get the room you know the hotel is an older hotel. It was a little rough around the edges, but it seemed to fit the throw back look. Minor issues: the TP holder fell off the wall and the tub drain was slow. I called the front desk in the morning and they were taken care of when I returned later in the day. I was there for a meeting and the meeting room food was good. I did also eat there for breakfast one morning. The food was OK but I thought the price was way too high. The only issue I had was the internet service was very erratic and slow. You also have to agree to pay per day, but the amount was waived at checkout. We had a large group of techies and maybe we just sucked up all the bandwidth, but everyone in our group was complaining about the internet speed. That is an area for improvement. Overall, if you like something a little different, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette Party Weekend”
Reviews.Author: H_Edgar86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. Very beautiful decor everywhere. The staff was super helpful and went above and beyond to make sure us girls had every thing we needed. There were always candles lit everywhere at night and they changed out the rug in the elevator to say "Good Morning" or "Good Afternoon". Lots of attention to detail. Close enough to Bourbon Street that we always walked. Quiet and comfortable at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby, OK Service, Tired Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KEEPTAHOEBLUE_NICE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four or five times and was just there this past week visiting a friend in town on business. I was living in Birmingham the first couple times I stayed at the W. I've stayed a few times there since moving to New Orleans. One time was in August 2010 when some friends of mine from Maryland came down for their first ever New Orleans visit. It was a wonderful experience with a suite upgrade to the top floor. My last time to stay there was July 29, 2011. Another friend who had never stayed in a W before stayed with me as we wanted to celebrate the end of our summer graduate school classes. This last stay was just ok, especially since my SPG room upgrade was only to a higher floor. The staff is overall friendly. Generally, you are greeted when entering the hotel. At times, the concierge desk friends can be a bit snooty if you're not dressed hiply. I'm more of an outdoors, Chaco, Patagonia, polo shirt guy. The lobby is pretty cool and has been well maintained over the years. The guest rooms are nice but showing age, as many other reviewers have shared. The beds are very comfy. The walls need more color and better artwork. The walls are very thin, and our NOLA night goers are quite loud walking down the hallways. We ordered some chocolate chip cookies and milk for a late night snack. It took quite a while to get them. I told room service two of us would be eating, but they only brought one glass of milk. I asked the lady to bring us another glass and charge it to the room. We never received it. Also, we requested a bag for the ice bucket. The lady who brought it after about 30 min said she had a hard time finding any. I like the pool area and workout facility. The Acura experience is a great idea, but I've never understood why they cannot come back to pick you up. The St. Regis car service does. But, we don't have a St. Regis in NOLA. Hotel parking rates in this city are a bit out of control. I talked with another guest staying there from an Asian country in NOLA for the first time and he said he was disappointed in the room as he had experience much cooler W Hotels other places. Overall, I would stay here again because I am loyal to Starwood (as long as rates are appropriate). I would like to see this property undergo a renewal like the W French Quarter has been experiencing.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked time at The W New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: Great location. Only steps away from the French Quarter. Close enough to walk but far away from the madness that comes with the French Quarter. My girlfriend and I walked The W French Quarter and were SOOOOO glad we choose The W New Orleans. Larger proof top pool, better set up and a great party compared to The W French Quarter. Service was goo, food was great and, most of all, we received amazing service from BIG P!! Pretty much helped us out everyday we stayed at The W New Orleans and made our trip a memorable one! It's always nice to know guys like BIG P are there to help with your W experience. He always went the extra mile for us! Made our vacation that much more enjoyable and his recommendations and advice was always on point! A HUGE THANK YOU TO BIG P!!!

Reviews.Title: “W New Orleans - Always a pleasure...”
Reviews.Author: Msdacko
Reviews.Content: Besides the needed renovation on all the rooms from the wear 'n tear, the service and the price make this trip always a welcome visit. And despite the terrible weather with tropical storm Lee lurking around our entire stay, the hotel was able to entertain us with a concierge that was alert and ready to please the guests.

Reviews.Title: “W- is for Wonderful, WOW and Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Tawnya J
Reviews.Content: The experience with every person that I interacted with from arriving to departing was great! The Martini Bar and Whiskey Blue does not disappoint if you want to stay in the hotel to party. Okay, I must warn you about my next experience called Zoe Lounge. They have the most sinful Bananas Foster. If you are a calorie counter DO NOT ask how many points it is, just start over when you go home. LOL! It is not over for the sinful menu, and when I thought it could not get better they gave me this Zoe Pasta and it was to die for! If you want to sample a little bit of heaven and sin I recommend you book the W-New Orleans. You want be disappointed. The Fantastic Suite was the BOMB!

Reviews.Title: “Great service great location”
Reviews.Author: barbiern
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for my birthday and I have to say the service was wonderful. From the people at the front desk to the concierge, and Acura drivers. They made our stay special and really took care of us. The location is good- across from Mothers ( get a Po Boy and gumbo), and a 15 min walk to French Quarter ($7 cab ride from Burbon St) the concierge helped us book reservations for dinner for my bday and that night when we returned he had dessert waiting for us in our room. That thoughtfulness was appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “In Love...”
Reviews.Author: JavC0
Reviews.Content: I've always been a fan of W Hotels and this is the first time I stayed at the W in New Orleans on Poydras. If you know the W brand, you know what to expect. I loved my room. I stayed in the small double. W Hotels are not known for their spacious rooms, but the size of the room certainly didn't put a damper on my stay. It was clean and the decor is minimal, but spectacular. I love the little touches that make this feel like a luxurious room, but in fact is very afordable. I don't have anything bad to say about the hotel or the room I stayed in. The hotel is close to Bourban Street, but far enough to escape the rowdy drunk tourists. The staff was super friendly and went out of their way ot make sure I had what I needed when I needed it. Restaurant and bar awesome. The bathroom was clean, modern, CLEAN (yes I say it again) and the room smelled like a spa. Also, if you know W, you know their beds. Honestly, the only bad thing I can say is that the bed is som comfortable I wanted to stay in bed all day and watch TV. As a matter of fact, I was there over Labor Day weekend and actually stayed in on a night when all my friends went out because I didn't want to leave the bed (very dangerous bed to fall in love with -- you'll never leave your room.) Props to W for keeping up with brand standards. I love this place and will definitely stay their again (although, I hear there is an even better W in NOLA....hmmm, i may cheat next time and go for the better one), but TRUST, this W is awesome. If anything, they could stand to offer up free internet service to guests. It should be standard practice by now. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as I did!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hair, dirty silverware, and smoke, never again.”
Reviews.Author: Kris3185
Reviews.Content: Ok so I'm actually on night one of a two night stay at the W. I never write reviews, but I couldn't not for this hotel. It's overpriced and has too many stars. The shower had hair in it, there was dirty silverware in the nightstand, and the whole room smelled like smoke. Unfortunately, the windows don't open so there's no way to get rid of the smell. The only upside is the front desk staff is very friendly. Also, the lobby bar doesn't even have basic cable so forget about seeing the opening game of the NFL season with the Saints, in NOLA... absurd. If I was staying here any longer than 2 days, if change hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bkl99
Reviews.Content: So glad we decided to try the W. Got lucky with a room upgrade through American Express to the WOW Suite. It was a huge corner room. Had a sitting area with a couch, two chairs, dinning table, TV, and mini bar. Then the bedroom with another TV, and the bathroom was huge with a glass shower and big jacuzzi tub. Not sure how the "standard" rooms are, but this one was perfect. We could see half of the city! All of the staff were very patient and helpful. Great location across from Harah's Casino and a couple of blocks from Canal and Bourbon Street. We had room service from Zoe (only to use up our hotel credit) and the food was pretty good. Cobb salad, swordfish, crab cakes and flan. It lived up to the bad reviews When we went down to Zoe for breakfast the next morning. Two eggs, potatoes, bacon and toast was $17 and tasted very ordinary. Overall great hotel, especially if you get upgraded, nice staff and within walking distance to a lot of things. OH, they even have car service that will take you anywhere within 6 miles. Came in very handy during the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Very average for a W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many W Hotels, and tend to lean towards them when I can, as I like the fun vibe! This W was very average. The pros: I liked the location - far enough away from the craziness of Bourbon to keep my sanity, but close enough to walk! The staff was very friendly and helpful in suggestions on where to go. The acura driver, I think his name was Paul, was fabulous and really took care of us! As with most W's, they had fresh fruit infused waters upon check in, which was nice upon arrival. The rooms were pretty similar to other W's, and I like the style and the size was decent. The cons: The lobby did not have the "wow" factor that most W's have. The pool was very small, and we had to get out there very early to have a seat at one of only about a dozen chairs. Though both of these were not that important to us, since we spent a lot of time out of the hotel. The housekeeping service was really not good at all. When we arrived, the toiletries were half used and the toilet was visibly dirty. When we went out for the day on Sunday, I stopped by the front desk to tell them that we had taken the DND off and would be out for the night so that the room could be cleaned. It was never cleaned at all, so we had no fresh towels for our showers the next morning. Overall, I agree with others on their reviews - it was the most inexpensive W I have stayed at, so worth the value for the money. You may just want to be clear at check in about when you would like your housekeeping service. One of the guys at the door told me that most of their business is bachelor and bachelorette parties, so maybe this W is just catering to that type of group. Unfortunately, I expected a little bit more, as I like nicer hotels. Would I stay here again? Maybe. But only because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great time and a great place!!”
Reviews.Author: arutha21
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New orleans and the staff at the W Hotel made our stay there very memorable. The hotel lobby is on the small side but extremely posh and classy. They have drinks in the lobby as you come in which is extremely refreshing after you have been walking around in the New Orleans heat! Our room was perfect!! It was modern and stylish with a nice IPOD player that we could use if we chose. They also had some nice snacks and water in the minibar although they were a bit expensive (water bottle-$6) We had a corner room with a nice big bathroom and an extremely comfortable bed! The tub in the bathroom was a bit worn but the room was extremely clean. As far as the restaurant in the hotel Zoe-we only meant to order breakfast once during our stay but ended up ordering breakfast everyday to our room because the food was so delicious. I highly recommend the blueberry pancakes and their wonderful coffee-I could not get enough of it! I spent most mornings at their pool on the 4th floor and although it was small it was quite refreshing. They also have some wonderful lounge chairs set up to relax. We also enjoyed the gym and although on the small side it had adequate machines and weights to work out with. Now onto the wonderful Acura Car Service that the hotel provides. Paul, who was wonderful dropped us off on Frenchman St. and gave us great advice as to where we should go in New Orleans. He even took me to CVS pharmacy and waited for me since I was picking up medicine that I really needed and was not feeling up to par. Travis from the concierge service downstairs was also fantastic. We visited him on numerous occasions and asked him a million questions about what to do and see in New Orleans. Not only was he extremely patient but he was also enthusiastic and very nice. I have only great things to say about the staff from the W hotel-they made my stay in New Orleans fantastic and I will be back. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The seventies called, they want their hotel back”
Reviews.Author: jjsp
Reviews.Content: Dated, shiny black paint, trying to be hip and failed miserably. Noisey...small rooms that need to be redone to bring them into this millennium...just an overall nastiness. I guess I should have known by the price...thanks travelzoo for a NO deal rate.

Reviews.Title: “It's an older hotel with some modern amenities and a very attentive, service oriented staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lennone
Reviews.Content: The concierge checked us in 2hrs earlier than we planned which was great. We were given a preferred guest room on the top floor (23), that had a decent view of some of the older rooftops in the area. Lawrence and Kevin gave us some really good information on things to do in our free time (recommendation for Mandina's and Bon Ton were especially great). The lounges and bars were hip although placed kind of strange. The private nook and the library made for some interesting moments. I liked the gym and though the outdoor fourth floor pool was small it helped stave off the heat. The Poolside service was fast too. The room was spacious though a bit older. They had expensive wired internet that should be replaced with high speed wireless as soon as possible. The bathroom needs updating as the tub is small and a floir tike was broken (it was repaired quickly). The water pressure went ballistic on my girlfriend and scared the living daylights out of her but apparently that was the city's fault. The sheets smelled funny the first night but it was changed out quickly, mattress, sheets, comforters, pillows, and all. Sally, from house cleaning was exemplary and really went the extra mile with keeping everything clean and neat. I'd kidnap her and take her back to DC if I thought I could get away with it. She even hung my suit jackets and left little smiley faced notes on the bed. Absolute sweet heart. We did get a set of month old, expired trail mix but the manager brought up new ones, comped them, and a six pack of Fuji water. The pretty dark-skinned girl with braces who served us breakfast was awesome too. Her and the other waitress are really hard workers and make a great team, and more than make up for the phone diva hostess' rudeness. That day off she needed, I recommend giving it to her, a lot of time off actually. All considered, it was a nice stay at an older hotel in a great location close to the river, the French Quarter, and conference centers.The staff tried really hard to make sure we were taken care of. I appreciate them going the extra mile. Hats off to the front desk as well. I hope the W updates this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing... would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: shannon1616
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG member and have stayed in many W hotels which I usually enjoy. This was by far the one of the worst W's I have stayed in. First, it took them half an hour to check me in and it wasn't even busy. Another couple was having an issue and there were plenty of people at the front desk and they kept asking me if I was being helped, when I said no they just said okay you will have to wait. Room was pretty shabby, run down and always seemed dirty. Three times my key stopped working and I had to go down to the front desk to get it fixed. They never refilled the mini bar or waters in the room my entire three night stay. The 2nd night we came in at 6pm from being out all day and our room was not cleaned, no one had come by and when we called they said sorry they forgot about us. The staff is fairly friendly but service is not very good. it just seems this hotel does not have it together. If you have the choice I would stay at the W in the French Quarter. We were torn on where to stay and we made the wrong choice. We checked it out and it was definitely nicer and in a better location. Everything just felt off and dingy. I would definitely never stay here again. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “I've had better...”
Reviews.Author: Travelgouroo
Reviews.Content: Ridiculous for the money... I have had and expected much more from Starwood. The W really let me down... The customer service is horrible!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best place to stay in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: kdlewis985
Reviews.Content: I stay in New Orleans often and the W is always my first choice. The location is perfect, right across from Harrah's in a very safe area, even late at night. The rooms are clean, a bit small, but with the clean W style, it doesn't feel cramped. The service is fantastic. I had a friend leave two dresses in a closet, didn't realize it until a month later, called the W, they still had her dresses and overnighted them to her free of charge! On another occasion, I had a minor complaint which I voiced to one of the managers. The hotel admitted responsibility (anywhere else you would just get a lame excuse), addressed the issue, and I was totally satisfied with how the situation was handled. I'm fairly difficult to please and I've been more than pleased with my experiences at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kiim R
Reviews.Content: Well let me begin by saying I appreciate that the room was comped through Harrahs but next time I would hope Harrahs puts me in their nice hotel. The convenience of the hotel is great but what I went through I will never plan on staying there again!! We arrived at about 4:20 and I was thinking great we can get in the room and rest a little before going out to eat. It was raining outside so I wanted to go up to the room and freshen up before heading across the street to get something to eat. Well I go check in and they tell me my room will be another hour before ready. My family sat on the sofa and waited for that hour, then when I got the room unfortunately I opened the door to see the room belonged to someone else. When I saw that I was so shocked. I ended up finding the lady which was from out of town and she paid for three rooms, she could not believe I had keys to her room. We went down and complain, I tried to keep my cool knowing mine was comped, the lady who had the room was not happy nor did she feel safe in that hotel. I think they ended up comping her a room. Not sure what happen. Finally they gave me another room and when I got to the room that was suppose to be smoke free because I have allergies it smelled nothing but cigarettes. I sprayed all the febreeze I had in my bottle, which did not work. I had no energy to go down stairs for them to tell me I had to wait another hour so I dealt with the smell all weekend. I go to New Orleans almost every month and that was my worse experience ever. I hope that never happens again. The people who work behind the counters are not that friendly. They walk around like they own the place. I did not like the atmosphere at all. We did eat at Zoe"s I was satisfied with my waiter and the food was good!! I hope I never experience that again. It pretty much ruined my birthday weekend, my whole family could not believe the smell in the room from the smoke. Good luck to the next person who stays there!

Reviews.Title: “Park It”
Reviews.Author: Rider123
Reviews.Content: This is my third chance for this property, where twice before I stayed away because the valet parking situation is so bad. Business travelers, like myself, always call down for a care parked by the hotel if we are to stay on time. Once I missed a flight and this past week late for an appointment because this Hotel just cannot get its act together on parking. The property is nice but it seems they either fix this situation or will only get guest who fly in for conventions without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for mixing business with pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Silly_Goose13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The W for the ALA conference in June 2011 and was completely satisfied with my stay. The room was large and had plenty of space for all my conference paraphernalia. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was just right. I know the hotel was packed, but I never heard anyone else when I was in my room. Highlights: - Every employee was pleasant and helpful. - I asked for a late check out to give myself a little extra site seeing time before my flight, and was granted it without issue. So many places aren't willing to provide this, so I REALLY appreciated it. - The bar had good drinks and good bartenders. - I only ate in the restaurant once, but it was delicious. - I love the beverage dispensers at the frontt desk. After walking around in New Orleans, it was refreshing to get a drink upon arrival. The lobby is small but welcoming and posh. - The location is good for conference attendees who also wish to site see - kind of in between the 2 places. Negatives, which are minor: - I hate having to pay for internet access, so I didn't bother. - The minibar offerings were spread out around the room, and there were a lot of them. Seemed a bit unnecessary. I didn't have time to to advantage of the pool or car service. The W New Orleans helped make my conference a pleasant experience, and I can't wait to visit again to have more fun!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: windows740
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, especially the concierge, a young man who gave the best service and the best tips on how to navigate the gorgeous city of New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thomas P
Reviews.Content: Well maintained hotel rooms, helpful staff, free in town transport service (if available), fair size swimming pool on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: stetson
Reviews.Content: I have been staying regularly at the W New Orleans over the last three years. The staff always greets me by name, and goes out of their way to make me feel welcomed. There is a very nicely appointed workout room that is rarely busy in the morning. There is a a very cool (small) pool with comfortable chairs and three private areas to hang out. The hotel is a little worn but clean. Very close to the Quarter, but not as crazy as a hotel located there (as is the other NOLA W)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not up to "W" standards”
Reviews.Author: chinny100
Reviews.Content: Hotel decor is very nice. However the hotel has many drawbacks and I cannot recommend staying here. Specific problems include: - Walls are very thin. We could easily hear TV, Radio, and children coughing in adjoining room. - Windows are small; rooms felt like caves (even the spacious Spectacular corner room that we stayed in.) - Internet service is very poor. Hotel's wireless Internet was hacked by a a local private Wireless provider (they want you to pay them, not the W), rendering it unusable in many of the rooms, so the only safe Internet was the wired. Download speed averages 200 kbps and upload speed was 380 kbps, indicating problem is that they just haven't provisioned enough bandwidth. - Only one outlet on the desk (but hotel did nicely bring a power strip.) - No plug-in for video screen for my HDMI device, so I could only watch my movies on laptop (they do provide a DVD player, however.) - Restaurant has limited menu (of course, you are in New Orleans, so you should not be eating at hotel.) - Two of three elliptical runners in gym were broken.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Good location, Just Be Prepared”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust-in-NYC
Reviews.Content: A few friends wanted to have a get together in New Orleans. We looked at different packages and decided to try out the W New Orleans. Summary: Overall, the staff and the people who work here go above and beyond. They truly care about the guests. The rooms are average to above average. The hotel has a lot of bachelor/bachelorette and birthday parties with people looking to have a good time in NOLA. Finally, the prices are on the expensive side so be weary. Location: The hotel is about 20 - 30 minutes from the airport and located a few blocks from the border of the French Quarter. The hotel is across the street from Harrah's Casino (great for any gambler or even occasional slot player). Mother's Restaurant is nearby, but there are not many stores nearby. The nearest one is a few block walk. The reason I bring this up is if you want a bottle of water (for less than $6 at the hotel rate), you will need to stock up and go to another place. Hotel: The lobby is really nice. There are curtains that are motion sensing and nice colors. The elevators need to be activated by a room key in order to go to your room. The best amenity is the convenience car (Acura) that will drop off (no pick up) in a 6 mile radius. The pool is on the 4th floor, with a bar. It is a scene to be seen. I saw a few families there with children, but the vast majority of people were lounging. The gym is in front of the pool and is indoors. It has some nice exercise equipment. Room: They are average to above average. I had some problems with the key, they get de-magnetized very quickly. However, BEWARE the small $6 small bottles of water around the room. Also, the TV had limited channels. The staff cleaned the rooms decently. Finally room service is 24 hours, but very expensive. There is an added 30% total surcharge (tax, tip, service fees, etc.) to anything ordered. The beds are definitely "W" beds. There is also a lounging long chair that can be slept on and used for quick naps. Some tips in general about NOLA: * Goto Johnny's for some po boy and mufliatta (sp?) sandwiches; * Goto Emeril's Restaurant; * Goto Muriel's and ask very politely about the ghost tour; and * Just hang out on Frenchman Street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: sharonjcovert
Reviews.Content: Staff is superb all the way around. From concierge to wait staff to housekeeping to porters. Everyone is friendly and personable. All the advice about where to go was right on. I highly recommend from decor, weight room, pool, food, bars. Only drawback I can see is that somewhere during the building of the hotel the contractors must have saved a lot of money by not putting in enough insulation between rooms. The sound between rooms was not muffled enough to give maximum privacy. Still a killer location.

Reviews.Title: “My kind of hotel in my kind of city.”
Reviews.Author: FreshSqueeze
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of finding a hotel for my group of 8 friends. The W seemed like a good choice based on price, location and amenities such as the Acura car service, pool and two bars. I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews here, but all of our rooms were clean and the hotel seemed well maintained. The staff were very pleasant from the front desk to the bartenders and especially Danny, the concierge. He hooked us up with last minute reservations at Restaurant August with a tour of the kitchen by the chef and arranged an airboat ride in the swamp. My one gripe would be that the hotel doesn't offer airoprt transportation. Overall we had a great experience at the W and would stay there again. The location is perfect if you want to close enough to walk to the French Quarter but far away enough to be able to get away from the nonstop party for a little downtime.

Reviews.Title: “Charlie Sheen would love this place.”
Reviews.Author: soonertourist
Reviews.Content: We visited the W New Orleans for a medical convention. The ambience seemed completely incongruous with the participants in the course. The hotel lobby and bars are beautiful and modern, and the concierge desk is full of polite, helpful people. Everyone in the facility was on top of their game, except for housekeeping. We had to call directly after check-in and ask for someone to re-clean the room. The bathroom had hair all over the floor and tub. After she finished, we noticed a crusty stain on the beautiful chaise lounge. We felt bad calling her back to clean again, so we assumed housekeeping would clean it the next day. It was still there 3 days later when we checked out. The walls are paper thin, and the art upon the walls was distasteful. Enough said. The hotel was full of bachelor and bachelorette parties, with all of the implications. If this is your bachelor or bachelorette party and you don't mind your drunk friends making a fool out of themselves in front of strangers before passing out on a chair in front of the entrance, and if you don't mind your friends' bottles and drink cups still laying around on the patio the morning after you left them there, then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in the quarter”
Reviews.Author: traveljunky3739
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for one night. I paid total $240.00 for one night (this did not include room service). The room was small, cramped, and dirty. The furniture was cheap and in poor condition. The front desk staff was rude and too busy chatting with one another. I am from louisiana and have stayed at many hotels in the french quarter. This was by FAR the worst and most overpriced. I would rather sleep at the krystal burger than ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: ktbrandon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W last weekend and had a great trip. The lobby has a really nice bar with plenty of space to have a drink(the watermelon drinks were so good). The gym is bright and clean, the pool is a bit small but we didn't use it. The location is perfect to walk around the different areas in town. The rooms are average and close, you will hear others(pillows are excellent). We didn't expect it to be the same as the W in NYC, most hotels are older in New Orleans. Travis was a fantastic help with dinner/bar ideas, we loved all of his suggestions. The ruby slipper is a great place for breakfast/lunch and close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very friendly place. Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: setcarp
Reviews.Content: The night I was there was a stormy night and the Television was all fuzzy from the rain and the internet was not working. Upon check out when I complained about the $15 internet that did not work, the girl at the desk never even looked up. I got a dismissive response from her. As a matter of fact I do not think anyone would look the guests in the eyes. From the guys at the door on their phones to the rude staff behind the counter. The location is right next to Harrah's and there is a Gordon Biersch that has great food and beers. The French Quarter is not a far walk where you will see another W hotel and you will ask yourself why you did not stay at this location. I travel for a living and take this sort of attitude from hotel staff as an insult. Keep looking before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Not so W esque”
Reviews.Author: Travel_bum99
Reviews.Content: You walk into a chic modern lobby that is typical of any W hotel but after check in you go to your fairly average looking room, which is out of context for the W's typical modern and comfortable rooms. We also found that the hotel forgot to replace soaps, were missing pages from their hotel directories and didn't pick up the phone at the front desk. The walls of the room were so thin that at one point in the evening I woke up thinking someone was in the room, because the people in the neighboring room were speaking so loudly. The pool area is a poor attempt at having a swanky a pool setting with it being on part of the roof with very little sitting area around it. Overall it wasn't a bad hotel but far from what I expect when I stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Custormer Service”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrails33027
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this fabulous hotel on a brief weekend visit to New Orleans for a friend's birthday. The hotel staff is absolutely phenomenal. From the time we checked in to the time we left, we were made to feel welcome. I am not exaggerating when I say, the "W" team catered to our every need. Krystal, in particular, at the front desk, took great care of the entire group and went above and beyond to accommodate our every request. This hotel's emphasis on customer service is a guarantee that I will definitely be back on my next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: gaillynn29
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this beautiful hotel. Not only is hotel gorgeous and perfectly appointed, but the staff was outstanding ---Very friendly, helpful, courteous, and solicitous. Our check in experience couldn't have been better--- mostly due to Krystal. She was helpful in many ways. Krystal made us feel welcome, assisted with Starwood membership, answered all our questions, and told us of all the amenities we had at our disposal. Would certainly return to the W.

Reviews.Title: “It had it's good points, but parking fees too high”
Reviews.Author: Laurawade01
Reviews.Content: The location was great, right next to Harrah's and Mother's resturant. Close to Magazine St. which had tons of great places to eat. I recommend Bon Ton Cafe and Pie (pizza) out of this world! Parking for this hotel was $35.00 per day. Front desk staff could be a little friendlier. Courtyard in front kind of dirty, but ok. Rooms are nice, we had a great view of the River Walk. Beds comfortable. No in room coffee maker and a pot from room service around $20.00. Overall I was happy with the accomodations. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is on point!”
Reviews.Author: judithmbell
Reviews.Content: The customer service at the W is awesome! From the parking staff to the lobby/check in staff to Paul Reed the concierge at the Whatever/Whenever Desk, my experience with the staff has been extremely helpful. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “What an upset”
Reviews.Author: ramirezfamilytrav11
Reviews.Content: I love the W brand and stay with them when I can, but this visit was crazy. The booking went smooth but the check in and the rest of the stay was nuts. They checked us into the wrong room , would not clean my room on time, we would get back from a long day and wanting to take a shower our put our daugther down and the room wou ld not be cleaned, there charged me incorrectly for the room and the charges. It was just a frasturling mess. They did give me a 75.00 credit and a breakfast for the inconvenice but they should of given me more. It was a week later and I was still dealing with credit card issues. The breakfast was EXPENSIVE and tasteless we like to travel to New Orleans but next time a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: PresidentialMerge
Reviews.Content: We were here for my husband's work conference and what a RIP OFF! No vending machines, no free wi-fi ($7.95 per every 15 minutes) and the service was horrible for the money you pay. $35 night to park your car. A bottle of water in the room was $6. Unless you are so stinkin' rich and money is truly no object, then this is most likely your hotel. They expect you tip for every move the staff makes on your behalf (even if the staff never follows through or you have to ask 5 times minimum). The cleaned our room and never even gave us all our towels back for the ones they took. While the hotel is beautifully decorated and the location is very nice, I still don't recommend it. The A/C there is great, I must say that. Oh and some of the performers for Harrah's, which is next door, stay there if you are into chasing fame.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a couple of nights, but wifi dropout plagued our stay”
Reviews.Author: SinBado
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasant stay. The staff couldn't be more helpful, however small things like coffee facilities not being in the room (although they could be requested), and the wifi constantly dropping out was inconvenient. would I recommend, all things considered, yes

Reviews.Title: “Bday Celebration in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JustKaramel
Reviews.Content: First let me tell you that I absolutely love 'da big easy' but the W New Orleans made my trip perfect. Check-in was easy @ I'm a SPG member -- I was fortunate enough to be the WOW member and I don't know what that means but I liked it. Upgraded to a suite with a separate living room/w wetbar, card table -- the folks even put balloons and chocolates in my room w/a card wishing me the best. Staff was great, pool was not gigantic but a nice place to sit back and relax. As always everything was uber modern - good location just 2-3 blocks to Cafe Du Monde - can you spell beignets? So great location, room price was reasonable about$100 a night - clean but my only complaint $40 a night for parking -- WOW -- not something to cough at. You probably don't need a car with the St. Charles trolley 4 blocks away and you're in walking distance to the quarter but it's something to consider. thanks W.

Reviews.Title: “Where the W stands for WORST - Don't Stay There!!”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Diva1
Reviews.Content: I decided to do something spontaneous and booked me and hubby three nights at the W Poydras, so we jumped in the car at 11:00 PM and drove to New Orleans for the weekend from Atlanta. We arrived early and the hotel staff was great and allowed us to check-in early upon arrival. The hotel staff is wonderful, very friendly and accommodating from the bell staff to the valet parking guys, the Concierge and Front Desk. When I returned to my room later that day, I noticed several food trays on the floor, it's normal to see these on the floor from room service. What wasn't normal was the MOUSE I saw running from eating off the trays. I was terrified from that point on! I HATE snakes, cockroaches and rodents. I was horrified, I contacted Whatever/Whenever to let them know and she said what can we do and I requested they move me to another floor. The hotel was completely sold out and so was the rest of the city due to the music festival and I was stuck at that hotel. So I moved to another floor and basically was uncomfortable the rest of the my stay. The bath tubs in this hotel are utterly disgusting, ALL OF THEM need to be resurfaced, all of them look filthy. As soon as the sun rose on Sunday morning I checked out and couldn't wait to get home, hoping one of those rodents didn't crawl into one of our bags. I kept everything high and off the floor just in case. It was really sad, because I've stayed at this location before and never had a problem, it just seems the years have not been good to this property. I ordered a drink one night at the restaurant bar and they served my Martini in a plastic cup. It was appalling. Whisky Blue was fun and they play great music and great atmosphere. I was completely disappointed. I won't stay there EVER again, if you're looking for a better Starwood Brand stay at the Westin at Canal Place it's very nice, great location and rodent FREE!! If you're looking for GREAT Poboys go to Mahony's Po-Boy Shop at 3454 Magazine Street, great restaurant with nice and friendly locals. It's nice to see the city continue to rebound and we wanted to support them in their efforts.

Reviews.Title: “awesome place; great staff; legit location.”
Reviews.Author: mtx1000
Reviews.Content: stay here. great staff. close to everything. harrah's across the street. a 5 minute walk to bourbon (and you get to catch some zzzzs). rooms are real modern and cool.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris72206
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during our NOLA trip. The architecture and design of the hotel, including the rooms, is very modern an chic, which gives it an energetic vibe. Nice little bar in the lobby with friendly bar staff (and good drinks). We went to the Whiskey Blue one night after dinner as well, which was fun. This hotel is very well situated to check out the French Quarter, and it has lots of restaurants in very close proximity - Mother's, Restaurant August are just a couple that we tried (bith excellent). The hotel has a nice (but small) outdoor pool and lounge area. You have to pay for wifi, which is kind of lame.

Reviews.Title: “Paul is the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: carly_z
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a complimentary car that will drive guests anywhere within a 6 mile radius. On the way to dinner with my co-worker one night, I mentioned to our driver, Paul, that I really wanted to have an authentic crawfish meal before we left New Orleans. He immediately told us he had just the spot. We abandoned our dinner plans and went with Paul to a seafood market where he told us exactly what to order (5 lbs of crawfish and 1lb of shrimp.. I highly recommend it) and even took us to an awesome daquiri shop to top off the meal! On the way there, he gave us a little history of the area we were in and the way it had been affected by Katrina. He drove us back to the hotel, where my co-workers and I indulged in an INCREDIBLE dinner by the pool! He went above and beyond.. thanks again, Paul!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at W - N.O.”
Reviews.Author: JAR303
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent two-night stay at the W New Orleans. Style/design was the typical W decor - very modern and sophisticated. Valet service was very friendly and efficient. Check-in at the Welcome Desk was very speedy and very polite. The design of the Living Room (lobby) and the Whiskey Blue bar was gorgeous and very sensual. I was assigned to a 'fabulous' room on the 18th floor overlooking the river - very nice indeed. Room has nice modern photo art and crisp, clean design lines. Room itself was spotlessly cleaned and rather spacious for a city hotel. Everything was in good working order. A/C worked well as did the shower temp and pressure. Bed and linens are wonderful as they are at all Ws that I've visited. Enjoyed time at the outdoor pool - it was a real treat to enjoy the pool in the sun with the warm breezes, right in the middle of the city. Workout facility (Sweat) was excellently equipped. Had dinner at the hotel restaurant, Zoe. It was deserted - we were the only people there for dinner. A bit disconcerting - why is a restaraunt in N.O empty at 7:00p.m. The entrees that we had were very good - so I guess it was just a slow night. Also enjoyed breakfast at this same place the following morning. A late checkout request was cheerfully granted, and bell service, valet, and checkout were perfectly and efficiently handled. Only minor quibbles: 1) Newspaper was never delivered to the room, though it was listed as an amenity - nor did I see them anywhere in the Living Room. 2) The place was nearly empty on one of the nights that I was there - nobody at the restaraunt, less than a dozen people in the Living Room and Whiskey Bar. While this isn't the hotel's fault - it just didn't feel as lively as a typical W stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....Hotel Needs a renovation”
Reviews.Author: BernardsDad
Reviews.Content: Well where do I startâ€¦This is my wife and Iâ€™s 7th stay at the W New Orleans, and we were very disappointed. We make a year trip to New Orleans, and have been staying here the past 7 years. This stay, we stayed in a Fantastic Suite, like we always do, but our stay and the room were not so Fantastic. First off, our check in was supposed to be at 3pm, apparently that means 6pm in this hotels eyes. We had just finished a long day of travel to get to New Orleans, and we didnâ€™t feel too welcomed having to wait so long to get into our room. Apparently they couldnâ€™t get the guest out of the room, and we were the ones who had to pay the price. This is completely unacceptable, and shouldnâ€™t be our problem. After checking in 3 hours late, not a single apology from the hotel, again this is unacceptable. So we get to our room, which has a main bedroom, and then a separate living room. We were excited because we were having friends over that we havenâ€™t seen in years. The room itself is a great room, but this particular room in the hotel was the sparsest suite I have ever stayed at a W New Orleans, and I know this because we have stayed in this room before. Decorations missing from the wall, coffee table had no books and no decorations, and the dining room table had 2 missing chairs. How does a hotel let someone walk off with chairs? Chaise lounge had no pillows, so I think that makes it a bench with armrests and not a chaise. I called the front desk to let them know, and they sent the manager to the room. I showed her the missing chairs, and she told me that they would get us two more chairs pillow and decorations, but they never came. So we had a pretty good start to our stay ;-). We didnâ€™t end up inviting our friends over because we didnâ€™t have enough sitting area in the room because of the missing chairs. On top of being disappointed with our room, and the late check in, the hotel itself really is starting to show its age. Our favorite place in the hotel to hang out is on the second floorâ€¦.but. The lounge had lots of broken furniture, torn drapes on the windows, and even broken light fixtures hanging from the ceiling wires exposed and all. The other common areas in hotel had dirty furniture, missing pillows, and broken furniture as well. We have loved this hotel in the past, but it just doesnâ€™t seem that anyone is paying attention to the detail anymore. My wife and I have traveled around the world, and we actually go to Cities that have Wâ€™s just so we can see them all. After this stay at this W, I am not so sure that we will be doing this anymore. We were completely disappointed by this stay and hope that someone takes a good look at their hotel. One thing that I think sets Wâ€™s apart from other boutique hotels has always been their attention to detail, and the W New Orleans has totally overlooked doing that. Come on W New Orleans, get your act together.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: scotlandgal74f
Reviews.Content: After double charging us for our room, they also falsely charged us for phone calls and room service. They were not service oriented and everything cost something extra. They didn't have any coffee sation (at least that was noticable) and when we went to the pool they shut the bar down two days in a row at 4:30pm. There was no real customer service. The management did amend the wrongful charges after a lengthy and embarrassing discussion in the lobby. We won't be back and it tainted our view of the famed W hotels of which we expected grand things!

Reviews.Title: “Saftey is an issue!”
Reviews.Author: hp_1
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying I never write reviews because I am usually too lazy to revisit issues when I return from a trip. But this experience was quite unique (sorry for the length). 1 hr after checking into the hotel, I was in the bathroom getting ready for dinner and the door opened. To my surprise (and theirs) a family of four was issued a key to the SAME room. Since I was half dressed at this point, I think this family got a little more than they signed up for. Clearly embarrassed, they apologized and headed back down to the front desk of the hotel for the right room assignment. About 10 minutes later, hotel security came up to check and see if I was correct occupant (really nice British guy) and explained that it was probably a computer glitch. I understand, these things happen. Since I was heading out to dinner and leaving my computer and jewelry in the room, I went downstairs and asked to speak to the manager to ensure this would not be an issue. After 15 minutes, the manager came out of her office, chatted with some friends who were in the lobby and then seemed as if she would return back to her office! The women at the desk signaled her over and I explained what happened with the key mix-up. She interrupted me and said; "Just get a new key" with a nasty attitude and then went back in her office. The woman at the front desk was so embarrassed by the behavior of her manager that she issued me a $70 comp for drinks, (which was actually really nice of her). By this time we were running late for dinner and had reserved the hotel car to drop us off. As we go outside to wait for the ride, the driver tells us they doubled booked and there is a party of 8 waiting to be dropped of in the French quarter. At that point, we just hopped in a cab. Since bad things come in triplicate, I was just waiting for the other shoe to drop. I checked out 5 days later only to realize that they made a mistake on the bill and charged me 2X the amount for two days. Again, Ashley at the front desk was great about taking the time to correct this, but it took 45 minutes to sort out and I ended up missing my morning meeting. Within 2 hrs of checking into the hotel, I can honestly say I have had the worst service of any hotel I have ever stayed in at the W New Orleans. I have stayed in W hotels before, this one does not even compare. Pros: The individuals who work at the front desk are great, extremely helpful (ask for Ashley or Lilly- they are awesome). Cons -Safety (always keep the safety latch on your door) -Managers are not very professional -Do not reserve the car if you need to be someplace in a timely manner -Check your bill before you leave the hotel to make sure you are not overcharged -Cleanliness was moderate at best. Food on the couch and towels with make-up after washing.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and the staff were superb, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Sam1234088
Reviews.Content: I was so surprised that when we checked in about 5 PM our rooms were not ready yet. The staff at the front desk (NIKKI) said that she was going to put a $100.00 credit towards my room without me asking. This was a very nice surprise, and it showed that they value your stay at the hotel. Great staff, everyone was helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay and the pet sitting was a plus!!!”
Reviews.Author: wzwang128
Reviews.Content: Was there with a couple of friends in Dec, 2010. Figured that you can never go wrong with the W. Although the weather isn't that great (actually, very cold), the staff made us feel very welcomed. The amenities have everything we need. The place is more tailored to young folks, but due to their pet-friendly policy, we decided to stay there and no regrets at all! This is all due to their non-refundable pet fee would also include dog-sitting. My little doggie loved the company of the staff, and the staff were extremely sweet to my dog. Truly appreciate how my doggie was taken care of, when we weren't able to take him with us.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: FredTheCatTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over Memorial Weekend and the hotel was packed however service was excellent. Fantastic beds, cool hotel, great pool. Our room was great and we did not have any off the worn issues others have mentioned in their reviews. Had a high floor with great views of downtown New Orleans. I'm a marathoner but this hotel for me was still a long walk to Bourbon Street. If you are going to just party, stay closer but if you are older than college age and you want to see all of the French Quarter, Garden District, CBD, Warehouse, etc, this hotel is well located. The Acura Service is great! Only con was there wasn't enough room at the pool and the hotel should open up more of that roof space for cabanas and loungers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for conference center and aquarium”
Reviews.Author: SkyLar_10
Reviews.Content: I was I. Town for a conference at the Hilton Riverside, but that place booked early so I ended up here. Modern decor and great great staff. If you want walking distance to the French Quarter you might want to try elsewhere, but even that was a quick (and cheap) cab ride away. You hear "stories" about NO but I always felt safe here. My ONLy quibble is that there was this completely dysfunctional family who was in the room next to us for most of our stay and had screaming matches that you could easily hear through the walls and happened as late as 3AM (really) Not fun to deal with when you have to get up and work the next day. Repeated complaints were made from us and (according to the folks at the front desk at least three others including people on different floors) and nothing was done. Please please please think of those of us who really do need a quiet stay and don't hesitate to evict the rowdy sleep ruiners next time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Get your WiFi fixed!”
Reviews.Author: SteamboatScott
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this is a nice hotel. The staff is really nice too. That said, I have a real problem with a high end hotel that does not have good Wifi service in the rooms. Also missing is in room coffee makers. Sorry, but having to walk down to the lobby to get a cup of coffee and use Wifi first thing in the morning just doesn't cut it in this day and age. Beds were very comfortable, but they should be for $200 per night. Food in Zoe's was better than expected. Paul the bellman was awesome. I will not come back until there is reliable in room Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not worth the $250 a night”
Reviews.Author: darightman4u
Reviews.Content: Me and the misses visited the hotel for the Jazz Festival. It wasnt in walking distance of the fair grounds but it was only a 5 minute taxi ride away. A call to the front desk on my way out the door and a taxi was waiting for me when I got to the lobby. The decor was very modern and elegant. There are a couple of bars inside the hotel that are all nice. There is also a bar/lounge that plays various music with a dim relaxing ambiance. Unfortunately the Spectacular room itself wasnt that spectacular. When you walk into the room it looks about standard. The king bed was comfy and again the room had the modern design but nothing too fancy. The wireless internet which is not complimentary did not work with my laptop. Contacted the front desk who pointed me to tech support and they were unable to assist. The wired connection worked. Overall I would recommend this hotel no problem. Its right across the street from Harrah's casino and the riverwalk is within walking distance as well. For the price vs. offerings I feel as though you are paying more for the decoration than the room.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the wrong hotel”
Reviews.Author: wkr011
Reviews.Content: Lovely, modern and up to date but not what I was looking for in New Orleans. I should have stayed at the French Quarter W Hotel. Location was just outside the French Quarter and it took some walking each day to get in and around the FQ. Hotel rooms fitted out very modern style and staff always very courteous. It was a bit to modern to relax in the lounge and enjoy a coffee. It seemed to be a great business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Being charged twice for our stay has put us off an otherwise great hotel”
Reviews.Author: danpearson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the W New Orleans in February. We arrived at around midnight after about 30 hours of travelling and were shocked to be told that unfortunately the hotel had overbooked for the first night of our stay, and they didn't have room for us. Luckily the hotel next door had rooms, and the W had booked us in there and covered the cost. We were tired and it was an inconvenience to have to unpack, and pack up the next day - leaving us feeling not quite settled in, and we were glad to finally be able to check in at the W the next day. We had a lovely stay - clean rooms, nice staff, great decor, fantastic location etc. and thought nothing more of our stay until 2 months later when we received a credit card charge for the W New Orleans. The hotel had messed up and booked us in as new guests when we had returned to the hotel after our one night at the hotel next door, and so even though we had already paid for the room, they charged us again as 'walk in' customers. It was a shock to say the least to receive the credit card bill, having not accounted for such a large charge - we had been given no prior notice from the hotel before taking this money which may be a legal issue. After several phone calls and emails, we finally resolved the issue but it took a further week for the money to be transferred back into our account, leaving us short of money, and at a Â£5.00 loss with the exchange rate! The inconvenience and poor record keeping/checking in procedures have left us not wanting to return to an otherwise great hotel. We are heading back to New Orleans in August and had planned to stay here, but will now go elsewhere! Who wants unexpected credit card charges 2 months after their stay?!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the W Hotel were absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: travellam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at W during AIA Convention in May. Paul, the valet guys, the drivers, the concierge, they were all terrific. We had at least 30 staff at the hotel and everyone was very accomodating. In fact, one of my colleagues "lost" her husband and child for several hours (coming back from zoo, dead cell phone, all was well in the end) and the W staff were incredibly helpful and kind. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best, Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: jymmyca
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, the service was tremendous. Sincere smiles and great attitudes from the door-men to the front desk clerks. No problem is to big or small here. My room was perfect with a view overlooking the canal and Harrah's casino. I will never stay anywhere else in New Orleans. Traveled alone during the French Quarter Festival and was giving a curteosy ride to Frenchmen St. by the concierge during the evening. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service and Rundown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 44frequentflyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 10 times since January 2011, so when I say I know this hotel inside and out, I really know this hotel inside and out. The only reason I stay at this hotel is because we get a great corporate rate and my boss makes us stay there. That's it--plain and simple. The service is outstandingly bad...staying at this hotel is akin to throwing your money at cheap motel. The worst part is that they never fix the things they mess up on. Let me elaborate, with a list of all the things that have gone wrong during my stays. 1. I am always overcharged. The W has a problem here; my colleagues and I have rarely, if ever, gotten appropriate charges on our bill. They try to tag on mini-bar charges or extra valet dollars. It's happened probably 75% of my stays here. 2. Room service is a sham. You come to the W because Starwood is known for its customer service....not here. I order food, and it gets there with astonishingly slow speed. and it's never the correct order. And then it takes one....two....three calls to get someone to bring up the missing items. 3. The cleanliness is not on par with a top-tier hotel. In my bathroom when I checked in, there was a short, curly black hair lying underneath my water cup on top of the coaster. The carpets are all stained as well as the comforters. 4. The clientele here is sub-standard for a W. I was awoken mid-week by druken revelers who were shouting profanities. The front desk did nothing to alleviate the situation. 5. They can't do a celebration right. For Valentines Day, a surprise was arranged for me by my significant other with the front desk. Needless to say, that never happened. And then they overcharged him for the champagne. This is just a sample of the numerous difficulties I have had. The staff is slow, unapologetic, and generally rude. Worst "high end" hotel I have ever stayed at, bar none. The only redeeming characteristics are the nice gym, soft beds, and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Can't go wrong here.”
Reviews.Author: bondocrob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during jazz fest each of the last 2 years. Good location but could be 2 blocks closer to quarter. Being next to Mother's is certainly a plus. Very comfortable beds. Friendly service. Towels delivered quickly when requested. Main complaint is a sewage smell in the lobby by elevators that was present last year too. I guess they can not get rid of it but did have a guy spraying a fragrance in the air around the lobby. Solid hotel but even better deal when using Starwood points.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Rooms but Dirty”
Reviews.Author: sgorelik
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights in late April. The location of the hotel is great -very close to French Quarter, the promenade and everything else. The rooms are OK size and the staff is quite friendly. We did have a big problem with general cleanliness and upkeep of the hotel. First room we were given reeked of weed. When we complained to the reception they switched our room without any problems. The second room was OK but whenever housekeeping came through you got the feeling that they were simply rearranging things rather than cleaning. Milk stains on the table from my son's breakfast the first morning stayed there until the last day. This was a good reflection of general cleanliness of hotel's public areas. The pool was just a mess anytime after 4pm or so and it was simply unpleasant to be there. Coupled with smaller problems like lack of wifi in the room anywhere outside the bathroom, poorly flushing toilet, and shower that didn't really switch between tub and shower waterflow the whole stay was missing the general W quality that we enjoyed on our other stays with this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, staff not concerned with guest needs”
Reviews.Author: Duckland_11
Reviews.Content: As a very frequent Starwood guest (platinum member) I have stayed at many Westin, and Sheraton properties.Â  I have always enjoyed the great service I have been treated to, however, the W New Orleans left me never wanting to return.Â  I literally had a front desk staff look at me and insist that the issue was my problem and what did I want to do.Â  As you would expect it was to speak to his manager.Â  While the manager tried hard to remedy the issue and comment that it was the Hotels problem and could have been remedied pretty easily, the first impression was made.Â  I will not return.Â  The issues are not the guests problems.Â  Definately this hotel needs to work with its "Talent".

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: wes74
Reviews.Content: I've been to New Orleans many times and each time I end up staying at a different hotel. Not sure what the deal is with New Orleans, but hotel standards in this city are far below that of other U.S. cities. With that said, the W New Orleans has been the best hotel I've stayed at in New Orleans thus far. The building is old and it clearly shows, but the W has done a good job in maintaining the property and providing a clean and enjoyable stay. The service is fantastic at this hotel and the lobby and public areas are very trendy. The location is right across the street from Harrah's Casino and about 7 blocks from Burbon Street. As a Starwood platinum member I was upgraded to one of their corner suites which was a great perk. The suite had 2 rooms, one room was a bedroom while the other room was more of a living room with a dining table and wet bar. The internet worked in the bedroom, but did not work in the living room so that was kind of a bummer since I would have liked to spread my work out on the table. I was impressed by the selection of TV channels and the on screen 'guide' that could be accessed through the remote. The DVD player in my room was also a great perk! I love the beds/pillows at the W and got a great night sleep. This property has a huge fitness center with dozens of weight machines, several cardio machines, and free weights. They have a small outdoor pool (which is rare in NOLA) on the 4th floor with about a dozen chairs. Don't expect anything to be free at this hotel unless you are a platinum member at Starwood, but that is typical with any W property. I tend to be rather picky when choosing hotels, but this is a property I would be happy to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: awval999
Reviews.Content: Great weather and great 5 day trip to NOLA in April 2011. Hotel is very trendy, great lobby, great Wheels and Front Desk staff. Room was always "clamy" and not much of a view if you stay on the side facing another large hotel. Small view of Mississppi River though. Very comfortable bed and always love the W Bliss tolietries. Very close to Casino. About a 5-10 minute walk to French Quarter, close enough but not too close so you can get a great night's sleep. Two negatives: housekeeping only came once total in 5 days, yes we were in and out of the room a bit and had the "DND" sign when we were in the room but there was ample time to clean it, but it was only cleaned once. We had to call and request towels on Day 4 because we ran out. We ordered room service and it did not get put though the first time, so we waited 45 minutes and no food, at this point we called again, Front Desk apologized and it came up within 15 minutes. All in all an okay experience which is what I figured to expect from prior reviews on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so nice guests!!!”
Reviews.Author: browninggirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the W. We had originally wanted to stay the weekend there but no room was available for Friday night...but boyyyy are we glad we didn't!!!! We were looking for a quiet, relaxing weekend getaway and this was not it. There were drunk people all over this hotel, wondering around and mumbling things in the elevators to us....we NEVER got a chance to go by the pool and relax. It was taken over by loud drunks that made comments as we walked by!!!! This is absurd! This stay was certainly not worth $369 and we will not be returning here. There was loud noise and ruckus throughtout the night that kept waking us up, along with slamming doors. The staff, however, was VERYYY nice and the valet was awesome! The hotel is very unique and accomodating. Your hotel should advertise that it is directed more towards young, drunk, ignorant loud folks, not a married couple trying to spend a nice, quiet weekend alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great W”
Reviews.Author: CarstenW2
Reviews.Content: I just had a wonderful stay at this property. Great staff, great room (the hotel generously upgraded me to a suite), great lobby with the typical W vibe. This is likely going to be my hotel of choice for future visits to NOLA. As other had mentioned, their wireless internet service is not very reliable and I gave up using it after the first day. The rooms are showing a little wear and tear and the maids did not keep the room as clean as one might expect (but hey this is New Orleans). The fitness center was great, but two of the three ellipticals did not work (they continuously reset after one minute). I had one disappointing staff experience and e-mailed the GM who responded right away. Definitely a hallmark of a well-run hotel!

Reviews.Title: “In Decline”
Reviews.Author: jameshfinkelstein
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the W in the past and was eager to return. Disappointed would be an understatement. The wireless internet service in the rooms is a joke. In fact, I had to come to the lobby to write this review. I've complained three times and never heard back from anyone. I tried to order a movie only to have the screen tell me that I wasn't a registered guest in the room. The shower diverter doesn't work properly. There is no light in the make-up mirror. The cordless phone only works on line 2. The fridge didn't work--I later discovered it was unplugged. The cover on the ironing board was like a street in Libya. The air conditioner in the hallway outside my room sounds like a semi starting up. The mattress has seen better days--sagging deeply in the middle. The iPod dock doesn't charge iPhones. I complained to the front desk last night only to be told that they were sorry. I was told that the manager was out and asked for her to call me when she got back in. No call so I went downstairs. They offered to change my room--albeit to a smaller one on a lower floor. A day later and still no call from anyone in management. However, every morning I got a message saying that there was no upgrade available for Gold Pass members. The workout room is about 65 degrees. Great if you like a cold chill. The hotel has passed its prime. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at better Ws”
Reviews.Author: Salandtal
Reviews.Content: The check-in was extremely slow since there was only 1 person at the counter, and it seemed like thats all they had throughout the stay. The room was OK compared to other Ws I've stayed at. I love starwoods, but wished this one was better, but at least they are a short walk from the convention center and around 10-15 minute walk from Bourbon/Royal Sts.

Reviews.Title: “Another poorly run W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rumpolian
Reviews.Content: Another poorly run W, and the last we'll ever stay in. High price, fancy trimmings, and very weak on basic services. Promised free wi-fi; room had NO wi-fi reception and we had to use an ethernet connection, then got billed double for wi-fi!
