Left maid a tip, but next day bathroom still poorly cleaned and no toilet paper! Also no bars of soap; only a tiny free squeeze bottle of body wash (try taking a shower with that!). Asked for soap at desk and were told "we're all out." Next day found piles of it on maid's cart and helped ourselves. Unlike virtually every hotel/motel chain in the U.S. there is NO business center with a FREE computer and printer to print boarding passes. There are two computers in the lobby that cost $7 for 15 minutes of use! Both conceirges acted aloof and like they were doing us a favor to speak to us. One agreed to print our boarding passes "if I have time" and said they'd be left under our door. When we returned that evening, the passes weren't there; we called the desk and, after about 15 minutes, got a call back and were told they'd found the passes and would send them up, which they did (another tip for the delivery men). No coffee maker; a standard feature in W hotels. We asked for one and were told "we don't have any left," but they gave us free coffee via room service each day, which meant waiting for the coffee and (again) tipping the delivery person. As always, the room was small and badly laid out.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed - will not be back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dani33ellie
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient, but that is the only positive for this review. The bathroom was the worst of the experience: - broken glass on floor - hair all over - stained/very small tub Also, housekeeping only came 1 time in 3 Days!! Would not return to this hotel, and have a tarnished view on W's in general - not surprised the Boston one is closing!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, okay rooms, terrible accountants”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Circus84
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Starwood hotels and W Hotels in particular. This was a disappointing experience. Check-in was smooth and the desk clerk was friendly. The parking guys were especially cool - great recommendations for non-touristy jazz joints and could not have been more cordial. The room was okay, but not quite up to par with other W hotels, especially for the price I paid. Location for Mardi Gras was phenomenal! Right at the end of the parade route - so we were literally able to walk up to the floats to get beads and get a little silly. :-p The gym was just okay, it seems like I've been to better W hotel gyms. The restaurant in the hotel wasn't tasty at all. But hey, you're in New Orleans and right across the street from Mother's - shame on you for being overly reliant on the hotel restaurant! :-p Now the bad part. 4 days after check-out, there was an additional $30 charge on my credit card from the W. What was it? Mini-bar. There is no way that housekeeping could have mistook a discarded water bottle or Snickers bar or whatever else was in the minibar in the trash for one of the overpriced snacks from the minibar. I do NOT do hotel minibars and the only thing in the trash were toiletries. Not sure if this was the W being shady or reckless with accounting, but I was quite angry, ESPECIALLY since it had been 4 days after check out this was charged to my credit card. To be completely fair, my friend staying in the room next to mine had no such issue with his stay. Not to sound like an old fogey, but traveling in the age of identity theft is hard enough. It's especially daunting when things like this happen. I would stay at another Starwood property, but not this W.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Touteseule
Reviews.Content: The room was okay, a bit small but comfortable. I like a better bathroom and this tub was shallow in the extreme. The hotel restaurant, Zoe, was very nice and the service was great. I had to have six or seven of those key cards made. I felt silly but met another couple having the same problem. Also, I asked for the coffee pot for the room. It came with coffee for the first morning, but I never received any more. The pot remained, but it was never replenished. I was there 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest or Inept”
Reviews.Author: Luyouren
Reviews.Content: I was double charged for a 4 night stay, so the charge was $1,000 more than expected. I called to report the problem and my calls were not returned. My colleague who was also double charged for her room left a message and was then tripple charged! They staff appologized and credited me $50 bucks. When I left the "folio" or receipt that they gave me was for another guest of the hotel. That means my receipt and all of my private information was given to someone else as well. When I called to request another receipt I was once again only able to leave a message with the management. When I did finally get the correct receipt it had the wrong address. I don't want to believe that these folks are dishonest, but can anyone be this inept? I'd skip this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel in a fun city”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_Classic
Reviews.Content: An SPG platinum member, I've stayed in W's all over the world, and I have to say this one was a pleasant surprise. It had the usual W glitz and glamour, but the staff still managed to keep that laidback, southern charm that is peculiar to New Orleans. If you're in NOLA for business or pleasure, I'd give this one a look.

Reviews.Title: “I always enjoy this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wxgoddess
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The staff are great people and make me laugh every time I visit. And yes the rooms are a bit small but have you every visited a hotel in large city you know how normal that is, also if you are visiting New Orleans and staying in your room, you are doing it all wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Overall--meh.”
Reviews.Author: AmblerChennai_India
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel has seen better days. The room we stayed in was very small, with drawer space limited to the bedside table--no bureau. No fan in the bathroom makes for a steamy main room after showers. Limited outlets--I had to crawl under the desk to find outlets for my Blackberry and laptop. The coverlet on the duvet was quite stained. On the other hand, staff were lovely, and the lobby is very hip. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “THE M”
Reviews.Author: ManiBagga
Reviews.Content: I commented to the management of this hotel that this W was so upside down it should be called the M. it was a great location across the casino near the convention center and not far from bourbon. great for business. Bar area was nice. But the hotel is run down. walls are thin and rooms a little banged up. and staff is out to lunch except the manager who took care of my issues.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tara_Al05
Reviews.Content: We had read some reviews and were a little uneasy until we arrived and it was wonderful. It was a little busy but what do you expect the week of Mardi Gras leading up to St. Patty's day. The staff was very friendly and gracious. We got a free upgrade on our room. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Showers had a lot of pressure and just the right temperature. No loud disturbances. It was pretty much a perfect trip. Can't wait to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, amazing service, great New Orleans hotel”
Reviews.Author: swedewhite
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New Orleans for a memorial service of a dear friend who passed away. Needless to say my friend and I were not in the best of moods, but Hayward "Mr. W" Angelette greeted us with gusto. When we disclosed our reason for being in New Orleans, he shared some kind words and offered us a few drink tickets - 'tis New Orleans after all. I've stayed at this hotel many times since it opened, but this was probably the best stay I've had. The room was clean, the living room has been freshened up, and all in all, the place is just plain chic. The pool side cabanas are great for napping off the previous nights debauchery. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a trendy spot with great staff and reasonable prices even during high season.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is past its sell by date!”
Reviews.Author: stb3Toronto_
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel as he was there for a conference. My husband had stayed at another W hotel years ago and it was great. WEll this one seems to still be stuck in the early 2000s. I think the hotel is still betting on its past reputation as being ultra cool to get around some real problems in the here and now. 1) Our room felt icky! I began to realize why and one reason was there is no fan in the bathroom. So all the showers taken give off humidity that ultimately settles in the room. The bathroom toiletries, were cheap and felt so sticky after using them (they used to carry aveda once upon a time) The carpet felt damp, the air felt humid and the sheets on the bed closest to the bathroom felt clammy. My husband found someones boxer shorts under the bed..gross! 2) the overall room looked like it had not been updated since its inception. So things looked like they were wearing out, from the counter in the bath to the lights in the room. 3) Once upon a time W hotel tried to be the hip hotel by offering people the ability to put their ipod on the alarm clocks to play and charge. They were the only hotel that did at the time. Fast forward to 2011 and they still have the same old clocks. None of the new ipods sit on the players, nor charge, as do none of the new i phones. 4) The restaurant service In a word, AWFUL.. We were there on the friday when it was dead for breakfast, and had to wait forever before just finally sitting down ourselves. Went again on the monday, when it was busier and they still made people wait, not just for the table but for breakfast as well. Hello! People are at conferences, which means they are on a schedule and have to be somewhere... They just were soooo slow it was painful. Overall, it was just not a pleasant hotel to relax in, and I was really glad when we left. Its unfortunate because I was looking forward to staying there but it just did not live up to the pictures, it was deceiving. The only plus was that its proximity to the French quarters is close and the bars downstairs looked cool although I did not go in.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel away from the Bourbon area, but beware parade routes!”
Reviews.Author: tygerlily
Reviews.Content: Came during the 1st weekend celebrating Mardi Gras and was thrown back that the Mardi Gras websites I referred to, did not list any parades passing the W Hotel. However, both Friday & Sat nite parades ended right in front of the W hotel and they were very loud until 10pm. Of the few rooms we had (all were on the 9th floor), our room was with a baby so the noise was a factor. Other normal things about the hotel, good & bad: The sinks in all our rooms had awful temperature control! If you used the hot water, it would get extremely hot (steaming) no matter how much of the cold water valve you use. EVen when you shut the hot water off, it took 10-15 long seconds for the steaming hot water to change to cold. This made it very difficult to wash you face for instance. Then when I tried to plug the sink and get a good temperature in the basin to wash, the sink & faucet are arranged where the faucet comes right down in the middle making it had to wash your face over the sink. It was very odd considering the shower/bath temperature control was fine. Another issue was the lack of plastic laundry bags & the noise insulation between rooms. One side of our room was very insulated & we couldn't hear our group next door. But then the other wall facing another room, we could hear easily (maybe b/c of the vent on that side?). Another room part of our group suffered through a noisy bachelor party room next door being very loud late at night. We also used the door tag to not clean our room, but don't know who took the sign off our door on the 3rd day, but it was gone (neither outside nor inside our room) and housekeeping came in. Considering the drunk ppl in New Orleans, the W should have installed a sign on the door to only be changed from the inside. The free coffee in the mornings and the location right across from Mother's Restaurant was a big plus for our group. Front desk & others were friendly & helpful. They allowed us to check-in early & accommodated our room requests no problem. That was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: 195binney
Reviews.Content: The Good: - Location, walkable to anywhere in the city really - Food was a cut above, even room service was okay - Public areas very nice - The two bars downstairs are interesting - The staff in general were very good and wanted to help - Great gym (large, lots of equipment) and nice roof top plunge pool - Casino opposite The Bad: - This use to be the Crowne Plaza and it showed in the bedrooms. Our room (1717) had paper pealing off the walls by the toilet and bath tubs were the ordinal from the mid 80s. We lack power points in desk area too. Corridors were very dark and narrow. - Service was okay, but they lost our friend's shirt thirty minutes before the wedding he was in and when I tried to order the New York Times the front desk noted they do carry 'this news paper" - The hotel appeared to allow non service animals (dogs) and I was surprised to see one swimming in the pool. If you have issues with dogs this may not be a good fit. - While staying here I realized I am getting old (36). I did not like all the black paint everywhere and the dim lighting. I will avoid W hotels in the future but more due to my love of the quiet classical touch in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: PlacesYouMustSee
Reviews.Content: I arrived into town Wed, and received one of those Priceline deals at Le Pavillion Hotel....Needlesss to say, I had to reserve another room the same day, and so happy I did! The W is great...The staff is the best ever. When you arrive to the hotel, there are so many details - the living room, the bars, all the candles, the grand staircase...And the food...I recommend trying either their seafood or crawfish pasta from Zoe's....It's the best!!! I love it...Oh yeah, and the beds - really good linens...slept on clouds!

Reviews.Title: “What a great staff and great site-my colleagues were jealous!”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyPayne
Reviews.Content: I selected the W Hotel on Podryus because the hotel looked great and had a gym and outdoor swimming pool and a great restaurant. When I arrived the location was even nicer than the photos, the gym was even nicer then the one I belong to at home. The best part of the stay was the staff who were proud of the place they worked and took pride in making sure every need was met with absolutely excellent service that was beyond just doing their jobs. What a great hotel and I will stay there every time I go to New Orleans. My colleagues who visited my hotel all wished they had booked their trip at the W Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to W standard”
Reviews.Author: HCJdallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for conference at the convention center. Bottom line: the rooms are awful. Dirty-caked in dust, worn carpet, furniture, fixtures, etc. The coasters were stained in the bathroom. Dust coated A/C vents. The walls are extremely thin-I could hear the conversation of people next door and the traffic on the road although I was on the 10th floor. Pros: Acura to take you in 6 mile radius, location, nice work out room, good bar, generally friendly staff. Management-please clean and remodel the rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so wonderful”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: While the hotel does have a hip feel, there is much lacking. Walls are very thin. Nothing special about the rooms. In fact, where is the in-room coffee maker? It feels like this is a hastily converted Four Points or something, not up to customary W standards. I'll stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ne33
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the W. The hotel lobby is so nice.. Very trendy... The staff was very helpful and service was great! The rooms are nice but small and rooms could have been more clean.. But the sleep was great, great beds and pillows!!

Reviews.Title: “Belongings taken from room.”
Reviews.Author: walklookshoot
Reviews.Content: Through the years we've stayed in a variety of NO hotels for Mardi Gras, CCC, concerts, plays, etc. Thought we'd try the W NO and found it farther from French Qtr, and not as comfortable as past hotels. The reason we won't be back: We gathered our belongings on the bed for a quick checkout after breakfast, put the do not disturb sign outside the door and left. On return an hour before checkout, the do not disturb sign was gone, and we found the room made up and our things gone. We only had a day pack of things but they included electric razor and meds. Other items were still in the room's safe. We called front desk and were told a manager would be right up. My husband found the maid who said she saw no sign on door and she thought we just left the things. We asked why she didn't call to verify we had checked out and she said it wasn't done at the W. After awhile, still waiting for manager, we get call from front desk that basically said. "we hear you got your things back. sorry you are unhappy." we never heard from the manager. won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Service, Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Trippingman
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference nearby. The W was a great alternative to that hotel. I found my room to be clean and large enough for my needs. The bed was quite comfortable. The shower had outstanding water pressure. They offer free flight check in. I found that all of the staff members I encountered were polite and professional. I ordered room service twice and was not disappointed either time. The service was prompt and the food prepared as requested. I can honestly say that this was one of the best hotels I've stayed at on business. It offers excellent value and amenities for the price. I plan to start staying a W properties for my future travel. I feel that the W does try and live up to a higher standard. Management can't control everything and some people may have a bad experience. However, if you are looking for a higher end experience at a value price, you can't go wrong here. Thanks to the W staff for making my stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: OrangeLeopard
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to NOLA on business during the Sugar Bowl. When I checked in, I asked for a quiet room because I was going to be working and also needed a good night's sleep. Miraculously, a quiet room is exactly what I got! The hotel restaurant was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: 2yet
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about staying here after reading all of the reviews, but we had a great stay! The staff was very friendly, and gave us a drink coupons upon check in, when they found out it was my birthday. I understand the remarks about the rooms being outdated, but I didn't feel that it took away from our stay at all. The room was clean, and fit our needs perfectly. The location was excellent-we loved being able to walk nearly everywhere. The only complaint I have, is that the cost of parking is ridiculous! The rooms are well over $100, so why charge $35 a day to park on top of that?! Otherwise, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: gregmba
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this W Hotel near Harrah's Casino for the past 4 years. I am a frequent visitor (greater than 100 nights) and have to say it is one of the best in the city. Customer Service - The front desk is a very good experience where they are courteous, greet you by name and provide information about what's going on. The concierges are top notch. The room service staff is prompt and very considerate (even slipped me a few free cookies every now and then) Rooms - Rooms are very nice and they probably have the most comfortable beds in the city. I highly recommend this place if you work a lot of hours and sleep is a premium. You will fall asleep in no time and be well rested. Gym - The gym is just as good as many boutique fee-based gyms with ample aerobic machines, weight machines, and free weights. They even have a punching bag to let off some steam. I have been coming to the city 14 days per month for the past 5 years and this is by far my first choice of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rescued last night of my vacation!”
Reviews.Author: prpro70
Reviews.Content: After two dreadful nights at the International House hotel (don't stay there if you can help it), we looked out our window, saw the W logo glimmering about 5 blocks away and in the middle of a major winter rainstorm with 60 mph winds, we checked out of the IH hotel and into the warmth, cleanliness of the W New Orleans. We arrived at the front desk and the staff was so shocked at our IH hotel experience, that they even apologized for what we encountered. They whisked us into a Fantastic Suite, gave us a $30 coupon good for hotel food and drink (which we didn't use but it was so kind anyway) and called after we unpacked to see if there was anything they could do for us. Jared at the front desk was a superstar! At the W New Orleans, our room was CLEAN, it had HOT WATER, the TOWELS weren't dirty, the HVAC vents weren't moldy, the windows weren't leaking water and oh, the quiet. We actually slept through the night unawakened by outside noise. Thank you, thank you W New Orleans for saving our last night in the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly NOLA Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lipearls
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the W New Orleans for a business conference (Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday). I had a great time at the hotel.Everyone I encountered at the hotel was helpful, friendly, and what I expect for the W Hotel. The lobby was beautiful and the location was just 3 blocks from my conference hotel. The checkin desk was awesome and everyday I had such a nice interactions with them. Everyone at the hotel really care about the guests and really seem to enjoy working at the W. Keep up the good work. The hotel rooms were older and my only issue was that my bathroom faucet leaked even when I turned the knob tight but I think you guys are remodeling and I sure it will be fabulous when those renovation finish. Hope to stay there again for the 2012 conference.

Reviews.Title: “I regret coming back to this hotel. I should have known better.”
Reviews.Author: CBBrown67
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times since I joined the Starwood Preferred Guest program, but not in the last two years. I had a bad experience with both a front desk person and a member of the management, so I had decided not to stay there again. But, i booked a last minute trip to New Orleans and the W was cheaper by far, so I decided to try it again. Another reason that I booked was that there seemed to be an abundance of suites available on the date that I booked, which was also the day I was to check in. I thought that maybe, just maybe, with there being so many suites available for rent and my status as a Platinum member of the loyalty program, I might get an upgrade. No such luck. I got an "upgrade" to what they call a "cool" corner room. If you check in and they tell you that you are in a cool corner room, prepare yourself for a struggle to get your luggage through the tight squeeze of a door. In the cool corner room you have to open the door all the way back until it hits the column behind it to get enough room to roll your suitcase through the door. The dent in the column behind the door where the door handle hits is testament to this problem. If you are just trying to get in the door without luggage, you have to open the door just enough to step into the bathroom and then you can close the door behind you and walk into the room. The other feature that you might imagine is a nice part of the cool corner room is a view. Again, no such luck. The view from my windows was of the windowless side of the Windsor Court hotel next door, so basically I was looking at a brown concrete wall. If I looked all the way down at the end of the view, I could see the roof of Harrah's casino as well as a tiny sliver of the pool at the Windsor Court. The bed, as always, was incredibly comfortable. The next morning after I checked in, I went downstairs to get a newspaper to take with me to breakfast. I remembered that they always had several stacks of newspapers at the end of the front desk, so when I got to the desk I looked over the newspapers and couldn't find The Times-Picayune, the local newspaper. Thinking they might be out, I asked the person at the front desk if they had any more Times-Picayune papers. He said "No. We don't have the Times-Picayune because we have a billing issue with them." I thought this was something that was not necessary to tell a hotel guest. But he did say that they would send someone out to get one for me, but I declined and took a different paper instead. The next morning, when I was going downstairs to get breakfast, I decided I would ask them to go out and get a Times-Picayune for me as LSU had won the Cotton Bowl the night before and the Saints were playing that afternoon and I wanted to read about both. The woman at the front desk told me that if I wanted a Times-Picayune I could walk across the street to the vending box in front of Mother's restaurant. What happened to "Whatever/Whenever"??? I also mentioned that there was no Do Not Disturb sign in my room, and was told that they would have someone bring one up. At 4PM, when I still didn't have the DND sign, I called the "Whatever/Whenever" line and they brought one up a few minutes later. With that said, I should also say that the bathroom is in need of an update. The wallpaper is peeling back from the wall in a couple of places and there are a couple of places where something has been dropped onto and chipped the tile floor. When I check into a room that is a part of the Starwood Preferred Guest group, I never expect to find peeling wallpaper. I fully expect that the General Manager or someone in her office will write some sort of standard response on here and that is their right. What is my right on this site is to say this: The last time I stayed here, I had a problem getting my starpoints posted, so i e-mailed the address shown on my folio to inquire. When I got no response and still no starpoints, I e-mailed again. After 14 days I sent a letter and it seems that the day it arrived in the mail someone from the management called to tell me that they don't check that e-mail very often. Why print it on the folio if you are not going to check it? And why tell your guests that you don't check it? It seems that the people who work at this hotel put out information that is detrimental to the reputation of the management. That reflects poorly on you, Ms. Thompson. And if your front desk help is going to tell your guests that the reason they cannot get the local paper is a billing issue, be an adult and a professional and get the issue resolved so the many LSU and Saints fans who stay in your hotel can get the newspaper they want and not have to settle for a day-old USA Today or Wall Street Journal. If you are going to be a part of the brand that has a motto of "Whatever/Whenever", you need to take that creed to heart and not tell a guest (a Platinum guest) that they should walk across the street to get their newspaper. If you are not going to live up to that creed, you might as well take down the W sign and become a Four Points by Sheraton, but you would still have to update the bathrooms. The problem I have with this hotel is that it has such great potential, and the lack of attention from staff and management make it fall short.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, small dull rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TripGoat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding over New Years Eve. The staff were very friendly even though the hotel was full. I was told my corner room boost great views and that the bathroom was one of the largest they have. The view was of huge brown office block, completely covering the window except for a patch which looked over a carpark. It was so depressing we kept the shutters closed the whole time. The bathroom was small, with the smallest, sallowest bath I have experienced since travelling budget as a student. It would have being better if they hadn't tried to sell the room up. It screamed, "we were a Best Western before, so we painted a wall black, added monotone carpet and bedding and tripled the prices!" Room service was friendly and quick and they have a great service where they take your flight info, print out your boarding pass and deliver it to your room. This W branch was friendlier than the San Francisco and New York ones, but the decor and style appeared cheaper and dated.

Reviews.Title: “W New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Aaron W
Reviews.Content: The W (one of two in NOLA) is a good deal versus the usual price for this brand but you get what you pay for. The location, lobby, bars, hotel staff and room service are all what you'd get at any other W out there. All very good to excellent except for the rooms which are smallish and the bathrooms were small and a bit worn. Nothing scary or bad though. The location was great for us: walking distance to the quarter, across from Harrah's and several good food spots like Emerils, Herbsaint and a few others. If they would just update the rooms and especially the baths, they would be all set.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Visit”
Reviews.Author: kaymack2
Reviews.Content: With the number of visitors in New Orleans for the Sugar Bowl game and New Year's Eve celebrations, the staff at the W did everything they could to accommodate guests' requirements. Danny Alford, chef concierge, went out of his way to help. Great hotel, great location and great employees!

Reviews.Title: “Comedy of errors - only it wasn't really funny”
Reviews.Author: free101girl
Reviews.Content: We had so many issues during our stay that we could only laugh, but overall it was a totally frustrating experience. Just a few of the things we experienced: It took 15 minutes to check in for EACH of our two suites. The check-in person was very nice but admitted he had no idea what he was doing. I ordered a floral arrangement to be delivered to our suite. It never showed up. I kept calling and going by the front desk, asking what happened to it. They swore it was never delivered. The florist says it has a signed document showing someone on the hotel staff took delivery of the flowers I never received. I realize that staffing on Christmas can be a challenge, but if the hotel can't provide basic services, it either needs to be upfront about that, or simplify its offerings to something it can handle. On Christmas morning we ordered a room service breakfast. We were told it would be delivered in 30 minutes or less. 60 minutes later, no food. We called and were told the kitchen was "backed up." At the 90 minute mark we cancelled the order. We received an apology and were told we'd get a food & beverage credit on our bill. (We didn't.) We were starving after the long room service wait, so we went downstairs to the restaurant. I asked the hostess if there would be a long wait for food and mentioned the room service issue. She said no, we shouldn't have to wait long. We deliberately ordered only soup and sandwiches, figuring those would come out faster. (Soup can normally be dished up by the servers immediately.) 40 minutes later, we had received only drinks. It was clear that some people who were not experienced in serving tables were on duty and NO food was coming out to anyone. The table next to us was even worse off -- their order hadn't been taken and they'd been sitting there for 35 minutes! I complained to the hostess. A few minutes later a competent waitress appeared and managed to get us some food fairly quickly, but I swear if I had not complained I'd still be waiting on that food. Since clearly there was not enough staff working, the hotel would have been smart to offer reduced service on Christmas (i.e., just Continental breakfast through room service, and maybe a Continental breakfast buffet in the restaurant). That way at least we could have gotten some food in a timely fashion. Our billing was totally screwed up at checkout. We had made a large ($1200) deposit on each of our suites, but we were not credited for that on the final bill. The front desk person was very polite and apologetic, and he supposedly fixed it, but I'm still not convinced my credit card will be billed properly. All of the staff at the hotel were very pleasant but unfortunately many of them were either incompetent, inexperienced or poorly trained. Even with the great rate we got on our two suites, it just wasn't worth it, because the hotel problems really had a negative impact on our Christmas. I spent a lot of time that should have been devoted to family functions, instead dealing with issues at the hotel. I should have paid more and stayed elsewhere. We visit NOLA frequently and I doubt we'll be returning to the W, even though I am SPG Gold and try to stay at Starwood properties whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, but not up to usual W standards”
Reviews.Author: geniusbrown
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the W on Poydras for a Tulane graduate school reunion weekend. My boyfriend and I were given a "cool corner" room with a King sized bed. The hotel is, like most W's, very cool and in a great location, but the main problem with this place is that the rooms seem a bit dated. Our bathroom was tiny & flooded with every shower. Our room itself was clean & cozy, but very dark & somewhat dated looking. Our friends' rooms were a little bigger, but they had some issues with the cleanliness of the room when they checked in (as in, the bathroom was clearly not cleaned when they arrived - dirty towels on the floor, etc. - they were moved to another room eventually). The hotel itself had excellent service at the front desk and in the bar areas. However, the service was inconsistent across the hotel. For example, we were highly disappointed with the hotel's parking system & valet staff. We had to wait almost an hour to get our car & when we raised an issue about it, we were met with very poor service & virtual non-responsiveness. The bars at the hotel are fun & a nice break from the Quarter scene. The location is good - not in the Quarter (and so not as noisy), but still within walking distance to everything you need downtwon. Additionally, as in all Ws, the Bliss products were wonderful. We have stayed at several Ws over the last 10 years or so, and I have stayed at this particular hotel twice. Both times I really wanted to like my experience & both times I left slightly disappointed that the hotel was not up to usual W standards. For the special rate we were paying for our room through Tulane, the stay was worth the money. However, I'm not sure that I would stay here under their normal rate. There are too many other options in town.

Reviews.Title: “Let the W take you away to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jasonc_10
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the W A great sleep in our heavenly bed. Close walk to the French Quarter (5 - 10 minutes). We had valet rolled into our room rate which was nice. Incredible service - from the valet, front desk, concierge, rooms service, restaurant, etc. Very friendly, outgoing, they really made our step. There was a gentleman working at Zoey restaurant in the morning (name started with an 'R'...) who really made our day. Top notch. Some nitpicking --- My girlfriend did comment on the room cleanliness -- a bit dusty on some of the furniture. But all the bedding etc were of course fresh and clean. Was not impressed with the paint job as well in our room, poor job on the edging, I'm not sure who signed off on that one. Also we were hit with a big phone bill after I dialed a local number that was busy several times, but the front desk was eagre to correct this.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice Hotel (for New Orleans)”
Reviews.Author: TRVLALOT_9
Reviews.Content: I like the location of this hotel midway between the French Quarter and the Warehouse District/Convention Center. I wouldn't say it is the best W Hotel I've ever stayed in, but compared to other New Orleans Hotels (Sheraton, Westin, Hilton, Marriot) - the W is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and Beds make this hotel a 6 star”
Reviews.Author: sioux006
Reviews.Content: ,,what a great staff..always a hello ,can we help you from EVERYONE. ..all 10 in family commented on great beds ..had no water at 11pm and at 11.10 we had a plumber in room to fix problem and hotel gave us a $40 credit for breakfast....restaurant very$$$$$ for quality....cereal $7.00 a bowl had family wedding and we all stayed at hotel...staff knew who we were and why there

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Typical W Hotel Vibe”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay here at the W. It was quite a bit more affordable than the French Quarter location and I can't complain given the price. SPG Platinum status acknowledged, upgrade given and late checkout offered. I think the hotel was an office building in its prior incarnation which may explain the room layout.. If you like to gamble Harrah's is across the street and you have plenty of dining options within a wander.

Reviews.Title: “We had some issues with our stay, but management has more than made up for them”
Reviews.Author: MrTed
Reviews.Content: I initially wrote a review of this hotel outlining the reasons why I was disappointed with our stay. The issues we had were relatively minor, compared with some I've read here, but combined to make the stay less than what we had hoped for. I rescinded that review before it was posted and decided instead to let the hotel's management know how I felt about our visit. I must stay that the General Manager's response to my email has more than made up for any issues we had. She called me and we had a long conversation about what I thought the hotel could do better. She really listened, told me what they were planning to do to resolve those issues, offered a one night stay gift certificate, and personally invited us back. After this response, we will definitely go back! My advice to anyone who has had problems at this, or any hotel really, is to let management know about those issues as soon as you can. They often have little knowledge of what it's like to be a guest in the hotel, and, according to this hotel's GM, they do like to hear directly from guests. Aside from the other issues we had, the service at this hotel was wonderful while we were there, and the response from management shows that customer service is something they take very seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogerm001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in November. The hotel is trying to be hip and trendy. However, I was there for business. I found the $200+ price tag to be too much for this hotel. Service was above average but this hotel was simply designed towards the party crowd, not a business crowd. The complimentary wireless service in the living room turned about to be only 30 minutes per day. In-room wireless was too expensive. Generally the room was okay but had some problems with the TV and found the shower to be a little dirty (someone else's hair was on the shower wall so clearly it had not been rinsed). I also found the furnishings, carpet, etc to be a little bit tired and worn. I suspect this is a happening place during Mardi Gras, Sugar Bowl, etc but for a business traveler it was not suitable. The bed was comfortable, the hotel is in a good location across the street from Harrah's and a short walk to the convention center. It's by no means a bust but I didn't really care for this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bit hit and miss, good location, overall nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: LP70
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at this hotel was due to the Sheraton (where I had some meetings ) being over-booked and not able to accommodate a longer stay. So the booking was handled by the Sheraton not direct. There are lots of things to like about this hotel, including its location which is next door to Mothers, a great local diner serving po boys and gumbo all day, and the riverfront. It's also easy walking distance to the French Quarter and most city sights. Welcomes pets and saw the staff walking a few during our stay. Overall the staff are friendly and proud to show off New Orleans with good suggestions. And the room had the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on (even counting other W's). We had a standard room and were unable to upgrade, with a corner aspect. These rooms are quite small so upgrade if you can. Be warned, the closet is the smallest I have seen in any hotel. The bathroom was also small with no fan, and the hairdryer very low power/cheap. Internet is charged for daily which is annoying - it's 2010 folks, let's start running basic wireless as a guest service. You can get wireless in one of the bar areas downstairs all day and there are desktops downstairs also for guest use. Hotel facilities are pretty good, gym, pool (not heated), bars nice (expensive as you'd expect). Room service variable, sometimes great sometimes a bit surly/delayed. Service a bit hit and miss in some respects. Examples - no guest compendium on arrival and had to ask 3 times for one, only 4 hangers in closet and about 2 hours to get more, requested newspaper but only received it on last day, leaking shower not fixed for 2 days, and despite pre-booking the Acura car service on two occasions and having it confirmed cars were not available when we went to go. Check-out and check-in smooth and friendly and efficient. Overall a pleasant option, good for a weekend away if you go for one of the larger rooms - and the bed really is comfy. My partner commented that it was like someone wearing cool clothes but still trying to get their act together - well intentioned though! For business the Sheraton rooms are more work-friendly and larger, I'd say the W has more personality and suits a younger demographic. More focus needed on details of service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: ibid17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this W for eight nights for a conference in the Convention Center, which is a 10 minute walk away. It is also about a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter. I'm generally not a "W guy" -- I find the brand perhaps tries a bit too hard to be cool. What matters to me when I travel (and I travel a lot) is the service. At this W, all of the staff was very pleasant and helpful without exception. I'd call out Danny at the concierge desk as being particularly helpful in finding vegan options for me (don't miss Green Goddess or Bennachin) as well as one of the waitresses at Zoe (whose name might be Rachel, but I wouldn't swear to it) who knew my breakfast order after a few days and brought be "the usual" every morning thereafter. Small things like this make a big difference when traveling and I appreciated their efforts. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “worst W i ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: mytraveler2010
Reviews.Content: I've stayed the W in westwood (LA) & all the New York ones and by far this New Orleans one is the worst out of all. The lobby look stylish (as expected from a W) however the room was tiny and all they have was standard bathroom W (bliss) amenities. What happen to the slippers? robes? shower cap? toothbrush? vanity kit? i mean the other W have them lay inside the room. the room was old. definitely look like some trashy hotel transformed to a W but did not spend the money to renovate the rooms. i have to say i was quite disappointed. Should have stayed at the Westin across the street or something. I told them i was celebrating a very speical occasion and they did NOTHING for me. did not even acknowledge it when i check in/out or maybe a in-room amenity with a card??? i asked for a late check out and the manager can only extend ONE EXTRA hour for me (WOW!!!) thank you that REALLY HELPS! i understand i'm not a big shot or a big VIP but at least if I'm a guest of your hotel - be a Generous to me. this W is definitely up to the W standard. they better off be the double tree next door. I dont want anything from the hotel. nor that I wish anyone to contact me from the hotel (if they even care abour what i'm writing here). i just simply want all you W Hotel fans know that *you will be disappointed with this one" go else where and you may get a better service/room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a "W" experience”
Reviews.Author: shellymm16
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed there for 4 nights during a business conference I was at. The front desk was cordial and helpful. ROOM: Terrible, small, no dressers to put clothes, I had to live out of a suitcase for 4 days. Anytime my husband was working at the desk on his computer if I needed to get past him to get to my suitcase he would have to get up and push in the chair for me to walk by. Bed was saggy, and the pillows were awful, soft and no support. Bathroom was small and they only supplied you with one bar of soap that you had to alternate from the shower and the sink. Tile came out of the bathroom floor and onto my feet (I found out from another guest the same thing was happening to them). Room was never cleaned until after 3pm, in fact there was no way to alert the housekeeping service that you wanted your room made up. I had to get a new card for my room 6 times. I found out from colleagues that they also had to keep getting new keys. Coffee Service- Complimentary on the second floor. Every day the coffee was luke warm because the staff did not light the sterno. Each morning someone would have to call and ask for the sterno to be lit. Elevators - Elevators were slow and on my last day I found out that 2 people attending the same convention were stuck in the elevator for over an hour (same people who had the bathroom tile stuck to their feet. I was so disappointed in the "W" and would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent In-Room Dining”
Reviews.Author: Dalblu
Reviews.Content: I have thoroughly enjoyed the In-Room Dining at the W New Orleans. Specifically, Michael with In-Room Dining, is always friendly and accommodating! Thank you W!

Reviews.Title: “Not Designed for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: SATravelers
Reviews.Content: Pros: location is very good for access to federal courthouse (2 blocks away); Tony (believe he works in valet dept.) was GREAT, he went above and beyond at 8am to locate a necktie for me after I forgot to pack one. Thank you again Tony! Cons: lobby is cramped, no good space for meeting in lobby; hotel bar is more like a club, not the kind of place to relax with a drink after a long day; bathrooms are ridiculously small (even in the larger corner rooms), for example, it is impossible to even access the sink without shutting the bathroom door (which keeps the steam trapped in there) I was constantly bumping into things in the bathroom; the desk area is not convenient for laptop computer use, there was no topside plug or powerstrip, I had to crawl under the desk to find a wall outlet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tyandbec
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to New Orleans in June to celebrate our 5th anniversary. My husband let me decide where I wanted to stay so I decided on the W. We stayed at the W located right across from the casino. The location was perfect. We were a short walking distance from the French Quarter, but not in the middle of the party life. It was very quite. The W hotel had a very swanky feel to it. The concierge was amazing. We wanted to walk through the Garden District on our own so he gave us a print out for our own walking tour. It had all the directions and history of some very exciting points to visit in the Garden District. The room had a very updated feel. We had a wonderful experience and would defiantly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “bad is bad; unresponsive is worse”
Reviews.Author: dd555
Reviews.Content: After a four-night stay at the W New Orleans, I will try every other downtown hotel before returning. The television in my room did not work, and the maid absconded with all the towels when she cleaned one morning. Both of those facts are bad, but when I complained to the front desk, they solved neither problem. In fact, because the World Series was on during my stay, I brought the TV problem to their attention no fewer than four times. In short, the hotel caters to spring breakers who don't want service, just a place to pass out. For business travelers, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “W = WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: isellwpb
Reviews.Content: Rude,surly and nasty front desk staff ..spent hours waiting for reservation to be found...when it was found they suddenly found a room. Staff never admitted error-spent days playing hide and seek with the hotel manager- Ms. Tompkins come out cme out where-ever you are! Rooms were dark,dirty and dingy -(everyuthing is spray painted black) including the walls. We were overcharged for telephone calls $1:50 to call front lobby and hotel refused to honor payment made by convention for the deposit charging double for the charges. This is the poorest quality customer service experience (and we are starwood members) The parting words with the w were this is not our problem ! So spread the word...W MEANS THE WORST

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: Amundobro
Reviews.Content: This place is a dive. Walls are paper thin. Elevators broke leaving co-worker and subsequent other guests trapped. Instead of fixing the problem, they allowed others to get stuck. The water pressure stinks. The toilet backed up. The beds are soft and sagging. The furniture in the lobby is cheap and plasice. They even have plastic looking picnic tables. The room smells musty. I would leave and go someplace else if there were vacancies. The room is small and cluttered. The Internet is $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag, more good than bad”
Reviews.Author: jasonturgeon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for 4 nights at the beginning of October, 2010. Whenever I travel on business, I try to book the trendiest hotel I can find for government rate. This was my first chance to stay in a W, so I was excited. On my only other trip to New Orleans, I stayed in the Sheraton on Canal St. The hotel's location was superb for me--I prefer to walk everywhere, and this was walking distance to the convention center, Canal St, the French Quarter, and on one of my afternoon runs I was able to see a good chunk of the Garden District. I think it's the best location going in New Orleans, but it is a little bit away from the action of the Quarter. If you're staying for a convention, as I was, you can't go wrong. The lobby is pretty nice, with a cool little outdoor chill-out lounge and a very cool semi-private room next to the lobby bar that's perfect for a small group. The lobby bar was nice and relaxed, open until 11 or 12 most of the nights I was there. There's also a livelier bar around the corner (still in the hotel) that I didn't get a chance to try. Full score for the lobby and bars. The staff deserve special praise--they were universally some of the nicest hotel staff I've ever dealt with. They were universally charming, genuinely friendly, and accommodating to the nth degree. Bonus points for the staff. The rooms, on the other hand, didn't live up to my expectations. Sure, they had very nice linens, a feather bed, and a flat screen. But the room itself was small and poorly laid out, with a trendy but unwelcoming lounge chair in in the corner. The bathroom was large but dated, and there was even a plastic zip-tie holding the shower-head in place. Not the end of the world, but hardly what you'd expect in a place that aims so high. One of the big failures of the room were cockroaches (little ones, but they were there--I killed 3 during my stay) in the bathroom. I expect that roaches are a part of life in the south, but I was still surprised to see them--I didn't have roaches at the Sheraton. Another was the absolutely useless closet. It was small to begin with, then they stuck an ironing board in it, then they put a shelf across it, and under the shelf they mounted both the clothes hanger bar AND a safe. I ended up storing the ironing board behind the minibar for the week. I like hanging clothes, and I appreciate the safe. But the location of the safe meant that I could not use 3/4 of the space in the section of the closet meant to hang clothes. I went down there with one suit, a light jacket, and 4 shirts, and couldn't hang all of them at once! Complete fail on the basics. I was also upset that they charged me $42 for internet for the 4 nights I was there, and that I couldn't get the wired connection to work. Since my company paid, it doesn't really matter, but it's still annoying. To top it off, it was a slow connection. Expensive, slow internet in 2010? Come on. So to sum up: great location, gorgeous lobby, fantastic staff, nice linens....plus cockroaches, cramped, useless closets, expensive and slow internet, and so-so rooms. Would I stay there again? Maybe, but if I could get a room cheaper at the Sheraton I might go back there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: advicebygrege
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a one king size bedroom. Very clean hotel located on the edge of the French Quarter and across the street from Harrah's. If you find yourself in the room for anytime at all, TV reception is great with plenty of channels to choose from. The room was a decent size and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Amenities in the bathroom were plentiful, and had a nice aroma. The pool area is very nice. We didn't use the pool, but had to walk through the pool area to get to the gym. The gym was a little crowded, but had really good equipment. The only negative's I can come up with are it is a dark hotel. If you have poor vision, I hope you have someone with you to lead you to the elevator. Also, as most hotel lobby's in New Orleans are, it's a place for the young who like to party. Not really a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “treated like a celebrity”
Reviews.Author: steve46152
Reviews.Content: I went there with my wife, we are from N.H.and our best friends from Wisconsin.What a pleasant surprise,first the hotel was great the people who in my opinion are always a reflection of the management,were just remarkable.The service starts from getting out of the cab , the bellman,the front desk, the concierge extremely professional and courteous truly friendly and in no way phony.The staff enjoys there positions and are proud of their hotel, not something that can be faked!I felt as though I was special and so did my entire party ,we spoke of it on a number of occasions.The food was good and the bar was always busy and a great atmosphere to enjoy each others company.I could go on and on as to how much I appreciated the staffs friendliness and non stop service. We were there for a week and never had a bad experience.It was my first visit to New Orleans( WOW) what a city we had the time of our lives.It will not be my last visit and I can guarantee that I have found a beautiful new home at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: swisslady
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the W. Our room had a wonderful view of the Mississippi and had everything we needed, even though it was quite small. The service was very good and we didn't encounter any problems. The W is in a good location for sightseeing - close enough to the French Quarter and other attractions. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: DWolf
Reviews.Content: You can tell this hotel is an older property, brought up to date by a lot of paint and new trendy furniture. I wish the furniture fit the room but it did not, making you constantly squeeze past the desk and bed. Everyone at our conference complained of noisy rooms, there seems to be nothing in the walls to stop sound either inside the hotel or from outside on the street. Service is deplorable, worst ever, they missed my wake up call one day, they never brought my room service another morning (I did without). The maid made the bed incorrectly one night and I had to remake the bed and pillow-top myself. They have a car service that does not go to the airport, but only in a six mile range around the hotel. Totally useless.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel with good staff but definite housekeeping issues.”
Reviews.Author: RoundTheWorld3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in October 2010. I will start off by saying that the hotel is in a great location. It is within walking distance to the French Quarter and close to lots of great restaurants in the CBD. It is quiet and the views are quite nice. When we arrived, we were greeted by Kevin, who was as friendly as can be. Check in was prompt. Kevin helped us with our bags up to the room and explained all the features of the room. Neither of our room keys worked, so he went downstairs to get new ones made. The batteries were also dead in the remote for our TV, so he had someone come in to fix that right away. The common areas of the hotel are quite nice. There are plenty of interesting seating areas in the lobby and 2nd floor, and the bar areas were hopping. Concierge was helpful when we needed their help, and other staff members were quick to assist when they saw we needed help and concierge was already on the phone. Our room, however, left much to be desired. Bed was comfortable but bedframe was dusty! The bathroom was nice but shabby, with missing tiles and a paint job that looked like it was done by my 7 year old nephew. Dark paint was splashed all over the white tiles. The carpet in our room looked like it could use a good shampoo. Toilet looked like it could use a good bleaching. Empty tissue box in the bathroom was not refilled on our 2nd day. On our last full day at the hotel, we came back to the room around 5:30pm. The room had not yet been cleaned. We left again about 30 minutes later and requested that our room be refreshed. When we returned that evening, the room had been cleaned but I also found a very gross surprise - a dirty rag left on top of the clothes that I had set out on top of my suitcase! The cleaning staff really needs to step up their game, both in rooms and common areas. Elevator banks should be checked regularly. We had garbage overflowing in the trashcan on our floor for two days, and the next day there was a full coffee mug left out again all day. The room next to ours set their coffee maker out for housekeeping to pick up, which they did, but left behind a handful of red plastic stirrers. Also, the hotel really promotes their Acura car service. We found the car's hours to be very spotty and unavailable when we asked about it. Concierge should set out a schedule so it is clear when the car(s) will be available. Good idea, but not executed well at this W. Not sure if the same problem is found at other Ws. Overall, we had an average stay at the hotel. If I didn't find so many housekeeping issues, but my review would be much more favorable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: colnagoroadie
Reviews.Content: Enough of the "cool" factor especially when you can't pull it off. I stayed at the Westin last time down to NO and had essentially better rooms, newer rooms, larger room, same food in room service and mini bars....two blocks away for of course a lower price. I'm a heavy starwood user, so, I've been to many W's around the country and Westins.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: floridanativedawn
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel not to be up to our expectations for a W. The front desk personnel were courteous, the location great and the lobby was nice, but those are the only good points I can make. The rooms were less than spotless. The carpet should really be replaced or at least given a really good cleaning. The furniture was dusty. The bathrooms are small and the shower would not drain properly. We also had an exorbitant parking charge on our bill at checkout and we didn't even have a car. It took almost fifteen minutes for them to finally credit us. I know mistakes can be made, but the time it took for them to credit us was excessive. Additionally, housekeeping did not come until really late in the day. I expect a higher level of quality from a W and this one did not meet the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this dump-never again”
Reviews.Author: Tom180
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for homecoming weekend from the 7th until today. It was a terrible experience. Everything was terrible. The room: The room was dirty and dusty. The towels were frizzled and were obviously used to clean shoes. It was disgusting to only realize it AFTER you used it to dry your face. The F&B:The Restaurant was so poorly run that we needed to leave. You get no place settings when you arrive. No spoon for the coffee. No knife for the butter. Coffe arrives cold. Waiters are not to be found. Roomservice: Called last night for 2 cappucinoos at 6.30 am. Called to ask where they were at 7 am. They arrived 7.36 am. We had to go to airport without. Parking: You need to call 20 minutes in advance to realize that they forgot your ca, or misplaced your ticket. At over 40$ per night for the car it is annoying to say the least. Overall: Tired Hotel that needs upgrading. Tired staff that needs to be more with it. This was my secont time at this Hotel because I thought the first one was a fluke. For sure, there will be no third time.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly poor experience once you get beyond the desk ...”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyNC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in multiple rooms over a weekend (Friday-Monday) and was disappointed with everything past the front desk. First - it is $42 for valet parking. Let that sink in - $42. That is obscene by any standard (even NO), but worse when you consider it is 20-30 minutes to get your car. As for positives, the desk staff was terrific - very professional and friendly. Concierge as well (we got a dinner recommendation and it was great for us). The problems began when we got to the room. We arrived on the 10th floor to find a hallway and rooms that were just plain old. Old old old - low ceilings old, small bathroom, grimy tile old. Our bathroom floor was covered in black hair - literally as if a wig had been shaken loose. Disgusting. That got taken care of fairly quickly, but we were left with what the hotel is - old and dingy. Bathrrooms, as I said, are small. Shower curtains on a straight rod. Tub had a slow drain so we got to stand in a nice pool of filth while showering (ick). Floor tiles need to be removed and replaced - cannot come clean. Carpeting in our room had dirt on it - had not been thoroughly vaccuumed. Rooms were not serviced until after 3:00 any day. One room wasn't serviced until 5:00 either day. Just not enough staff and not good enough. Bottom line - this is not a W quality hotel. More like a Sheraton with a cool lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Flawless”
Reviews.Author: socalbeachbum97
Reviews.Content: Our 6 night stay in September was truly a memorable experience. Everyone was always courteous & professional. A big shout out to concierges Danny & Travis for their fabulous local tips and patience. The rooms: 17th floor- Wonderful Room. The modern interior was very pleasing to the eye. Beds are heavenly and slept like babies. My only complaint would be the space had a couple of design flaws in how it functioned. The bathroom sink was very small so it was awkward to use. Another design flaw, if someone is sitting at the desk another person has to squeeze to get by. Other than that, the hotel is seamless. The location: Right across the street from Harrah's casino in the CBD. On our previous visit to NOLA we had stayed in the French Quarters and wanted a different experience. Great decision. We really enjoyed this area a lot. The locale has less of a tourist feel even though there are plenty of tourists in the area. The clientele is a blend of business and visitors during the week and caters to the hip crowd on weekends. A nice mix. Safe, quiet and clean area in the middle of all the major sights. Service: We had a plumbing problem one morning and maintenance was there under 5 minutes who worked promptly with a smile. The only complaint I have with service was 'weekend only' housekeeping. During the week every detail was delivered, like restocking. Other than the weekend housekeeping, this hotel is a well oiled machine when it comes to service. Would we stay here again? Absolutely. Thanks for the WOW W.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls are my only complaint”
Reviews.Author: TXnatives
Reviews.Content: The walls are paper thin. I heard the conversations from the rooms next door. After the neighbors arrived from a night of partying in the Quarter their alarm clock and TV in the early morning woke me up. The hallway noise was also a distraction when I was trying to sleep. I even heard the elevator coming up and down all night. Overall it was a good stay but you should pack a pair of ear plugs if you want a good night sleep. The hotel is trendy and if you are visiting NOLA for party purposes this would be a good hotel. For play it would be a great location but we stayed here because of a conference and I don't think I will be staying here again for a work related trip.

Reviews.Title: “Southern hospitality at the W”
Reviews.Author: tropicalfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, and the highlight of the stay was the friendly staff. From the bellmen and waiters to the entertaining bartender, everyone was freindly and interested in making our stay better. I liked the location, far enough from the noise of Bourbon St., but easy walk to French Quarter, Jackson Square, Riverwalk, and Warehouse District. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance. The bed was extremely comforable, and I am always a big fan of the Bliss toiletries at the W. The decor was sleek and hip, overall a very nice hotel, and great choice for a weekend in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: lazydaysNyc
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate! The rooms are lovely! If you can stay in a corner suite I highly recommend it. The people working there were excellent - friendly and knowledgable. We even got a call each day to make sure the room was cleaned to our liking. There were no negatives. Go and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay Was Sensational!”
Reviews.Author: jjsd2010
Reviews.Content: Well if I could describe our experience in one word I guess it would be "Sensational"! My husband and I went to the W Hotel in New Orleans to celebrate our 10 year anniversary and from the moment we arrived to the moment we departed our experience was one of a kind. The staff was wonderful and the room was absolutly georgous! The manager sent us a bouquet of balloons to thank us for choosing their hotel to stay at during our anniversary occasion. We thought that was really sweet. My husband and I never had a traditional wedding so therefore we never had our wedding cake. I called the Hotel ahead of time to ask if they could possibly make us a minature wedding cake as a surprise for my husband and they were so kind and even gratious enough to say let them take care of it. That it would be their little gift to us for our celebration weekend. I was just lost for words b/c this was something that turned out to be very special for my husband and I. Everyone at the W Hotel in New Orleans was so kind and so accomodating to anything that we may have needed. We will definately go back for many more special occations to come. I've posted a picture of our wonderful and delicious wedding cake that the hotel created for us!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Housekeeping Service”
Reviews.Author: misshyde30
Reviews.Content: We were VERY disappointed with the housekeeping service during our stay over a very busy labor day weekend (and Southern Decadence). We requested for our room to be serviced twice in the same day and the housekeeping staff finally came to clean our room after 6 pm. On day 2, we had to call again to request service. We did get offered free drink coupons, however it didnt help the fact our room wasnt cleaned. On both days, only our hotel towels were changed out and the bed was made. The sheets were never changed and the bathrooms could stand to be remodeled. They were definitely not up to W Hotel quality. As SPG members we expect a certain level of service from the W Hotel and within the SPG brand and expect that when we leave the room by 9 or 10 am, that our room will be cleaned by the time we return in the late afternoon to relax before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “The property is beautiful! However what...”
Reviews.Author: MissLaw08
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful! However what is better than the ambiance are the staff members. Everyone had an excellent countenance and extended help at all times to ensure we had a great stay. The members that made the most memorable impression were Kevin, Krystal, Tony, Travis, Don and Trey. Kevin and Travis are well versed in the happenings of New Orleans and when I returned from my walk soaked due to a random thunderstorm they brought me towels before I could ask. The aformentioned staff members are representative of the quality W presents. By the way...the red fish po boy is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Whilst not the best W ever. . . Still a great place to stay in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Howard2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend in early August 2010 and had a really good time. This hotel is not one of the newest W hotels however that was reflected in the price, it is not as expensive as some of the others. Firstly the hotel is in a very good location AWAY from the french quarter which is the main tourist drag and whilst good fun, you would not want to be staying on or immediately off bourbon street. . . unless you are a group of 10 lads on a stag party. Don't worry though this hotel is only a short walk away from all the fun too. Service at the W was exceptional and in particular the concierge was excellent at providing recommendations together with making reservations for us. We had a great time at this hotel and would definitely stay again. P.S. The gym is really good if you like working out whilst away.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from front desk to valet just great and helpful. Thanks!!!”
Reviews.Author: Keylargoreef
Reviews.Content: We had an issue with getting from one w to the other.the taxis out front would not take us because of our rhodesian ridgeback," some cultures are a afraid of dogs". However, Kevin Cheneau" manager"and his team Tony,Dane,travis where on there game, and made things happens fast. Kevin make a fabulous manager super service!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you come to expect from a W”
Reviews.Author: GreekGirl101
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business and have come to enjoy whenever I have the chance to stay at a W - they're usually immaculate and modern and I enjoy all the little touches (Bliss products, tea and flavored water, etc). I actually can't believe that the W New Orleans is a W Hotel. It is so sub-par in relation to what one would expect from a W. Sure, the lobby is sleek & gorgeously appointed, but most of the staff is inept. From being unable to find a package that was sent for us for over an hour (they repeatedly told us it wasn't there; we repeatedly told them it was...and surprise! They finally found it!) to getting an attitude when we asked someone to open a conference room that we had paid for, it was just a disaster. In addition, the room was filthy. Dust and hair EVERYWHERE. I had to pick out the bright red hair of whoever stayed in the room before me with a tissue before taking a shower. We had no cold water (a ploy to get you to buy the in-room Fiji bottle for $6?) and a bobby pin from the previous guests remained on the floor our entire stay. I just never felt that the room was truly clean, even immediately after being serviced. In addition, they truly don't get the whole "whatever/whenever" concept, seeing as every day we were told that the free Acura that would drop you off within 6 miles was unavailable. Sometimes it wasn't running until 4pm, sometimes not until 7. No one could give us a straight answer. And, being that the hotel is located in a business district--not exactly the part of town you want to hang out in--using the Acura drop-off perk was something we relied on in lieu of taking a cab. It wasn't terrible...if this wasn't a W and just some boutique hotel, I'd probably be easier on them. But when you come to expect certain things from a certain brand, it's frustrating when the experience doesn't measure up. In a nutshell, the GOOD: -The cabanas by the pool are great, and the lounge chairs are super comfy. The pool is small, but fairly clean and they usually set up a bar when the weather's nice. -The fitness room is wonderful - clean, updated equipment, those wonderful Bliss cooling towels. -The lobby is spacious and funky. -It's quite easy to get a cab and easy to walk to the French Quarter. -The food at Zoe is decent, if you don't feel like venturing out. -The beds are SUPER comfortable. THE BAD: -The service is uneven. Sometimes you get someone great (Darren, the guy they call The Doctor). Other times you get someone snooty or inept or both. -The hotel is clearly a very old building; the plumbing is loud, we didn't have cold water coming out of the faucet, etc. -Cleanliness (or lack thereof) is a major factor. The rooms never felt clean, there was hair leftover from the previous guests, dusts on the desk and bedside tables, etc. -The lack of wifi is so frustrating. The fact that you have to pay $15 for it is simply outdated and it's impossible to get wireless. You essentially have to be plugged in (via a very short cord) in order to get on.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service but also loud, lines and a just a little bit tired”
Reviews.Author: DC/VATravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I typically stay in the French Quarter when visiting New Orleans but this time stayed in the business district b/c of it's proximity to work-related activities. Before going any further I think it's important to note that I always try to stay at 4 or 5 star hotels and consider myself to be a bit of a hotel snob in that my standards are pretty high. That said, Ws are often a hotel of choice when I'm traveling as I'm typically not disappointed with them. This time, I'd have to say I'm a bit disappointed. The lobby, living room, bar and restaurant are quite nice and appear to be in good condition but I can't say the same thing about my room. It was a bit musty (perhaps to be expected when you're staying in the Gulf?) and overall just looked a bit tired. The furniture had some nicks and scrapes and there were some marks on the walls. The biggest disappointment was the bathroom. It was very European in that a shower curtain was the only thing separating the shower from the rest of the bathroom (i.e., no tub or ledge) and so the water literally went all over the floor when showering. I had to put down three towels before showering which, of course, immediately soaked up all the water and were then a sodden mess by the time I was done. There was also zero room around the sink and only a cart with towels so it was a bit frustrating only being able to fit my toothbrush and face scrub by the sink/mirror. Additionally, three tiles came out of the floor in the middle of the bathroom and skittered around the floor every time you accidentally touched that area of the floor. These may not be big things to everyone but possessing a Ritz-Carlton standard, I found them to be terribly irritating. Oh and the pillows seemed to contain about three feathers each and didn't provide any support so those were sort of annoying too. I suppose these are all things I could have complained about or requested a room change over but once I was settled I really didn't feel like moving around and I'm not sure they would have had other rooms anyway b/c they seemed to be quite busy. Speaking of busy, there were often lines at the front desk and there seemed to be a dearth of desk staff which was especially annoying when we had to have our room keys reprogrammed constantly b/c they often stopped working (even when we were super careful to keep them away from our phones, ipods, etc.). The floors are a bit loud at night as this is a trendy hotel so there are lots of party-goers coming in late, slamming doors, talking loudly, etc. This, in my mind, is not a family-friendly hotel and I would definitely not have stayed here if I was traveling with my 10 year old daughter b/c it had too much of a club/party atmosphere. It's definitely for an older and cooler crowd. Now that I've gotten my complaints out of the way, I do think it's important to note that the customer service was exemplary. Our rooms were not ready upon arrival (and we actually arrived about 30 minutes prior to the normal check in time of 3pm) so the woman behind the desk immediately gave us two $30 and $40 vouchers for lunch at Zoe which was very enjoyable. All the other staff was very friendly as we arrived and departed from the hotel and the concierge was knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. They even zipped us off in their Acura (part of their Acura experience) to the restaurant we were planning on walking to so that was a nice treat especially since we did not have a reservation for the ride. The bartender we had in the lobby bar was fantastic and made us several cocktails that were not on the drink menu and the other cocktails we sampled were fresh and fantastic (especially the strawberry mojito). The gym was also clean (although four of the cardio machines were not working which was annoying) and the pool looked nice although we didn't get to use it b/c of the constant rain. The pool is quite small, however, with limited chairs so this wouldn't be my first choice if you're looking to lay by the pool with your friends for hours. So, overall I would give this stay a 3.5 out of 5 because the negatives were just annoying enough to color my overall impression of the hotel. Also, if you're mostly interested in French Quarter activities this hotel is a bit out of the way and certainly not as convenient as the W located in the French Quarter so where you plan on spending most of your time is something else to consider. If you are going to stay in this neighborhood I would check out the Lowes across the street. It seemed just as nice but quieter and without the trendy crowds always present at Ws. Do yourself a favor though and be sure to try John Besh's restaurants Domenica, Luke and the American Sector (in the WWII museum) as they are all excellent. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: toucy
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit late (OK, 5 months late) in posting this, but: The W New Orleans was wonderful. Considering that it was a rough ride to NO (luggage being delayed, flight being cancelled/delayed), it was such a welcome suprise to receive such accomodating service from everyone on staff.
