Everyone on staff made sure to make our stay as comfortable as possible, in spite of the circumstances (our not having any clothes/toiletries to wear for 3/4 of the time that we were there) In addition, they treated me with an extra champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, and free drinks for my birthday (and to soothe the pain of our disastrous travel there). All and all - staying at the W New Orleans was a wonderful experience that I'll definitely repeat if I ever come back to the city. P.S.: Genevia, the hotel manager, made it all happen for us and for that I'm forever grateful. Do ask for her if you'd like your stay to be an exceptional one.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Amazing...”
Reviews.Author: Dimplesdeep
Reviews.Content: Service was amazing...almost! Danny (concierge), Don (bellman), Adrienne (front desk), and Dane (driver) were all AMAZING and truly represented the "whatever/whenever" spirit of the W! And then there was The unnecessarily pompous Brandon who treated us like second class citizens! We are loyal to the W, but will stay at the other property in New Orleans from now on because our experience with Brandon turned our trip sour!

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!! The Best Birthday I EVER Had!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mzbriezy8
Reviews.Content: I'm from New Orleans and I have always admired this hotel from the outside. I now live in Dallas, so of course when my vacation time came up, I decided to come home for my birthday. I spent 5 days here and I LOVED every minute of it!! I had awesome service, good food, and everybody was more than friendly. I will be back later on in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Diane6349
Reviews.Content: What a disappointing stay at the W New Orleans. I expect beautiful, well-kept rooms from this hotel chain, and was very disappointed. Upon arrival, our bed linens and chair in the room had multiple stains on them, and the bathroom had hair all over the floor. We asked to switch rooms and the front desk was quick to apologize and put us in another room. However, our new room was an adjoining room and we could hear the people next door like they were in our own room. The previous review of paper thin walls doesn't do it justice - it as though there were no walls at all! This problem kept us up till two in the morning every night. In the mornings, we woke to bright light bc the windows have shutters rather than black-out drapes or blinds. Overall, the hotel seems to have spent more money on the modern decorations than on the things that truly matter.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Place”
Reviews.Author: Todd K
Reviews.Content: We were really thrilled about our time at the W Hotel in New Orleans. Right off the bat the service was outstanding and the concierge gave us all the time we needed to plan our afternoon. The rooms were very classy with a cool modern look and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The views of the city and Mississippi River were really nice and it was only a couple blocks from the French Quarter. Overall we just loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: annekr
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something special from a W Hotel but it delivered the usual business hotel quality. Had a disappointing start - arrived by taxi but didn't receive any offers of help from the bellmen hanging around the entrance. Even at check in no help with luggage was offered. We were allocated a room on the 6th floor. It appeared ok until both daughter and myself noticed stains on the bed covers - they clearly hadn't been changed. I phoned to report this and was told someone would be up to change them. We started unpacking and then I noticed that the safe door was closed so we couldn't use it. Another call and we were told someone would be with us soon to fix it. Half an hour later and still no-one had arrived to rectify either fault and we wanted to go out. Another phone call where we suggested changing rooms but told no we would be sorted soon. Security arrived to look at the safe and discovered he couldn't fix it there and then. I explained we wanted to go out and again suggested we should change rooms - he agreed and he was able to negotiate a room on a higher floor with a much better view, where the beds were clean and the safe worked. So after a shakey start things settled down. No coffee in the room but available on the first floor untill 11am each morning. We visited the first floor bar the first evening which was virtually empty and the barman told us he was 'training' so couldn't do cocktails without direction. He did make a great margarita though. Whiskey Blue was high quality and pricey and so dark I couldn't read the menu - probably too old to go there LOL. Free internet in the lobby but not in the rooms which is a pain and meant lots of guests sitting around with laptops. Pool is small but was one of the reasons we chose this hotel. Unfortunately the weather was not kind to us so we couldn't use it. Hotel is in good location for visiting French Quarter and the shopping areas as well as the streetcars. I would probably return but wasn't wowed by my experience.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to cheap in and not have to worry about running into problems try this hotel.......”
Reviews.Author: ronnie1989
Reviews.Content: We checked in, the employees were all very pleasant, and the rooms were very clean, we tried to get aroom somewhere else where we stayed before because we already knew they had great service but this hotel was even better......The conceir and front desk could answer all of our questions about the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, friendly staff, good choice for NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Mommarazzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel on Poydras Street for a conference, in a suite for a reasonable rate, which had been arranged by the very pleasant and professional Christina before the conference. We arrived very late (early) in the morning, and the night staff could not have been more accommodating and kind, providing extra sheets , towels and pillows. The W has free coffee and tea from 4AM to 11AM. (which was a welcome treat after a 15 hour drive). It is a well located hotel, in moderate to easy walking distance from most of New Orleans attractions. The rooms are a bit eclectic, but kept pretty clean. Our teenagers used the hide-a-bed in the living room, and there was adequate privacy. There is free wireless internet in the lobby which has you log on every 30 minutes, but there are large lobby spaces with large tables that are convenient and comfortable. The rooms were quiet, and the air conditioning worked very well. The pool is tiny, but the kids had a good time. Parking was $28 per day, but that is pretty standard for New Orleans, and they will bring your car to you any time you need it- just don't lose the receipt. Getting to the rooms requires a key in the elevator, which made us feel more secure, even though the neighborhood seems fine. Right next door to Mother's which was a plus. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Urban Chic w/expensive price but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Tracymyboysmom
Reviews.Content: The building is older but they made a valiant effort to mondernize it. You walk up to the 'magic curtain' and you enter to see a very urban hip lobby. Complimentary flavored water or tea is available along w/the daily newspapers. The 2nd floor houses a resturaunt and meeting rooms. Everything is very eye pleasing. The rooms have be renovated and 'look' good. The best things about The W-- The employees. Kevin, one of the Bellhops, is amazing. He anticipates your needs; has great knowledge of the city; helpful; thorough (made sure I didn't forget my phone charger at check out) and just a great guy with a great smile. Next, the beds, oh my the beds are divine! Next, the Acura Experience and it's drivers. This is a promotion they run where you can be chauffeured by a driver in a brand new Acura to any destination within 6 miles of the hotel. You need to arrange these ASAP b/c the secret gets out quick. Best, all you do is tip him, no fare! Worst things abt The W-- the elevator, although it is meant for safety it is a pain in the behind b/c it is temperamental. Next, is the PAPER thin walls; I could listen to clear and complete conversations in the next room. No mumble like we are used to in hotels. Finally, NO FREE I-NET IN THE ROOM! This was a biggie for me as I was there for 8 days and wasn't willing to pay the $15 a day. Only free I-net is on the 1st and second floors. Even the 'business ctr' (not a true business ctr, it sits in the middle of the lobby next to the bar so you can't work) charges for i-net so bring your own laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Crashed427
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year for my sisters birthday and had the best time ever! Harrahs is right across the street and we walked to everything from the French Market to Cafe Dumonde. The first room smelled like cigarette smoke and they moved us without hesitation. The beds were super comfy and the staff was friendly and helped us book the tours we wanted to go on. One of the guys found out it was my sisters birthday and had a bottle of champagne sent up to our room! We ran into Tracey Morgan and BB King in the lobby. The lobby is beautiful and so are the rooms. Theres always plenty of staff at the entrance to open the door and welcome you in and say goodnight when you're leaving. Whiskey Blue was a cool bar that everyone seemed to want to be at. Overall we had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'll stay in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: D_MusicTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hotel (New Orleans) for Essence Music Festival. This was my second year staying at the hotel and from the moment I arrived, I felt like I was returning to my second home! The staff was very welcoming from the moment I pulled up, some even recognizing Me from last year. The staff was so friendly. My room was very comfortable and my "room stylist" did a great job of maintaining the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Par with the other W's”
Reviews.Author: ET_NYC32
Reviews.Content: I am not one to [--] about a lot of things, but when there are things that constantly go wrong, I have to draw the line... I wouldn't consider myself a world traveler, but have staying in hundreds of hotels throughout my lifetime and this is the first time I had such a bad experience on 1 trip. let me start things off this way: The Good: The W New Orleans lives up to it's counterparts with it's hip atmosphere in arriving to the hotel, it was posh and shiek and we were greeted very warmly by the doorman/porters. They were extremly friendly extremely helpful and kind. this was followed up by a warm smile from the Check-In Staff. All was looking good... The bad: We get to our room and it's a standard double which is what we ordered. As we venture in to the room further, we notice stains on the floor and Q-Tips lying on the floor, and not clean ones that we dropped, they were dirtly looking...We go into the bathroom and there are towels in the sink, not the towls that you use for your face, but a rag looking towel, like the kind they use to wipe down tables in restaurants. It is soaked and sitting right in the sink that we are supposed to brush our teeth and wash our face in. Hey look, I am not one of those types of people that nit pick everything, the Q-tips could have easily fell out when the maid was cleaning up, no harm no foul, but to leave a rag inside the sink smelling like mildew (must have been there for a while) this was unacceptable. We call downstairs to the front desk and kindly inform them of the issue and ask them to send someone up to clean this. Unfortunately, there is no one available to do so at this current time. Are you serious? You can't send someone up to clean up the room that should have been cleaned prior to us checking in? Ok, so they offered to switch rooms for us which sounded like a good idea, so we agreed and started to make our way down again, when they call back and say, "oops sorry, there are no more rooms", we answer back and say you just told us that you were going to switch us. "Yes sir, but now we have no more rooms, we can offer you a complimentry breakfast for the inconvenience" We agreed and went out on the town. No harm, no foul right? WRONG! The next morning, we are all getting ready to go out and whilst in the shower, the water completely stops working. Not in the begining or end of the shower, but smacked dab in the middle, shampoo in hair and soap all over body... Boom, no water... No sink water, no toilet water and no shower water to wash off all the soap. Are you serious? I call down to the front desk and am greeted by a short snobby, we are working on it. At this point I am frustrated not only from the night before, but now no shower water... I ask to speak to a manager, and am transferred to the "Manager" who says the engineers are workign on it and it should be back up shortly. No offer of anything for the inconvenience, no apology. Nothing. We are furious that a Hotel with such a great repuation can have such a lack of customer service and courtesy. We march downstairs and are met with snotty attitudes and another complimentary lunch offer, I mean while we appreciate the offer, is it too much to ask for a hotel that provides clean rooms and running water? Oh and I almost forgot to mention, that maid service is non existant unless you specifially request it... No new towels were placed in our room until we called down to the front desk to request it, there were also no card that some hotels offer to leave on the door requesting maid service and new towels. So we assumed that the rooms were cleaned daily, but not here... Needless to say, the next time we are out in New Orleans, we will NOT be staying at the W on Poydras Street. It seems like they are asleep at the wheel here...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: 051411i
Reviews.Content: The W New Orleans has a wonderful staff who provided excellent service in addition to its great location just blocks from the French Quarter. Upon arrival at the hotel the valet staff eagerly assisted us with our bags. With check-in we were upgraded to a better suite without asking for it. The layout of the room was nice but was a bit cramped with not much walking space between the bed and the work desk and chair. The closet did not contain robes as did the rooms of our travel companions plus the room was a bit dusty. We really enjoyed the complimentary ride service in the Acura MDX. The ride service is only drop off service but still came in handy and was much better than taking a cab. The concierge service desk workers were extremely helpful with navigating the city. One couldn't ask for a better location with Harrah's casino across the street and blocks away from the Riverwalk, Convention Center, and French Quarter. We didn't eat or drink at the hotel since there are so many cheaper options in the French Quarter. I recommend the Praline Connection on Frenchmen Street for lunch and dinner at Olivier's on Decatur Street. And you can always find cheap drinks on Bourbon Street and live jazz at the Royal Sonesta Hotel also in Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service!”
Reviews.Author: MeganJ82
Reviews.Content: 13 of us stayed for a weekend for a bachelorette party. The people who worked in this hotel were outstanding! So willing to help and making things happen when we needed it. I was very impressed and would definitely stay here again. Tony and Kevin were our favorite concierges! Thank you so much for contributing to our fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “I hope other W properties are better”
Reviews.Author: luxurylady99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights here before a cruise. Upon checking in, they argued with us over our priceline reservation. They wanted to charge it all on our card. We were happy to give the card for extra expenses, but not to charge the room, because we'd already paid for it. They also seemed to be training someone at the front desk, which doesn't seem to be a good idea at 10:30 at night on a Friday. Our room was small but modern. The shower had absolutely no water pressure. Thisis clearly some older hotel they remodeled and slapped a "W" name on. I will say the common areas are very beautful and spacious. They claimed there was a shuttle, but we were never able to use it. They also refused to take it out any time there was a parade, and it being mardi gras, that was most of the time! That was when you actually found someone who had heard of the shuttle. Half the employees acted as though you asked for a ride in a spaceship. The people at the front desk would let you wait there a bit, finish their private conversation, and then talk to you. I was pretty disappointed, but then again, you're in New Orleans, how bad could it be?

Reviews.Title: “This hotel freakin' rocks!”
Reviews.Author: meganemilymorris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights on the second leg of our 10-day, 2100-mile roadtrip, and it couldn't have been a better stay. Everyone on staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and we even had a nice card and bottle of champagne waiting on us in our room (I had mentioned it was our delayed honeymoon when booking the room) from the manager. I am obsessive about cleanliness in a hotel, and the W delivered 100 percent. The hotel is not brand-new, but our room was impeccably cleaned and I didn't feel gross walking around without shoes on the carpet at all. The size of the room was perfect, the bed was extremely comfy and we had a nice LCD TV directly across from it mounted over the desk. But just to convince you that I'm not a covert W employee kissing my own behind, I'll point out that the bathroom door wouldn't stay open on its own, but we fixed that by using the in-room hair dryer to prop it open when necessary. Not a big deal at all. Everyone complains about parking in these reviews, but the fact is you're going to pay a ridiculous amount to park ANYWHERE in New Orleans at ANY hotel, at least downtown or in the French Quarter. Get over it. We valeted with them for $29/night and never had to get our car out until we left, but when we did it was returned quickly and without damage. The hotel is in a great locationâ€”a quick two-block jaunt to Bourbon Street, one block to Canal, half a block to Riverwalk and 10 steps to Harrah's. And if you want to go anywhere else that isn't within walking distance, the W has several drivers who'll ferry you there in a sweet Acura (but they won't pick you upâ€”so hone your cab-hailing skills before you leave). We did a little too much drinking on Bourbon Street our second night and didn't get to see everything we wanted to in New Orleans, so we'll be making a return trip at some point. And more than likely we'll be staying in the W when we do.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel stay ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: urbangirl1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few really nice hotels and I have to say not only was the W really nice but the service was EXCELLENT!!! From the moment I walked through the door I was greeted by Kevin and he was so extremely nice and very helpful to my mother and me. The entire time we were there he always greeted us with a smile and treated us extremely well. The entire staff was very professional and they really made us feel welcomed. I also had dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant - Zoe. I highly recommend the crab cakes. They were excellent and if you go to the restaurant for breakfast the blueberry pancakes are amazing!!!! I have to say I have been to New Orleans quite a few times and I've made it a point to stay in different hotels but now that I've been to the W, I don't know if I want to try another hotel. This one was perfectly located and I was able to walk all over the place. It was a great trip and partly because we had great accomodations. One more thing, I'm a very visual person and the fresh floral arrangements througout the hotel were works of art. Just amazing! I highly recommend W, New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “I Could Live Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: HommeNoir
Reviews.Content: What a surreal experience! I knew without ever staying at one that the W Hotel chain was top shelf, but until I actually stayed at one I truly had NO idea just how high on the shelf the W sat- All the way at the top in my book. W is now my hotel of choice when traveling, and I can't wait until there is one in every city. The W Hotel on Poydras is one of the older hotels in the chain and is due for a make over. My room felt a bit sparse, dated and "cold" as far as decor, but even in its current condition it caters very well to its 20 to 40-something chic, sexy and sophisticated clientele. The indoor/outdoor social area (bars, restaurants, lounges, rooftop pool and fitness area) are all prime areas to enjoy delicious food and beverages or workouts while watching the most gorgeous people enjoying the same. The staff is young, hip, stylish, knowledgeable and most importantly genuinely committed to making your stay as pleasant as possible.I felt right at home from the warm reception I received the moment I stepped through the huge double doors to the conceirge's heart-felt handshake the moment I left. The high light of my stay was meeting Travis the concierge. Anything you could possibly think of is within his realm of expertise. My tastes are simple: food, shopping and night life and site seeing, so he had no problem pointing me in the right directions. I travel to New Orleans 3-4 times per year, and prior to my stay at the W I spent my free time exploring the French Quarters. This time around I was ready for something different, and Travis did not disappoint. He turned me on to the Industrial District and Garden District with plenty of suggestions to fill each of my upcoming trips.

Reviews.Title: “Style, no substance”
Reviews.Author: RobynC66
Reviews.Content: Let me first say what is great about this hotel: the chic lobby, the location and a really comfortable bed. An easy walk to both the convention center and the French Quarter. What was annoying: 1. Nothing worked. Upon our arrival to our room, we had to have both the toilet and in-room safe fixed. The printer for the Flight Check-in Kiosk in the lobby was broken for the entire 6 days I was there. The roof-deck pool was out of service. 2. Housekeeping never came before 4pm. Once I had to call the desk at 4pm to ask if our room was going to be attended to, and another day I had to skip housekeeping altogether b/c I decided I wanted to nap at 4:30 instead. They also threw things away that shouldn't have been thrown away (my razor, for example). 3. Food service was lacking. I tried to get breakfast, the restaurant was pretty empty but I wasn't seated for at least 10 minutes while the waitstaff was laughing and chatting in the back - then I was seated without a menu, and after waiting another 15 minutes for a menu and water I finally left. The next morning I ordered room service and only half my breakfast arrived. To make amends, Travis the Concierge promised me a breakfast coupon. It was never delivered to my room as promised. Next time I'll try the Leows across the street.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Prepaid Reservation does not guarantee room category”
Reviews.Author: irwins0001
Reviews.Content: My wife and one other couple reserved 2 rooms for the 1st weekend of Jazz Fest. We are all in our 40's. We had prepaid our rooms (king), for 4 nights. This was the only option for that weekend. If we did not show we would lose the entire cost. I checked in 1st and was given a 2 bedroom. When I questioned the on duty manager I was asked who I booked through (W site). She then said that prepaying does not guarantee room category (not stated on website). No Kings were available. My friends checked in after and had booked through Yahoo. They were told they need to take it up with Yahoo. Ultimately, I was given $100 credit and moved the next night. A very nice gesture but a poor policy. I did contact the general manager by email from home and she stated that she will educate the front desk and upgrade my next stay. Another nice gesture, but I think a hotel in this price range shouldn't hassel guests. As far as the decor and noise level-you either like it or you don't. Personally, I think it is for the 20 something set. I prefer contemporary styling, and more intimate loby bars. Pro's- Service other than room assignment was very good, location is excellent, gym is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hasibc
Reviews.Content: Really well decorated hotel. Clean rooms and friendly, quick service. I travel enough to know what should and is to be expected from the hotel staff. One hotel staff, in In room Dining, Michael Lavigne, who delivered my dinner, was especially courteous. He always made sure that the order came in perfectly, to the minute detail, and always asked about how the service was, and if I needed anything else. I must say that with service like this, with the addition of a personal touch, goes a long way. I really liked this hotel, and will be back here, whenever I have to come to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mandi4
Reviews.Content: I have been a SPG member for years and usually love to stay at W hotels, but this New Orleans location did not meet my expectations for the following reasons: 1) Walls are paper thin...we could hear all of our neighbor's conversations (day and night) 2) Room service took over 2 hours to deliver (during normal daylight hours) 3) The Acura experience was not on time for our pick up and we missed a tour 4) Be aware this hotel allows pets and their are no pet-free floors (everything definitely had an odor)

Reviews.Title: “Great customer services... even before arrival”
Reviews.Author: fatbully
Reviews.Content: I've been a SPG platinum member for years, and from time to time I have been truly impressed by how I was treated at some nice properties around the world. I spent 190+ nights in a hotel last year and I don't give compliments lightly either. Typically, I was treated way better in foreign countries or Hawaii than any domestic hotels. I didn't expect too much before I came to NO, so I was little (pleasantly) surprised of my stay at W New Orleans. I haven't been to many W hotels and this was probably my 10th/11th W hotel I have visited so far. I booked one room at this hotel for one night during the Mother's Day weekend. Before my arrival, I indicated to the general manager (Angela) that I would be coming to celebrate my best friend's college graduation. Less than an hour after I sent the email, I received a greeting email from Angela telling me that she's gonna pre-block an upgraded room for me. For those who are not familiar with SPG upgrade policy, hotels are not obligated to provide an upgrade to any platinum members and any suite upgrade is based upon availability upon check-in. The swift response I got from the hotel manager really shows that the hotel is going extra mile to please their most loyal guests. Later that day, I got another email from the concierge (Brandon B.) who asked me a bunch of questions regarding my friend's favorite things and provided me with some excellent restaurant suggestions. On the day of check-in, as promised, we were given a wonderful wow suite at a high floor with river view. We were delighted and rested a bit before heading out for a dinner (reserved by our super nice Concierge Brandon). When we came back from our dinner, someone knocked on our door but we were not expecting anybody. I opened the door and a staff brought us a bottle of champagne, a fruit-plate, and a very cute handmade porcelain container (with lots of purple Kisses - my friend's favorite color) made in Peru (not China!!). The staff kept apologizing because they put this gift basket at the wrong room and they just realized they made a mistake. My friend and I were totally impressed and we really appreciated the gesture. We had a wonderful time in NO and good rest that night (thanks to the wonderful W bed)! The only regret was that I was not able to meet the GM in person to thank her and her staff for their generosity at this wonderful property!

Reviews.Title: “i was blown away”
Reviews.Author: shaheed8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W New Orleans and had a pleasurable experience. When I pulled in the drivewaym Bryan H was very helpful. Crystal at the desk was pleasant and knowledgeable. Darren, my ambassador, assisted with luggage and gave great recommendations for night life, and my driver Felton, he was avaliable to take me to conveniently located places. Thanks W New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: neeraj
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying in this hotel. The rooms were clean and decor was wonderful. My room was on the 16th floor and had a wonderful view of the street and the river. It was also quiet and had a very comfortable bed and pillows. Breakfast was great. I had buffet breakfast on most days but was treated to cooked breakfast from the menu on the final day. It is about 10 min walk from French Quarter and most of the attractions are within walking distance. The staff were very polite and courteous. Internet was very expensive - approximately $7 for 15min. In most cities in Europe, it is about 5 euro per hour and sometimes it is free. I did not have a laptop with me, but I think wifi is free.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special... expensive, loud, trendy, paper thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: ECBryant
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W- New Orleans for 5 nights, as our hotel reservations at another hotel were not secured. This is a very pricy hotel and nothing extra or special. The walls are so thin, I was in the bathroom and actually thought someone came in my room. It was the man in the next room talking on his cell phone. The hotel is for a young crowd, trendy, loud, and and the music that is played in the lobby is very trendy and upbeat. (not sure what type it was) The bathrooms are very small and the drain was extremly slow and backed up. Not sure what is going on with the decor, but not my taste. Lots of black laquer.

Reviews.Title: “Danny Alford, Chief Concierge is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: carol21403
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for the JazzFest. We had never stayed at this hotel.The hotel location was wonderful! We were very close to many fabulous restaurants. The bartenders in the lobby bar were wonderful..the drinks outstanding! Our trip was a great one not just because of the music and food at JazzFest but because our hotel stay was great. Our room was beautifully decorated and felt like home.Danny Alford, chief conceriege was so knowledgeable and helpful. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MKK10
Reviews.Content: Checkin was quick and smooth and staff is very service oriented. When we got in the room, we noticed the couch was stained, the New Orleans magazine had some liquid stains and was crinkled AND we could hear people outside our door so clearly we knew we couldn't stay in that room. We asked for a different room and was promptly moved to a room away from the elevator which was much quieter. The pool on the 4th floor is wonderful even though the water was very cold. The decor is very contemporary and attention to deal was great. I took my laptop to the library where you can get free WIFI and did some work comfortably while taking in the activity of people coming and going. It was spring break time plus there was a wedding in the hotel so it was very busy. The Livingroom, bar area and reception area are all well appointed and very contemporary. Loved it all. The consierge helped with dinner suggestions and reservations and gave us great recommendations. The location is wonderful. Being a ways away from the craziness of Bourbon Street and the French Quarter was nice. We went to the nightclub one evening and enjoyed the atmosphere as we danced among the 20 something yr. olds. Our stay included breakfast, however, it took a very long time to get our food which was mediocre in quality. The waitstaff was very nice and apologetic. The casino down the street was a fun stop on our way to the hotel one evening. There really is something for everyone in New Orleans. I would highly recommend the hotel. I've stayed at "W" hotels in the past and have enjoyed them all.

Reviews.Title: “Flashy fun an flirty”
Reviews.Author: Sugbaby2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 815 I work for habitat for humanity here for buisness ... And jazz fest ... My time was awsome front desk nice met my room attendant who was really awsome and has a very beautiful voice .... Walked in on her cleaning an singing ... Love the beds they were nice an soft I would recommend my friends and family to this hotel w hotel rocks

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BostongirlChicago
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at several W hotels, and all (including this one) are fine hotels. Clean, modern, gracious and attentive staff, and good location (if you like to gamble at the Harrah's casino, right across the street). Two negative experiences on this trip diminished our experience, however. We returned to our room on our second day to find the room cleaned and everthing apparently in order. That night, I noticed that the toiletries that the hotel provided (shampoo, conditioner, body wash) had been taken out of the shower and lined back up on the sink. They were all more than half empty (there were two of us using them). Why would housekeeping do that? Are they trying to save money? And why be so sneaky about it - they didn't just leave them in the shower and not give us new ones, they were deliberately taken out of the shower, dried, and put on the sink to look like new. I called the front desk at that point and asked for more toiletries; they were delivered that night in a gift bag which was a nice touch. Still, it left a bad taste in my mouth. As I mentioned, my husband and I like to gamble. We spent time each day at the Harrah's casino. Anyone who has ever visited a casino knows that you come out smelling like cigarette smoke. On the second day at the hotel, we noticed a post-it note on the mirror in our room, telling us not to smoke in the room or to face a $200 fine. My husband and I do not smoke, and never have. Our clothes and jackets did smell of smoke. This hotel is right across the street from the casino, they must have guests who come from the casino back to their rooms all the time - do we all get this nasty little note? Since we don't smoke, there was no evidence of smoking in our room, no ash trays, cigarette packs, matches etc. Again, rubbed me the wrong way. To sum up, you may have a lovely stay at this hotel; these may have both been the actions of one poorly trained housekeeper. Still, it's my only experience at this location, and I doubt we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF MAKES FOR GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: mp1ollack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W New Orleans for wedding central in late March and had a great time. Meeting planner, David Astley was awesome, as was the entire front staff, particularly Adrienne. The Ambassadors, (Doctor) Don, Lawrence, Kevin, and Felton, Concierges Travis & Danny and Joseph, Director of Welcome Desk, made our experience unparalleled. Thanks to all for an unforgettable time. We were there again this weekend for jazzfest and everyone remembered us and treated us like royalty...'what can we get you' is their motto. They really understand customer service and made for a wonderful time, again.

Reviews.Title: “W, It Doesn't Get Any Better”
Reviews.Author: ClarkeInc
Reviews.Content: From my arrival to my depature the W New Orleans WOW'ed me. The service was great, valet was very quick, concierge was reliable and the front desk was on top of everything. My room was perfect, I had a great view of Poydras and the theme of the room reminded me of my home city New York. I honestly can not wait to return back to this W property and as well as experience others.

Reviews.Title: “A sure bet”
Reviews.Author: JoeHouston52
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights as attending a convention. Just like the other W properties worldwide, this is a winner. Great location, good rooms, superb service.

Reviews.Title: “Best run hotel with great staff who just want to make you happy!”
Reviews.Author: luvs2trav
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted with cocktails on a silver tray, our stay at the W New Orleans was memorable! Everyone who works here seams more than delighted to "grant your wishes" for a fabulous time. We have traveled the globe, but had not stayed at W Hotels before and after this experience it will be tough to stay anywhere else. Also, the location is very convenient despite it not being in the French Quarter. It is walking distance from numerous attractions and just across the street from the famous NOLA eating establishment, Mothers Restaurant and the lovely August Restaurant. Two ends of the spectrum on dining!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Daniel C
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at a W hotel. I found the hotel was very comfortable. Our room was ready before the check in time and was spotless. Only small gripe was the some of the shutters were broken but that is not a big deal. The location could not be better. So close to everything but not loud to affect our sleep. The Bliss products in the room were great and much better than the standard hotel fare. This thing that seperated the hotel from others was the staff. They did the little things to help us make our stay great. The concierge helped us book a great swamp and plantation tour. Everytime we left they had apples and bottles of water for us. Our room keys were not set properly, when they realized the issue they came and found us with new ones. I would definitly recommend this place to anyone who wants a nicer upscale place near the french quarter

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: rockstar89
Reviews.Content: Spent 12 days at the W on business and it was fabulous. The front desk staff and greeters are always accommodating and the concierge knows everything possible about the city. The rooms, while not huge, are clean and comfortable with a modern flair. The lobby area is modern as well with all kinds of funky music playing day and night. Great location close to everything. Planning to be here another 12 nights soon.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect.”
Reviews.Author: dennis248
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, 5 minute walk to the French Quarter, the warehouse district or the river. Upgraded to a deluxe room and allowed to check in upon my arrival, 11:30 a.m. Room was large, comfortable and CLEAN. Front desk staff was cool. Only problem was the restaurant. Breakfast was expensive, service was slow and bird size portions. Have breakfast at Mother's or the $9.99 buffet at Harrah's, both a 1/2 block away. Visit New Orleans 2 to 3 times a year and won't stay anywhere else from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Personalized service, great knowledgeable staff, spacious rooms and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: AdriaChicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights with 3 other friends. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. The concierge was always very knowledgeable about local jazz clubs and restaurants, set us up with a guided tour of the city and checked us onto our departing flights. They always made sure we knew where we were going and if we needed any help. The hotel rooms are spaceous, very clean and the staff is accomodating in case you need any additional towel, etc. The hotel decor (lobby, bar area, pool) is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller28Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days and it really was an enjoyable stay. Rooms are very well decorated and have all the things you need as well as the extras such as IPOD dock and Bliss products in the bathroom. Great gym too with good quality equipment. Staff very helpful with a great concierge who are more than happy to book restaurants and give advice on what to see and do. This is a really good hotel and in a safe area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for small meetings but subpar lodging for a W”
Reviews.Author: Superwhammy
Reviews.Content: My company held our National Sales meeting at this location and after spending a week on this property I have a very mixed review. The conference facilities and staff were wonderful and since I was in charge of all of our presentations and sessions they made my life easy. The food and serving staff were wonderful and accommodating and the lounge and bar areas were very welcoming and open. However my Spectacular Room was anything but, I got stuck in an awkward corner room that required some dancing just to get into with an angled entry way and the bathroom tile was in horrible shape and and overall the bathroom needed to be scrubbed down. Also to my dismay the tub had one of the slowest drains I have ever experienced. Not quite what you would expect from the W and as the week went on I heard from a number of my colleagues that had similar in room experiences.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SMShock
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of this hotel and I noticed drastic changes since the first time I visited. I visited NOLA for a St Patricks Day party and chose this hotel again. My check in process took about 15 minutes as the staff member walked back and forth to a back room without telling me what was going on. As a Platinum member, I was not upgraded to a suite, but was placed on a high floor with a view of the hotel next door. Was not asked what check-in amenity I desired either. Room was in pitiful condition. Marks on walls. Peeling wallpaper. Cracked tile in the shower. Stains all over the loveseat. Dusty, worn carpet. I prefer the location because it is quiet (away from the quarter) and close to the casino and warehouse/garden districts. Starwood needs to strongly consider either renaming this hotel a Four Points or upgrade the rooms as they do not meet the W brand standard.

Reviews.Title: “W hotel on Poydras: overall a good experience - especially Latoya Cain's service”
Reviews.Author: KMTman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W on Poydras for a conference. Unfortunately, the conference was scheduled for the same weekend as the NCAAs. Tried to check in early but with the number of people registered this was not possible. They did call my cell when my room was ready. The room was NOT as clean as it should be - very disappointing. There was hair in the bathtub and the toilet had something on it. Not W standards. Other than this, the stay was great. The complementary acura shuttles are a really nice touch. The bellmen are very attentive and the concierge was knowledgeable. The best part of my stay was LaToya Cain's service at Zoe (restaurant). She is true New Orleans and a true professional. The food at Zoe is great but the service (if you are lucky enough to have LaToya as your hostess or bartender) is even better.

Reviews.Title: “The W hasn't let me down yet...”
Reviews.Author: TinyDundee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three night stay at the W New Orleans. We choose to stay here mainly because I am (usually) loyal to Starwood properties, in particular the W, and we got an incredible rate. I kind of â€˜feltâ€™ like we should be staying at the other W but it was so much more expensive. However, once we got there I was surprised to see how compact New Orleans is â€“ we were literally a five minute walk from the French Quarter. I felt like this was for the most part a typical W Hotel â€“ trendy and modern, very clean, good service, Bliss products, Wonderful W bed, with very nice (albeit more pricey) bars. We didnâ€™t eat anything while we were there so I canâ€™t comment on the food. Itâ€™s nice that they provide free coffee in the mornings but it would be even nicer if the rooms themselves had coffee makers. I was particularly pleased that our room was ready when we arrived at 10 am in the morning. The concierge was very helpful and able to get us the reservations we wanted. The white curtain that automatically opens and closes when you enter and leave the hotel is very dramatic and made me feel like I just might be someone important. A couple of things I noticed that could be improved upon: 1. The towels seemed skimpy to me. I donâ€™t know why. I have never noticed this at any other W and these were W brand towels so maybe the W as a whole is skimping on their towels these days. Not that they were grungy and threadbare, just not as fluffy and not as big. 2. The lobby to this particular property is poorly designed, or maybe itâ€™s just not big enough. There was quite a line of people when we checked in and there is just nowhere for everyone to stand. Plus the concierge desk is right there, and people were passing through to go too and from the outdoorsâ€¦it was just too many people in too small of a place. Not sure what you could do to improve upon that short of redesigning the lobby, but it was kind of weird and awkward, particularly for a W. Other than that, I really canâ€™t complain. We wouldnâ€™t hesitate to recommend to a friend or family member and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Next time I'll stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: DrBunBun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment, even at a discount (from a travel website). My mom and I were in New Orleans for a relaxing get-away weekend. We're not fussy travelers, but the W was disappointing on many levels. Before I list my complaints, to be fair, there were some good things: nice bath amenities (although not all were replaced - a hassle I noticed someone else wrote about as well). The bed was comfortable, and there was plenty of hot water for shower/ tub. Unfortunately, for me the downsides dissuade me from returning or recommending this hotel to other travelers. I reserved our double room four months in advance, and when my mom and I arrived, the hotel clerk argued that we had actually reserved a king room (in spite of my reservation print-out which stated otherwise) and seemed annoyed when we protested. She told us that she could prepare a room for us if we were willing to wait a few hours. She took my cell phone number and promised to call when the room was ready. Four or so hours later we headed back to the hotel (they never did call) and we were told our room was ready. We gratefully headed upstairs after checking in. When we got to the room it was a King bed after all. I called down to the front desk to request that we be moved to a double room, as we had reserved, and we were told that none was available. My mom and I wanted to enjoy ourselves, so we decided to forget about it and move on with our weekend. The W did not feature in room coffee makers, an important feature for us, but you can call and have them bring one up. We called, and they said they would send one up straight away. It didn't, but after resting for a few hours we headed out for dinner. When we returned it still wasn't there, so I called again. A few hours later (now about midnight) they did deliver the coffeemaker, and I was glad because I was exhausted and wanted to go to bed! The phone rang a while later as I was drifting off - they were calling to make sure I got the coffee maker. Thanks. Service was very slow - on one day it was after 6pm before our room was made up. The Internet service in room is outrageously expensive - why don't they offer free wi-fi like other good hotels? On Saturday evening, my mother asked the concierge about music recommendations. He told her he "didn't know much about the music scene." Really? In New Orleans? We love this town and will be back again. Next time we'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: notebook10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in W hotel for 6 nights and was really happy with the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Only major problem was the wall-to-wall carpet that really causes respiratory problems (but it is in everywhere in the USA, don't understand why they use it). Decoration was modern and beutiful.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the French Quarter, not in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: dawoz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week about a year ago for a convention for work. The convention was actually at "Lowes" directly across the street, but being loyal to Starwood, I stayed here. Although the location isn't as desirable as the "W" French Quarter, it is a much nicer hotel than its French Quarter Counterpart. Nice lobby, a few bars.... Nice place. As an added bonus, it is directly across the street from "Mothers" a great place to grab some food when the lines aren't' too long. My first room was "average". Nothing special about it... although it did have a nice view of the city. After a few days they upgraded me to a 2 bedroom suite. The Suite didn't have a nice view, but it was still appreciated. At the time, they had some kind of deal going with Lexus and offered free rides within 3 miles of the hotel. I took advantage of that a few times... A nice feature. If you are visiting NOLA and would rather stay at a nicer hotel if you don't mind an extra 5 minute walk, I would recommend the W on Poydras.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and staff!”
Reviews.Author: SKBSKB
Reviews.Content: When travelling and working, having a great staff makes a huge difference in the quality of the stay. My day started with a flat tire on the way to the airport, almost missing a flight, yadda yadda yadda. You get the point! I found everyone at the bell desk, front desk, concierge, et cetera all happy and helpful. A special big thank you to Michelle in housekeeping. She kept our room spotless, and was really an awesome person and employee. Thanks to everyone at the W!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: jolonex
Reviews.Content: The location was good if you were going to any sporting event or concert. Otherwise it was a little ways from the traditional attractions in New Orleans. The valet guys were great, the front desk workers were great and the restaurant and in-hotel bars were great. However, the price of the valet parking was really expensive.The room was amazingly nice. Large flat screen tv, however, there was no HD service. I really liked the mp3 player. It allowed me to play my ipod at a nice volume. The shower had great pressure. If you like to gamble a little bit, the casino is right next door. We really enjoyed the experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is Mutton dressed as Lamb”
Reviews.Author: sydneyLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Terrible service, the staff are slow and unorganized. Room service was frequently forgotten. The layout of the rooms are very odd in shape the bathrooms are very small. This hotel needs a makeover. The worst experience ever !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location / Gracious Hosts”
Reviews.Author: Mazz56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the last few days of Mardi Gras. In spite of the madness in the streets, valets were great at hailing cabs when we needed one. Bed was very comfortable as seen in other reviews. We hardly spent any time in the hotel, to be quite honest, but we were very pleased to be staying here and NOT in the Quarter - just a short walk anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: GailS7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. The employees were helpful and friendly and the rooms were fantastic. The location was the best. I could walk to everything. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need an update--and some better staff management”
Reviews.Author: Abswim79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W New Orleans in early Feb of this year for a week long work trip to the area. Having never been to NoLa before, I was looking forward to the time I was going to spend there--and I really wanted the W to be better. I arrived on a Tuesday afternoon and found everyone from the woman who checked me in, to the guys who helped me with my luggage to be incredibly helpful. On my way out of town, my flight was canceled and I ended up hanging out in the W lobby for about an hour trying to straighten out flights and overnight arrangements. One of the managers who happened to see me, asked about my plight and asked what I had been paying for the room (since it was the weekend before the Superbowl and hotel rooms were going to be hard to come by if I got stranded I was really worried). He told me that, if need be, he would happily extend my rate and find me a room at the hotel. I was so grateful for his offer and told him so--but it turned out I didn't need it. A+ for service. The room I ended up in checking into for the week, however, was small and pretty run down-- a disappointment. I have stayed in a number of W hotels around the country including, NYC (three different properties) and Ft. Lauderdale and had come to expect a certain level of cleanliness but found the W New Orleans to be dowdy and dirty. The bathroom had dark stains on the tile grout right in front of the sink, the paint on the wall behind the toilet was peeling and cracked and the carpet was in need of either a good cleaning or being removed all together and replaced. I was wary of walking around barefoot, so even when I got out of the shower, the first thing I did was put on my socks. Being from NY, I was very happy to have some warmth in the air, but apparently 60-70 degrees is still cold for those who live in the area, so the heat was on in the room all the time (hovering near 75-78 degrees according to the thermostat on the wall)--and no matter what I did I couldn't get it to cool down enough to be comfortable. The second problem I had was with the gym. I went there every day I stayed at the W (since it rained nearly every day) and every time I went, it was 90 degrees in the gym no matter what the thermostat on the wall said. I complained to the front desk twice about the issue but during my entire stay it was never rectified. The only plus to a 90 degree gym--no one else is crazy enough to work out in it--so I had it to myself (even at 7am!). Finally--the restaurant. As is typical in all hotel restaurants--they are expensive, but the W was pretty ridiculous. I had some granola and fruit for breakfast early one morning and it ran me $30. This wouldn't have been so bad if I hadn't had to wait 45 minutes for it--and nearly missed my meeting as a result. It seems there was a conference at the hotel at the time and the W had failed to staff the restaurant with enough waitstaff to handle the influx of people. There was one woman seating folks and one woman serving, clearing and taking orders. To her credit she was courteous and as quick as possible given some really cranky (and quite rude) hotel guests--but it still took a very long time to get a refill on coffee and even the check. The W caters to both business travelers and pleasure travelers but on a Tuesday they should know better than to keep those business travelers waiting. Bad move. If you stay at this property, its cheaper (with better service and real NoLa feel) to go to Mothers right across the street (get the biscuits and the grits!). I didn't make the mistake of eating in the hotel again. I would recommend this hotel to women traveling solo (and for those of you who actually want to get some rest in the Big Easy), though I really hope they update their rooms soon. The location is close enough to the French Quarter that you can walk (during the day) and the W offers free rides over to the area at night (but only until a certain time at night). On the way back to the hotel, I'd recommend a taxi or walking with a male friend since there is a stretch along the casino that can be a little sketchy. Overall--it was ok for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times!”
Reviews.Author: SonicDeathMonkey72
Reviews.Content: 12 of us stayed at the W Poydras over a 3 day period for my bachelor party. First off, I'm sorry. Sorry to the staff that they had to put up with a bunch of 30 something year old hooligans out for a lurid good time. I'm just kidding, most of us were perfect gentleman. (Not you Vitty) First off, the staff was great! Everyone from the general manager who had a bottle of bubbly waiting for us upon check in to the maid staff who went the extra mile to have our rooms looking immaculate were absolutely great. I would especially like to thank the concierge (African American gentleman with dreadlocks) who was super friendly and amazingly helpful in giving us directions and restaurant suggestions. A lot of reviewers have compared this W to other W's they've stayed in have rated this one to be sub par. I have had the pleasure of staying at 8 different W's around the country on multiple occasions and I think this one was absolutely on par with the rest of them. The room was stylish, roomy, immaculately clean, and had a great view of the city and the river. It's just boring to gone on and on about how great the hotel was so I'm going to sum it up with a pro/con/fun things to do list The pros and fun things to do: -12-!5 minute walk from the French Quarter....trust me this is a good thing because you need to get away from the sensory over load that is the French Quarter. -Across the street from gambling (Harrahs) -Across the street from Mothers (Greasy delicious hangover cure all) -Free Acura driving service if available -Go to Coop's Place for some of the most amazing fried chicken and Jambalaya. -Go to Commander's Palace for some fancy pants dining. (Worth every penny) -Go to Cooter Brown's and watch sports (In the garden district and it has many different types of beers and there is a lot of cool old antebellum houses to see on the trolley ride to and fro) -Go to Mr. B's for the BBQ shrimp and Bloody Mary's -Go to Pat O'Brien's (Take a picture in front of the fountain and drink some girly drinks) -Go to K-Pauls -Go to Nola's The only con that I could come up with is that we wish the hotel bar was open later. Any way I was glad to be able to spend some quality time with the boys at the W Poydras. Good Times Indeed

Reviews.Title: “Snobs”
Reviews.Author: ZoeandJack_10
Reviews.Content: Booked a SMOKING room and after 500 miles of travel we were told they only had two smoking rooms in the building (23 floors-come on!) and none were available. Too Bad so Sad for us. You couldn't smoke but you could bring your dog so we got to sleep listening to dogs barking up and down the hall. How POSH!!! Everything in the room had a pricetag on it-afraid to touch anything. They don't even furnish coffee in the rooms-you either have to pay for it-$16.50 for 4 cups rooms service or get dressed and go downstairs. The wait staff was great except the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a homerun.... but slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TravelHeart914
Reviews.Content: The hotel certainly lives up to the well known "W" standard as far as aesthetics and luxury are concerned; however we were rather disappointed with a few of their supposed conveniences. For starters, when we first arrived, my friends mentioned that we were there to celebrate my milestone birthday, and asked if they could do something special in the room for me. The front desk agent was rather rude to my friend and declined the request.... the kicker was that the only reason my friend had asked for the "special" treatment was because she had just overheard the group checking in before us, and a different agent said they would send up complimentary champagne. To further disappoint us upon check-in, they told us that the pool was under renovations, and that we would not be able to go during the length of our stay. When my friends called in to reserve the rooms the month prior, nobody informed them of the renovations, which clearly would have affected our decision to stay at the hotel. They informed us that we could visit the pool at the French Quarter W Hotel and that we could take the complimentary Acura car service.... unfortunately this turned out to be another HUGE disappointment. There was only ONE car on duty during the weekend, and the wait time for the service was absurd! We ended up using cabs during the length of our stay. Overall, the general experience was good. We had great cocktails and service in 3 of the lounges there and both the guest rooms and common areas were decorated with the chic sophistication that all W Hotels are known for. I would consider visiting again, but I would certainly confirm that all of the ammenities were at 100% before doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best W, but fine”
Reviews.Author: dstraveler12
Reviews.Content: It's a W, but without a few of the finishing touches that make me love Starwood. No available outlets near the desk (even W's hipster guests need to plug in their cellphone without reaching behind the minibar!), a fair amount of noise (not the W's fault, although hallway and next-door conversations were very audible). Overall If you like W you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel Setting in an Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: SKDMumbai
Reviews.Content: Modern decor, spacious rooms & a very decent gym for a hotel. The hotel is ideally located. The restaurant menu requires to be improved. The service in the hotel is less than adequate though. Walking distance to the French quarter. All in all the hotel is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Asked to speak to Manager”
Reviews.Author: asudarshan
Reviews.Content: We had a nice trip to New Orleans at Christmas and an average stay at the W. I left several messages with the front desk staff that I would like to speak to the General Manager but have not been contact yet. I would appreciate a call or email. The hotel itself is beautiful, the drinks are great and with one notable exception, the service staff is impeccable. They cared for us like family. A Sudarshan

Reviews.Title: “I freakin LOVED IT!!!!! Great People!!! Great Service! Pure Luxery!!!”
Reviews.Author: SCEJCaligurl
Reviews.Content: I love the W new Orleans Downtown... The staff are the best . They are not uppity, but they are highly upscale. They remember all their returning guest. They fix situations promtly... the bartenders in side Zoe are the best! Trichelle and Amanda left the best impact on me. The concierge deserve raises! Danny and Travis are the best! Thay meke you feel like a celebrity! In-room dining really serves you whatever/ whenever! Mike is a doll! Joseph the director is level headed, doesnt over extend his authority! He's a solution maker instead of an "im right, you're wrong" authoritive manner. The bellmans are so clean, well-mannered, jolly, and informative! Best bellman Hayward aka "Mr. W" lol. The drivers for the complimentary Acura service actually know the city so you dont have to know turn by turn directions to get where your going. The cleaning ladies are so down to earth and willing to work with your schedule. Mini Bar service are so nice they also work around your time. I really love it here! I wish all the Ws around the world were like this one! I wouldve given 6 stars but i cant so... ****** 6 star treatment!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is recommended”
Reviews.Author: minsam
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel last week and was very impressed with the place and its staff. It is within walking distance to many attactions. I rented a Fantastic Suite and used the main room for a business meeting. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my stay and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, incredible service, great for groups.”
Reviews.Author: mbsa2
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this review for a while, because the W New Orleans is one of the most fun hotels I've ever stayed at. I went down in July of 2009 for a bachelor party with 12 of my closest friends. I planned the party, and picked the W New Orleans on a recommendation from a friend who had been before. The location simply couldn't have been better. The peace and quiet of being outside the French Quarter, but within easy walking distance of less tham 5 minutes. The casino across the street. Mother's next door! I think I took a taxi once in the entire three days. The staff was such a pleasure to deal with. They handled complicated check-ins and payments with each and grace, helped arrange transportation for our group, and dealt with some fairly unusual requests. Very reasonably priced. Everyone was really impressed. In fact, I probably got more comments about how great the hotel was than any other aspect of the trip. It was so good that I am returning to the W New Orleans this spring with a group TWICE the size. Be on the lookout.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for the faux-hip businessperson”
Reviews.Author: robert240
Reviews.Content: My first stay at a W. Very comfy bed, very small room, very chic bathroom, very splashy sink. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant, the lobby was chain store hip. All in all, a modern chain hotel trying to be cool. Oh, and they charge for using the business center!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EWRFlyerAL
Reviews.Content: I spent New Year's at the W New Orleans and am happy that I selected this hotel. The location is great with Harrah's across the street, only a few blocks to the Riverwalk, and just a short walk to the French Quarter. The hotel itself is nicely decorated with a beautiful lobby, bar, and pool area (it was too cold to use the pool, but it was nice with cabanas and plenty of seating). I booked a Wonderful Room and had some issues with my reservation prior to staying (the hotel changed the room rate and type), but these were rectified with an e-mail to the hotel. They upgraded our room to a Spectacular Room (not sure if this was because of the mix-up or due to my SPG Platinum status). The room itself was modern with nice plantation shutters that blocked out the light, typical trendy W furnishings, and a decent amount of space. This hotel is also within walking distance to the convention center, so it's good for business travelers. I would recommend this W and will stay here again when I return to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it...”
Reviews.Author: iluvdatiger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during xmas because he got an $85 room rate, it's pet friendly and has a good location. The staff were all very nice and the concierge even gave my puppy some treats while we were in the lobby. The bed was comfy and had a cozy couch in the room too. I also liked how much counter space our bathroom had. The strange thing about the room was its furnishings kinda looked worn out and whoever painted the walls must have been blindfolded. Another strange thing was when I called to have the comforter changed out...they brought up this small blankie that looked like they had brought it from home. I called housekeeping immediately and told them and they apologized and assured me the proper comforter would be brought up ASAP. They had someone up to our room in a few short minutes to exchange the wierd blanket for the correct down comforter. We ordered some food from the Zoe Restaurant located on the 2nd or 3rd floor. The bbq pizza was very good. I thought the overall style of the hotel was cool. The Whiskey Blue bar downstairs used to be a cool place to have drinks but now it's kinda hit or miss. Harrah's hotel is literally across the street and you can also walk across the street to Loew's Hotel and eat at Cafe Adelaide.

Reviews.Title: “My Wish was not granted”
Reviews.Author: bob75081
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel New Orleans was very nice. Great detail was made to the lobby and dining area. The room was nice with a flat screen TV, mini-bar, and a clean bathroom and bedroom. Although the room looked great, the A/C in the room was not working. Almost every day during our stay the room was heated to 78 degrees. After multiple attempts to turn the temperature down by myself to my desired temperature, a call to hotel maintenance were made and a visit was made to fix the A/Câ€¦they did not. The thermostat was lowered a couple degrees by the maintenance man, but the room was still hot. After a second call to the front desk to have the A/C fixed, another man from hotel maintenance was going to visit our room to correct the problemâ€¦he never did come. When I returned to my room after dinner, all of the food and beverages from the mini-bar were missing. After a call to the front desk thinking some had broken into my room, the items had been removed because a large group of people were staying and at the hotel and there were â€œnot enough mini-bar items available.â€� After about an hour, the manager called to apologies and said the items could not be put back into my room until tomorrow, the day of my departure. The staff never informed me they were going into my room during my stay to remove the mini-bar items. I strongly believe the ONLY reason a hotel staff member should enter a guests room is when they are cleaning the room or there is an emergency of some sort. There is no policy I am aware of pertaining to the mini-bar. At other 4 star hotels I stay at, once the mini-bar items are in the room at the beginning of a guests stay, it stays until the guest leaves. The smoke detector in my room had wires shooting out of it, the water from the tub/shower leaked and dripped all night, the room safety deposit box did not close, and the bed was too soft with not enough back support. The hotel appears to be nice with their iPod charger, in-hotel bar, and contemporary theme, but if the guest requirements for comfort and safety are not met, there is very little chance of their return for a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Fitzychick
Reviews.Content: My husband is partial to W Hotels, and we got a reasonable deal, so we booked a family vacation here over Christmas. I admit that I was worried. Traveling with my elderly -- and admittedly, unhip -- parents, I feared that if the hotel actually did live up to its too-cool and black-clad reputation, that they wouldn't be comfortable. And if some of the reviews here were true, then we were all in for disappointment. I'm pleased to report that we all had a wonderful stay. The trademark W vibe was there, but nicely tempered by Southern hospitality and service. My 84-year-old mother was dancing to the music in the elevators and charmed by the attention she got from Don and others in the lobby. Location was perfect -- walking distance to everything if you can walk a couple of blocks (only across a small street to the casino; two blocks to the Riverfront streetcar; a few more blocks to the French Quarter), yet far enough from the really touristy stuff to relax. We did have a few issues with water temperature control in our rooms, but I don't think the solution is to tear down a perfectly good building to erect a sparkling new shrine honoring waste and shallow thinking. I'd stay there again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “WOW- Woe is more like it”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBocaRaton_Fl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel quite frequently and always make it a priority to stay at Starwood Hotels, particularly the W-I had received an email Sunday morning asking how was our stay and responded with the below - I have just received the same request this morning so I am assuming my first response was not read, just adding insult We got in on Wednesday Dec. 23 â€“ we had booked months in advance â€“in August- requesting a Marvelous Suite â€“ the first night we were using our points, the balance of the stay we were paying for â€“ I wanted to make sure that we would stay in the same room throughout the stay â€“ I verified this prior to leaving Florida- also at that time requested a refrigerator in the room. When we arrived the bellman suggested we get a river view â€“ we said sure- that would be nice â€“the desk said that the room available with the river view would have two beds, not a king â€“ we said no problem- and again reiterated we would like a refrigerator â€“ When we got to our room it was nothing like we expected â€“ it was very small, laid out in a way that two people could not pass at the entrance, the tiles in the bathroom were popping off the floor, the bath mats were frayed, the refrigerator never came â€“ our whole purpose of reserving the marvelous suite was to have a separate living area- this obviously did not â€“ I went down the next morning and spoke to the manager â€“ he confirmed that this was not a marvelous suite but that he had adjusted the price â€“ we had never asked for a lower priced room, that was not the issue- we wanted the suite so we would have space to move and work â€“he said he would get us a different room, that they would take care of the move, and that it would be done before three pm â€“ I asked if he had a better time frame as we were going out- he said donâ€™t worry I will call you â€“ we gave him both cell numbers- at 3:30 I still had not heard so I came back to the hotel â€“ we had been staying in a friends room at Harrahs waiting for the call- I came over and he said yes our move had been made â€“ I asked why we had not been called and he said that he knew we were out and we would find out when we checked back in â€“ so we basically lost the use of a room we were paying for for the entire day. Christmas morning we ordered up two pots of coffee, and requested extra cream â€“ the coffee came and there was no extra cream , we were told they would be right back- when we went to pour the decaf we noticed that the glass spout was broken and chipped off- not knowing where the glass went we called back down and asked for a replacement pot- after waiting about twenty minutes I just went down to level two and got coffee to carry up-this was on Christmas Day â€“ Nine oclock there is a knock on our door â€“ maid wanted to come in to service room â€“ we feel this was very early, especially on Christmas Day â€“ give us a chance to drink the coffee that finally came- This morning we ordered up two pots of coffee again â€“ and guess what- the same broken glass carafe shows up and again no extra cream so back down I went to the second floor not wanting to wait another twenty minutes.We had also ordered an English Muffin that arrive untoasted â€“ this may be a local custom I am not aware of but I have never ordered an English Muffin and had it delivered untoasted- The housekeeping in general has really deteriorated â€“ the Good Morning Welcome mat, what we always thought was just a nice touch, is still out at 4 in the afternoon, If you call down to the desk you are put on hold for a very long time, the shampoos and conditioners were not replaced in the room â€“ and to top it all off when we got the bill this morning there was a $27.charge for a fax delivery to the room. We come to New Orleans quite often and have stayed at Soniat House and this W- Soniat House had sent us an offer for an upgraded room for this time period for $199 a night â€“ rather than cancelling our reservations here we kept them â€“ I now wish we had canceled and returned to Soniat House We just returned from staying at the Nines in Portland and the Diplomat in Hollywood Fl. â€“ both experiences were delightful as usual â€“ I donâ€™t know what has happened to this hotel but I know we will be looking for alternate arrangements when we return in April This hotel is far from a WOW â€“ Woe is more like it â€“ One last item- the discount card to be used at Saks Fifth Avenue was a nice touch â€“ we received this card upon arrival on Dec 23 when I mentioned going over to Saks â€“unfortunately the card expired on 12/20-

Reviews.Title: “Liked it so much I returned again”
Reviews.Author: ZP83
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel for the first time in the winter of 2007 and again in the winter of 2008 and love love loved this hotel from its staff to its wonderfully modern but warm rooms. I think this hotel really is in a great location if you want to be close to the action but far enough away not to hear anything. The beds are ridiculous might i just add and anyone would be foolish to say that they cant sleep in these beds. The staff was always helpful in recommending places to go and eat both times I was there and always said hello to me and my friends every time we walked in. This is the only hotel I will stay in when I go to New Orleans. Its young, hip, modern, stylish, and warm. It is the perfect hotel if you want a get away for the weekend in new orleans and is not overly posh. Hats off to the W New Orleans! Keep it up

Reviews.Title: “Don't get it”
Reviews.Author: Holidayguest
Reviews.Content: My first stay in a W and I just don't get it. This property is a 1960s concrete block chain hotel with a fancy atrium and not much else. The rooms were small, cheaply furnished, noisy and dirty. Bathrooms were tiny and don't seem to have been updated since the place was built. Service was lousy, apart from the over excitable "greeter" who was just annoying. Being a Starwood property, everything is extra cost - internet, breakfast, parking, are all way overpriced. I realise the W brand has been successful in marketing a hip boutique image, but it's all on the surface and pretty cynical. If this is the experience you want, then stay in an independent boutique hotel where the staff and owners really care.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: girl_from_nowhere
Reviews.Content: When I arrived in New Orleans, I ended up with a cab driver who tried to charge me too much for my ride. Darren, the valet and bell hop, was kind, helpful and apologetic for the types of people in this world who try to take advantage of others. The staff at this hotel was very nice and cheerful. I ordered room service one night and the service ended up being extremely slow. They made up for it by giving me a voucher for the bar. I don't know whether they have a business office but they provided me a free FedEx box and did not charge me extra to ship the package (most hotels charge).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Sofoula13
Reviews.Content: I was in NOLA for a wedding, and while everyone else was staying at the Roosevelt (where the wedding would be) I got the same price for 2 nights at the W that everyone paid as the wedding group rate for one night at the Roosevelt, so I have to say that right off the bat, I was happy because I got a deal. That said, the W on Poydras is good, but not great. The Staff: very courteous (like most people in NOLA) and responsive to requests. OH and they'll print off your boarding pass for you at the reception desk, or if you fill out a little slip with your info, they'll do it ahead of time and stick it under your door, and they took the time to review the seats available on my flight when I wanted to check in and get a different seat. They have computers you can use in the lobby (not quite a traditional business center since it's all out in the open) but the worse part about that is that they charge by the minute! redonkulous! Location: Right across the street from Mother's (a NOLA landmark) and Harrah's...though it's closer to the waterfront than the French Quarter, it's still within a reasonable walking distance. Worst case, you take a $6 cab ride to the Quarter and start your walking there. I did both depending on the shoes I had on.
