The hotel itself is currently undergoing some kind of renovation (or at least I think they are...) as I stayed on the 4th floor (Floors 5 through the top require a key card for access on the elevator...I would've preferred to have been on one of those floors, had I known) and portions of the carpet were covered in taped down cardboard. Again, not sure why. The room itself had upgraded features in the bathroom, but it had the original tile on the floor which though classic, look dated. The carpeting in the room also had flicks and spots of discoloration. Nothing that would ruin a vacation, obviously, but it definitely didn't have the 'polished' look that most Ws do. I have to say, unlike some others who raved about the Bliss products in the bathroom, I hated them. As a mater of fact, I can't remember the last time I left the free-bees at the hotel. Why would I want my hair to smell like cirtus peppermint (or something rancid like that?). They were gross, if you like regular shampoo smell, make sure to pack your own. The ROOM: modern bar, huge desk, flat screen tv, chaise and shutter windows which I liked. Though really the BEST feature in the room was the iPod radio. Why this has not become a necessary feature in all hotel chains? I do not know. Anyhow, all in all, I got a great rate through Expedia, for a pretty great W. Bottom line anyhow, if you're spending too much time in your room in NOLA, you're missing the point of being there! go eat and drink!

Reviews.Title: “Late check-in beware”
Reviews.Author: Harrald
Reviews.Content: I had a room booked for 3 nights at this hotel. A week before I was to arrive I called and asked for a late check in. I was told I could arrive as late as 2am. The morning of my flight there was a computer glitch with the airlines. I called the "W" again at 11am and checked my late check in. The reservation desk told me "You'll be fine". At 1am when I arrived I was told there are no open rooms. The reception desk did what they could and got me into another hotel 5 blocks away. They paid for my cab and sent me on my way. After having to play the check in game at another hotel I finally got to bed at 2:30am At 6:30am I got back to the "W" (I had a 7am appointment at the "W") and checked in. They took my bag and told me it would be waiting for me in my room when I came back from work. At about 1:10pm I got a call telling my my room was ready and my bag was on it's way up. All I had to do was stop at the front desk and pick up my key. The rooms are fine. The hallways are loud. It's tough to sleep when people are coming back to their rooms at all hours (till 4am) after partying in the French Quarter. It is New Orleans though so you can't blame the hotel. After calling to check on a reservation twice, I wasn't expecting to lose a (very important) hour of sleep because of overbooking. The staff was polite and apologetic but it doesn't make up for overbooking and not honoring a confirmed late check in. I would tell anyone thinking about staying at this hotel to arrive before your check in and be prepared for a night in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy environment”
Reviews.Author: kjack49
Reviews.Content: Have stayed dozens of times in many hotels in N.O. This was, by far, the noisiest stay. We were on the top floor, so street noise was not a major problem, but the rooms were so poorly insulated that every word spoken in neighboring rooms could be heard, even at normal conversational levels. Hallway noise was also very evident. Did not make for a restful room. The fitness center required a GPS to find....long hallway, several flights of stairs up into a "dead-end" room. Would have been frightened for my wife to go there alone. While the decor of the hotel is "hip", the construction is old and dated with very small bathrooms and small rooms. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our complaints were basically related to structure of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- but not great”
Reviews.Author: jimbonash
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great lobby and a few nice bars. I've been to a few W properties before and the rooms here were not really up to par. Nice styling, but the bathrooms seemed outdated for this hotel. Great location for the gamblers though.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: mt0626
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward with my stay in the city at the "NICE" W hotel. it was going to be my first time there with my husband for his birthday, a few of my friends recommended the hotel. i booked my stay through their website, so therefore i made mistake and book the wrong date. i called to asked if i can move it just a day ahead, they told me no. its non refundable, i mean they already charged my card, its not like im asking for my money back, just asked to move it to the day before it was originally booked. they couldnt even do it. im really upset, i just lost out on 200 bucks on hard earning money, i will surely not recommend it to any of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: ha39727
Reviews.Content: I took a girls' weekend trip to New Orleans with my sister-in-law to the W in NOLA. Initially, I was VERY impressed with the service. I also liked the snazzy toiletries that they give you. My one complaint, and it is a big one, is that the room allowed for an inordinate amount of street noise to come into the room. I understand that this is the French Quarter, but for that price (over $300 per night for our room) I want to be able to sleep after partying on Bourbon. The booming from the car stereos on the street outside literally rattled my teeth. I've traveled all over the world and this was by far the WORST night's sleep I have every had in a hotel. By the way, we probably would have stayed on Bourbon Street long after midnight, but we witnessed a woman being shot in the doorway of a nightclub right in the middle of Bourbon Street. Therefore, we took refuge in our hotel room only to be rattled out of bed by the boom-boom of gansta rap. VERY DISAPPOINTING TRIP TO NOLA. WILL NOT RETURN.

Reviews.Title: “Love Travis”
Reviews.Author: town_n_cntry
Reviews.Content: The concierge, Travis Frye, is awesome. Quite responsive, good at listening to the guests thoughts, and recommended some great restaurants off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the W!"”
Reviews.Author: bowlheimer
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the W New Orleans. There were hits and misses, but the overall experience was a good one. The car service offered by the hotel was fantastic - a free ride (we always tipped the driver though) anywhere within 6 miles! Super convenient and a real bonus. The concierges were mixed - always very pleasant, but mixed on knowledge of things to do and places to go. One told us there weren't any guided walking tours of the Garden District when we had a brochure for a company offering exactly that in our rooms, and saw 5 other tour groups once we arranged the tour ourselves! The rooms were nice - small, but comfortable and clean. No fans in the bathrooms meant waiting for the steam to dissipate before being able to use the mirror, but not a huge deal for us. The pool was under construction which was a bummer. The other staff was mixed - great front desk staff, pretty inconsistent wait staff at the restaurant and bars. And Whisky Blue was CLOSED at 7pm on a Thursday night??? Very bizarre. Overall, though, we had a great time. We liked the location - it was accessible to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Much ado about nothing”
Reviews.Author: spikeTX
Reviews.Content: I generally like W hotels because i enjoy contemporary architecture. I did not enjoy the W New Orleans. For the price, I can't think of a worse hotel I have stayed in. Where to start? Check in was smooth and easy. Friendly desk attendant. The room was spacious and well furnished. On closer inspection, it was quite bad. Two of the lamps in the rom didn't work. The AC/ heat worked intermittently and was very loud. The paint job was comical. Apparently it was recently repainted by a 5 year old. White paint from the walls on the carpet. Whoever painted the grey walls in the bath painted parts of the floor and shower tiles. Internet- $15/ day. I can't remember the last time i was expected to pay for internet service. The restaurant was comical. They had a pretty good breakfast buffet, for $26. At dinner, they didn't seem to expect to have quests. They had a very short menu, which they called tapas. In truth it was just a few small meals that could be prepared in the kitchen with a minimum of time and one staff member. The guests at the table next to me walked out. The next night I ordered from room service. Didn't get what I ordered, but at least was more comfortable in the room than in the restaurant. I was there for 4 days, housekeeping came twice. Not a real problem- I don't really need the room cleaned every day. But Kind of expect it at an upscale hotel. I checked out a day early but they charged me two extra days and one day of valet parking (i didn't have a car there). Pool is closed and undergoing renovations, although this wasn't a problem for me. I'm tempted to wrote off this very bad experience to a labor shortage caused by the hurricane 4 years ago. But friends staying at other hotels in the area reported no similar problems. It's a trendy hotel with nothing more to offer. I'm tempted to give up on Starwood. Although I hope this is just a bad apple in the basket.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Natasha Kogan!”
Reviews.Author: catalina_lara
Reviews.Content: Natasha, Its funny how a hotel can make you feel at home! My flight was delayed last night and I arrived pretty late and tired. It had been a while since I've been in town. I checked in and from the lady behind the counter, the concierge, the bell man, all friendly familiar faces! I was so happy to be back! I quickly forgot all the troubles of the day! Thank you so much for helping me with the rooms! I love staying at your property and it always brings back great memories. I hope you had a great day, and most importantly, have a wonderful weekend! Take care,

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: TennillePichon
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel to stay. it 's gets 5 star's. It's walking distance to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “This is a W hotel? Really?”
Reviews.Author: Atlas81
Reviews.Content: My huband and I just came back from our first trip to New Orleans. Surprisingly, we were NOT by any means, blown away by this hotel. I wish I had trusted other reviews before booking this "swanky" hotel. Because of the low season, prices were low and I jumped on the opportunity. Needless to say, this also attracted many young and rowdy crowds. The staff was quite friendly, but by no means, exceptional. The main reason I was disappointed was how unclean the room was! There were white spots on the lounge chaise, the dark duvet also had multiple stains. Other than the well kept lounge, we were suprised by how unclean the rooms were! To top it off the pool was under construction and closed and the gym had several broken machines. After we finished up using the gym, there was no water available in the water tank. I called the reception to refill it and in my dismay, it still was not refilled until the following morning! (I should tell you that I informed 3 people about the water situation and it still was not attended to until I called that morning). Lastly, wi-fi came with a hefty price. Who charges for internet use at a 4/5 star hotel? That was appauling. In this day and age, wireless should be free (considering it is free in most 3 star hotels/motels!!!). I find that almost insulting. There is no reason to charge your clients almost 17USD for 30 minutes of use. Overall, do NOT stay here if you are expecting the same level of quality and crowd as other W hotels worldwide. For those of you who are well travelled, you will be disappointed by the level of quality and refinement.

Reviews.Title: “"W"ow...... The best stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Stargaten
Reviews.Content: First I want to say a big thank you to the staff at the W New Orleans for making our vacation to New Orleans a very memorial one. Thanks to Brandon, Travis and Tony for being so wonderful to my wife and I. This trip to your great city was to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and you guys made it special. The next time we are in New Orleans we will be staying at the W.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: globetrottin13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend for my bestfriend's bday and it was amazing! Everything that we had hoped for, fun.hip,and comfortable! The hotel was in walking distance from everything we needed but the Acura was a nice touch! We did have a issue with valet but the manager (black lady with cute bobb haircut) was so nice and compensated us for the inconvience. The staff was extra friendly and very helpful, some of the great staff we came in contact with were Felton,Travis,Brandon, and Travis. But I would like to give extra thanks to the ladies in the restaurant Trichelle and I am not sure of the other ladies name but they were so sweet and personable! And last but niot least DARIUS he was speedy everytime we needed towels, soap,toothpaste and gave us directions, restaurant suggestions and let us know all the hot spots to go, he went that extra mile! Keep doing what you do!!!! We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Holy @#$%! Are you serious?”
Reviews.Author: GullfCoastalTraveler
Reviews.Content: If there is a purpose for Trip Advisor its to help travelers like me find great places and help me stay away from not so great places. I am a very laid back kinda guy and very understanding and have never written a negative review. I travel constantly and have stayed in every conceivable type of hotel there is all over the planet, and had all sorts of experiences. W bills themselves as a Luxury Boutique Hotel that prides itself on customer service. I found that there service is unprofessional and negligent. My major complaint: After opening a tab at the hotel bar with a credit card but then charging the drinks to the room, I was double charged and had to spend a significant amount of time on the phone to resolve the issue. Days after the problem was presumably resolved a barrage of charges from the hotel and the bar appeared on both credit cards used during my stay, some dated three days after my checkout... and signed!. After several phone calls over the past few days and still no resolution. I am considering canceling my cards and reporting fraud. Honestly, and not because I am bitter, the W doesn't live up to its claims, its artsy and filled with smiling faces but thats about as far as it goes, there is no service to back it up. For example, we arrived to find the restaurant closed (supposed to be open) and the room service was limited to whatever a bellboy could fix. There motto is "Whatever, Whenever", now I will adopt a similar motto when it comes to this hotel and its whatever, and never again...I would keep going but I wouldn't read a review this long so I won't subject you to any more.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: needwings
Reviews.Content: I had heard such good things about this hotel from friends so I decided to try it out on a recent business trip to the Big Easy. Totally disappointed in general. But the kicker is the bill I received. I visited the so called trendy Whiskey Bar and opened a tab. When I checked out the next day my bill was not available so they emailed it to me. That's when I got the big SHOCK! One night cost me almost $700.00. Apparently the bartender used my room to charge her friends drinks and then charged my credit card for my drinks in addition to charging my room for the same amount!!! I then found an additional charge for $86.00 charge two days later. Each time I called to talk with the manager they were unavailable and no one seemed to remember my situation on the 3 separate times I called. Oh....and they didn't honor the rate I purchased online to include free parking (another 29.00) charge even though I had a confirmation with the rate description. I will NEVER stay in another Starwood hotel. Beware if you go to the W hotel in New Orleans. It is a rip off in more than one way.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need Upgrades”
Reviews.Author: UCLAdy04
Reviews.Content: In my prior visit to Nola I stayed at the JW Marriott, but I wanted to stay somewhere more active and fun so for my next visit I decided on the W. Check-in was smooth and took less than 10 minutes. When I got to the room at first I was very pleased, but then I started noticing quite a bit of wear and tear. For instance, there were scuffs on the walls and the white couch was just flat out dirty. It's also a little annoying how they jam pack the mini-fridge so that you can't anything in there without taking out 10 things. The walls are PAPER thin! I seriously could hear the entire conversation from the room next door. It was so loud it sounded like a guy had a megaphone to our wall as he was speaking. But with all that said you don't really stay at the W expecting a quiet, serene environment so it wasn't the biggest deal in the world. One other gripe is that our room key mysteriously stopped working and it took 15 minutes to get it straightened out at 3:30 in the morning. Another room also had the same problem. Overall...I had a pretty enjoyable stay at the W. There is tons of action and it's definitely a very stylish place to stay. Next time I return to Nola though I will stay somewhere else where the quality of the room is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectation, careless”
Reviews.Author: alsolution
Reviews.Content: I stayed in others W Hotels (San Francisco, Newark, CA, NYC Lexington) but this one is below my other W hotel expectation. I picked this location to celebrate my birthday. We arrived on a Saturday evening around 8:00 pm and took us around 10 minutes to check in. Only one front desk clerk available and he was trying to resolve a problem with a customer by phone. At the time that we arrived to the room I was happy to see a welcome fruit platter but then a realize that was for somebody else and the fruits was moldy. (I am a SPG Gold Member) We stayed for 2 nights and housekeeper never clear the plate. Then the King Size bed have a very nice Queens Size Bed Feather padding. A little uncomfortable if you sleep in the side of the bed in which I do. Bathroom picture frames are worn out. The tub drain was running very slow. I ended up cleaning the drain and found a lot of hair and a disposable razor cover in the drain. The computer by the elevator to print the airline boarding pass wasn't working. We even report it to the front desk but nothing happened I even sent a email to the GM but never got a response . However location of the hotel is awesome. across the street of the Harrah's Casino, couple of block of the french quarter, a cross the famous "mother" restaurant

Reviews.Title: “First Time to NO and it's all good!”
Reviews.Author: janelovestravel
Reviews.Content: My first stay in a W hotel...felt a little too old and nerdy but loved the experience. Can't say enough about the friendly staff. They work very hard to make the experience "w"onderful (sorry, couldn't help that). Didn't know what to expect from NO in general so I was pleasantly surprised with the area of town. Near the river...great part of town. The hotel could have felt cleaner but it may have just been the August humidity that felt a little 'not so clean'. Felt like I was on the set of a swanky magazine shoot with all the ambient lighting and cool chic decor. It was backed up with good food in-room dinning and even better at the restaurant. My room felt like a sanctuary. Cool and clean and great shower. It may have been the upgrade to the spectacular room from wonderful (higher floor). Don't know why everyone is yakking about paying for internet...I just logged on to the free wireless network...hello...what year is this?? The staff absolutely knocked themselves out with great service. LOVED the courtesy rides around town. Check in was a little crowded but the Saints were in town so the hotel was busy. Had to call on staff for new in room safe - it was handled very quickly and the security staff stayed in the room until the switch was complete...even gave us the names of some great restaurants! Had a walking accident on Bourbon st. and staff offered to take me to emergency clinic...thanks Brandon. More service than I have ever experienced at Four Seasons' and Ritz Carltons put together. Definitely the best part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be...”
Reviews.Author: floridagirl2223
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the W last weekend for a girls trip to NO with 4 others. We love W hotels and are starwood reward members. This hotel used to be so nice: clean, swanky, efficient, etc., however this visit was lacking. First, we had to wait until well past the 3 pm check in time before our room was ready, then the rooms they gave us were not adjoining as requested, so we had to wait longer. The staff was very nice and helpful, but not so efficient. The pool speakers were so badly blown that the music was distorted and would have been more enjoyable if it were just turned off. Price was great, location is great, but property is not being maintained to W standards in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamaica92
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel through Travelocity and was very pleased with the overall package. The hotel is nice but more importantly the staff is exceptional. The concierge servec is very good. They all were very helpful in the selection of restaurants and overall information. Dennis was great. The acura service provdies a personla car service within a six mile radius which is convenient and helps to save money. The room we had was on teh 22nd floor with a great view. The bed was very comfortable. The location is good. I am really surprised to read some of the review which complain about the staff. Our DVD malfunctioned and within five minutes the repair technician came and quickly repleced the DVD. There is a free DVD library and complimentary umbrellas when needed. I agree that the internet fee is very high - which I believe can be easily changed. Overall a good hotel which I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not WOW-worthy! Starwood Needs to Step it Up a Bit. Mixed review.”
Reviews.Author: HOBY_1986
Reviews.Content: First, let me say I was hesitant to book there based on the reviews here and elsewhere and know that the "W" is not for everyone, but we had planned a small gathering in the on-site Whiskey Blue and we were working at the Convention Center so it was convenient and the rate was great for off season. This property does have potential. I noticed that the GM Angela Thompson recently began posting canned responses with some minimal editing on Trip Advisor. While I'm glad they're looking at the reviews, but it is evident they are not addressing the core issues: housekeeping, maintenance, and responsiveness are lacking. If this post receives the typical cut and paste response from the hotel, we'll know that the guest experience is not a priority. The Wow's The bell staff is welcoming and warm and provides a desired experience - reflective of NOLA culture. Lawrence was my last W experience and he may have saved the whole property as he arranged my transport back to the MSY airport with a very friendly, personable, professional feel that made me forget the room I had slept in. The desk staff I interacted with were all smiles and easy going. Reginald and the on duty concierge (caucasian, enthusiastic, personable, bleach blond male) were assets as well when I checked in late). Taking time to say hello, introduce themselves and provide some insights on local restaurants: BBQ The Joint, Mr. B's in the Qtr, Casamento's, Acme Oyster (for the "experience"). In general, every time you came and left, the staff took note and said hello or wished you a good time. Thanks guys! "W" is known as a chic line and the lobby is a great reflection of that swanky feel - as is the whiskey blue bar. Nice feel, groove and vibe. Kudos to the designers for executing well there. That's where the WOW ends, because then you go to your room. The best way to describe it is WORN-OUT. The rooms are not up to par from a housekeeping standard, much less a quality standard. One detail I noticed in particular is that the bathroom towels did not match, there were 3 different brands: 'W', Cannon, and Pyramid on was the latter 2 were a shade or two off the W which caused you to notice the off white - non W color - maybe they outsource laundry - but this was a detail that most would pick up on and well, enough that I even wrote it down. The bathroom in particular was not clean, there were stains in the tile floor, the bathtub could have used a serious scrub with Comet or bleach. The rooms are on the smallish side - but that is a NOLA characteristic more than a property line due to the historic buildings that are often used. I am not sure that is the case here but plausible. The thin walls - I noticed I could here other rooms doors opening and closing but that was the extent of any disturbbance - pretty normal noise levels. The room carpet was stained in several areas and needs to be replaced. The mini-bar - had a few interesting souvenir items - a W hat, a W bear, a W intimacy kit that had been opened and the important items removed. Housekeeping never replaced that from the previous guests. Yes, I considered changing rooms. I am SPG Platinum - and received a minimal upgrade to Spectacular Room. However, my colleagues who also checked in had rooms that were of the same quality - so little if anything would have been gained unless we moved properties altogether. You shake your head and accept your fate sometimes. Notes: The hotel was not fully booked. Hot water and decent water pressure. Clean towels. Comfortable bed. Friendly staff. Good location, 5-6 block walk to French Qtr or 3-4 block walk to convention center. I would have rated service higher - however, management not addressing the cleanliness and maintenance prevents that. Recommendation - enjoy the lobby experience, skip the stay.

Reviews.Title: “W not a real W”
Reviews.Author: dksa9
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to stay at this W thinking it will be like all of the W's around the country think again. It is a converted hotel, which means the room dimensions are like that of a typical room you will find in any other hotel chain. I have stayed at many W's...Ft. Lauderdale, Dallas, LA, Atlanta, this hotel failed miserably in comparison. A regular double bed room is very small. 2 full size beds, a table for the tv and a small bathroom. That's it. The suites, however, are nice and spacious...for a hell of a price though. The pool is on the roof on the 4th floor. It's like a cruise ship pool...kinda small with a plastic bottom. No hot tub, low music and if you want sun...go early because after around 3 or so the sun will set behind the hotel. You have to pay for the internet...it is not free like the other hotels in NO. Find a meter because valet will cost you $28 a night...rip off. The other W in the French Quarter will cost you $34. Overall, I would definantly NOT ever stay at this hotel again. If you want something cool like the usual W's look at Loft 523 in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Style over content”
Reviews.Author: roadtrip97
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for work at the end of June. We were so looking forward to our stay but from the moment we got there, things went downhill. Our room was not ready and the rude, flippant front desk guy would not give us a time when the room would be ready. Had to dress for work in the pool bathroom because we did not have a room. The room was finally ready at 7:00 p.m. that night...ridiculous. The first two mornings, I had the gross experience of standing in 4 inches of water in a clogged shower. It was finally fixed on the third day. All of the cool, stylish decor means nothing when the basics are so incredibly lacking.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the W New Orleans were outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Spanky60048
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W with a group of 56 high school students. This size group could have been a challenge for the staff, but on the contrary they were very accomodating and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We found the rooms to be very nice, much in line with other W Hotels that I have stayed in. The location was outstanding. Overall a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and fabulous service.”
Reviews.Author: missms
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very chic. The lobby is beyond beautiful. Every employee was very helpful especially our bellman, Kevin. I have never had a bellman go to the extremes he did to accomodate our needs. He was there for us at the beginning all the way to the end. We especially liked the Acura car service. We were able to ride in luxuary to Magazine Street for shopping rather than catching a cab. Kevin, of course, arranged it for us. We will be back and tell our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome customary service”
Reviews.Author: kevin06
Reviews.Content: I was particulary impressed with the complimentary car service. I was fortunate enough to get a tour and drop offs over the course of my stay from a driver by the name of Felton Delmore. He was great and had a broad knowledge base of the city of New Orleans. If you are looking for a place where the locals enjoy a good meal, do not be too shy to ask him for a recommendation. You should request Felton as your driver, you won't regret it! Overall, I enjoyed the entire staff and can't wait to return to New Orleans to stay at this hotel. Now what's your "WISH"!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Wowvisor
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the Hotel W and all of the extra special things that this property offers to guests. Not to mention the fact that their staff otherwise known as their "Talent" goes out of their way to make your stay amazing! After all their motto is Whatever, Whenever! They certainly live up to it. I will definitely make this hotel a destination on my list for vacation, it's wonderful! Kudos to all of the staff at the Hotel W and to their Director of Talent Resources, Lisa Dusset for making our stay AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “WATCH UR POCKETS..PRICEY EVERYTHING..TOURIST BEWARE..STAY ANYWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: willaguila
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying how truly upset and disillusioned I was with my stay. I am a SPG member and have used them globally. My last two trips in Germany where in Sheratons Hotels. But, this trip was personal, in New Orleans. The check in was a nightmare. The â€œEssence Festivalâ€� was checking out of the hotel. I waited on line for over twenty minutes listening to the bickering over the room service charges and lack of service by other guests. This should have triggered me to question the service levels of this hotel. The room was TINY bit larger than my walking closet at home. The bathroom tiles were grimy and dirty, I found globs of hair in the drain. The toilet just barley flushed, and so on. All this I can deal with, because housekeeping was called and engineering was contacted. But I did have to wait over an hour for each to arrive. The front desk â€œNicoleâ€� and â€œAmberâ€� were very nice and useless. I do not want to be â€œyessedâ€� and hear half hearted apologies. I want the service W is known for. The concierge was not aware of any of the fees associated with the local museum and exhibits near by. It took over 30 minutes to get a phone call returned with in correct information. Where are the drawers to put away my clothes? This hotel stinks if you stay more than two days. I was completely living out of my suitcase. We were super uncomfortable and irritable. My credit cards and wallet were lost on the drive up from Miami. Luckily, I had my DL and debit card, in my pocket the night before. My debit card had authorization in excess of $700 my total bill was $283.00. I was charged and extra night with a higher rate. The deposit was held twice. It was so bad; I left a day earlier, and vowed never to stay here again. The front desk promised 5000 points to my SPG account. Starwood properties are usually the absolute best and I stay there whenever possible. However, New Orleans was a complete disappointment. I am still fighting with my bank to get the deposit back to my account. As a SPG member I feel I should be treated much better than this. The lack of services, better yet, the in difference is what gets me. It was undertones of there are other hotels in New Orleans Mr. Aguila. I just gave up and left. That is my feedback. NEVER AGAIN will I set foot in this hotel in New Orleans. Total disappointment and embarrassment to the W Hotel chain of hotels. I am confident I am not the only guest that has complained about the lack of service at this property.

Reviews.Title: “FABOLOUS”
Reviews.Author: ayp123
Reviews.Content: W New Orleans is the best hotel to stay at. Service is unbelievable! Management is fabolous and so accomodating and what a pleasure that is when you are on a leisure trip. I would recommend staying at this hotel anytime. This is my 2nd stay here and the service has been outstanding both times.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SeePalomaTravel
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel was phenomenal. My daughter and I had every need attended to. The beds were comfortable. The swimming pool was nothing special and the restaurants were OK, but we had a lovely room and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is within walking distance of the French Quarter and Canal st Streetcars.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay at the New Orleans W”
Reviews.Author: jbmullen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, cool and completely friendly. All the staff were extremely professional, but also made you feel welcome...whether coming in from the conference after a busy day , or just walking out in the morning. The concierge, Travis, was especially helpful with restaurant ideas and other questions we had. I'd definitely stay at this W again.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jockk407
Reviews.Content: We were unfortunately evacuated only two days into our 5 night stay so we didn't get much time on our last visit, but it was nice to see that the hotel was still run as well as I recall. The location is just a short walk from the Quarter, so it's generally quieter than the Quarter hotels. It's right across the street from Harrah's, two blocks from Riverwalk mall, two blocks from the Quarter...an all-around great location. This is a typical W, modern and trendy but comfortable. The lobby is very cool (I love the curtains that open as you approach from the parking area). Rooms are clean, comfortable and attractive, with flat screen TVs. I was a little annoyed by some hallway noise (mainly doors slamming from housekeeping) in my room that was located in a corner...I don't remember having this problem in the past when I stayed in other areas of the hall, so will probably ask for a different room next visit. Love the rooftop pool and gym, though if I remember right the pool used to be 24 hours and on my last stay, it wasn't. It should be. Also, the high speed internet fee, as with almost all Starwood properties, is a rip-off. But if you're used to staying with Starwood, this won't be surprising. Only real issue I had was with room service, which apparently was understaffed...it took a while to get ahold of anyone on the phone (after a few tries of many rings I would give up and call back in a few minutes), and then the food took a lot longer than expected. And I must say, the onion soup I ordered was the worst onion soup I'd ever had. Fortunately, they brought me something different which was better, and took off the entire charge for my troubles. Don't hesitate to stay here, great hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel but not quite up to the W Brand”
Reviews.Author: Mskellydoll
Reviews.Content: I will admit I am a W snob. I stay at a W whenever possible and I got an amazing room rate at this one in New Orleans this May. After having experiencing W hotels in Chicago and New York I was slightly dissapointed with this one. The lobby, bar and restaurant were dead-on, sexy ,chic and stylish. I held an event there and the staff were accomidating but not exactly polished and the meeting rooms left a little to be desired. My room was a double and pretty small. I entered the room and almost fell into the bathroom. The bathroom was very tiny and had the older fixtures like the original subway tile floor and old fashioned tub and fixtures which was kind of charming but they could have used an upgrade. The rug was a very unattractive brown color and was starting to fray along the seams of the room and the entry into the bathroom. Just not what I expect from this brand of hotels. All in all it was fine but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: mozzylizzy
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. It is in a great location-- near the French Quarter, without the hassle and noise of being IN the French Quarter-- also very close to the street cars. My husband and I stayed there for his 30th Birthday. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel and room were in great condition. Due to a medical emergency (labor) my husband I incurred a $750 room cleaning fee. I emailed the General Manager and she responded very promptly (within hours) and worked to get the charge removed. I could not have been more pleased!

Reviews.Title: “when can I go back”
Reviews.Author: 88buffs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the W. This was my third stay in three cities at same brand. The theme is spot on.. Cool curtains pull back as you enter, know doubt to keep the cool air in as it was very warm-even for those of us from Houston. Staff was great. Did work out and the pool and gym were dead Monday but active later in the week. Evening bar was fab but slow. Dont make or get coffee at the hotel. Walk directly across the street to Mothers for chickory coffee and then come back with your partner for the most incredible breakfast. So good and filling you will dream about the food but probably wont go back-too filling and a little too tourist. Try the "debris" on a biscuit but consult your cardiologist first. Yum. Will serve you a bloody at 8 am. Hotel has great drop off service and VERY knowledgable concierge. Right across from the casino and Drago' at the Hilton (big tourist spot for oysters but felt like a Luby's, food was okay). A little loud in the morning for late sleepers and be sure to call well ahead for your car. They have to park about three blocks away. Bell man was at my room before I hung up the phone. Best oysters are in the quarter at the southwest corner of the courthouse. Cant get the name but on a Tuesday afternoon about four couples besides us were just hanging out eating oysters the size of your hand drinking Mojito's for a looong time. Best shopping is north of Bourbon. Found an incredible watch shop and many cool "guy" places to hang; civil war armory, belt stores, collectibles. Third trip there and still amazed. We did drive down to the 9th ward-pure gut check. Not for kids but still felt safe and actually got out and walked around. People are desperate but were before the storms I sense-only different. Racial tensions dont seem to exist-I felt the same the few times I have been before. NO is truly a gem and not to be missed this time around. I would also strongly suggest the 1 hour paddle boat trip to battleground-the last battle of the civil war. Very sad story too long to mention here.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Patriot27
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and got upgraded to a two-room corner suite with a view of the city and river. Pros: Great location in walking distance to all major attractions, nice restaurant & bar, friendly staff, very comfortable bed, fitness center, and pool. Cons: Slow and unpredictable WIFI connection that was not worth paying for - hotel should consider new service provider. I'd recommend this property over the W French Quarter for the simple reasons that its rooms are more spacious, there's a fitness center and nightlife. Overall it was a great experience and worth your consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomadating”
Reviews.Author: JohnnySunshine
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the very nice and super cool staff at the W. My cousin and I had a great time and were provided with great recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “ADA meeting 2009”
Reviews.Author: PAOHtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the W hotel for the 2009 ADA meeting and the service was great. The concierge was especially helpful in setting up dinner reservations. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New Orleans to go to one of the conventions, as it is a short 10 min walk to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled”
Reviews.Author: HillTrav
Reviews.Content: W is my new favorite hotel! The decor is great, but even better was the staff! We were greeted by everyone, whether it was coming in or leaving the hotel or just in the hallway. My concierge, Brandon, was the BEST. He sent me to the best restaurants the city has, and not just the tourist spots, but hidden gems and local spots. He gave me the lowdown on life in the Big Easy, and life at W. He was happy, helpful and friendly. I would like to take him to every new city I go to. Because of Brandon and the other concierges at W New Orleans, I was not uncomfortable being alone while Hubby was at conferences. My only complaint is that the bathroom needed a little, very little, TLC. Clean out the pipes and fix pictures that have been damaged by steam. Not much of a complaint and certainly doesn't change my love for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Different, great lounge, rooms not was I expected”
Reviews.Author: Lesliep1209
Reviews.Content: Travelled to New Orleans for our honeymoon May 20, 2009. Absolutely LOVE the city, history, culture, good weather and lots of fun! The entry to the hotel, concierge, front desk and lobby bar are beautiful. Very "nouveau" with lots of areas to "snoodle" and have a drink. Concierge is very helpful, free internet, chess game. Lighting is very low, wouldn't recommend for anyone who has difficulty seeing. Cute little ideas such as changing the carpets in the elevator to say "Good Morning" and "Good Afternoon". Rooms were very disappointing. We were apparently "upgraded" however, the room was small, the bathroom very standard and disapointing, shower head did not work well. Bliss bathroom amenties are excellent. King bed very comfortable. TV had lots of options. Safe needed to be repaired, carpeting looked "worn". Nice view of the river and pool. Pool did not have enough chairs, cabanas were beautiful, however it was unclear whether you could use them or had to pay a fee. Fitness facility was more than adequate. Restaurant was disappointing, however, they did "comp" our purchase without us having to complain. Could not find a "Bliss spa". Conference facilities looked excellent. Acura "experience" ridiculous, car was NEVER available. Overall a decent hotel, but would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What the?”
Reviews.Author: jnine71
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in NOLA - stayed at the W. We hesitated to make the reservation because of some of the weird reviews, but went with it. After the experience we just had at the hotel, I have to wonder what people really expect?!?! We had excellent, friendly service from start to go. I say that after having experienced "reservation issues" but the staff handled it quickly and were friendly and apologetic about the confusion. We even got a free drink coupon that brought us into ZOE where we met the award winning mixologist, Amanda. She was very friendly and made an excellen cocktail. All in all a really fun trip and very pleasant hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: ERtrips
Reviews.Content: My stay at the W was great. Travis Frye in concierge was very pleasant and helpful. He accommodated our needs and was very hospitable. They offer complimentary car rides to any nearby location in a brand new 2009 Acura MDX. I want to thank Brandon, the Acura driver, for greeting us every morning. Travis recommended Emerilâ€™s close by to the hotel for lunch. It was phenomenal. I highly recommend lunch at Emerilâ€™s. We also toured the French Quarter and ate dinner 2x at Murielâ€™sâ€¦.delicious. Overall, my trip was wonderful. If you are visiting the New Orleans/French Quarter area, I highly recommend you stay at the W and say hello to Travis Frye!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: ceeceejones
Reviews.Content: I must say that I have had nothing but exceptionally fine dealings with this hotel . The few times I had to ask for changes, they were carried out quickly and cheerfully. the quality of their hotel & staff is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: dsaccone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for business this past week. I must say that the people who work there are fantastic. They really do believe in making your wishes come true. The concierge, Travis, was the best. If you need a recommendation of where to go, where to eat or anything else, he is your man. The drivers, especially Brandon, are also great. If you need to go anywhere, the drivers are there to help you. You really do get the experience of home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “GHETTO”
Reviews.Author: grrannemal
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from the room. It is probably the worst hotel experience of my life. The first room we got stunk like cigarettes, even though they had described it as a non-smoking room. On top of it, the place was dirty. The cushion on the white chaise lounge was upside down - zipper side up - and had all kinds of black/brown spots on it. There were spots on the duvet cover, and the floor. We called downstairs to see about getting another room. They said someone would come up to help us move to another room. The guy took forever to get upstairs, so by the time he got upstairs we were obviously tired of waiting, so we had moved ourselves and our stuff to the elevator bank. i was ready to go downstairs myself to switch the keys but the guy finally got there. The second room smelled just as bad as the first, and had a stained duvet cover as well but since we had already spent an hour waiting to settle into a room, we just figured we'd go with it. Besides, we figured if the room they moved us into smelled just as bad as the first, it must just be that all their rooms smelled like that. The towels don't absorb water, but they do spread lint all over you when you try to dry yourself, which is a lovely touch. Now I was going to take a nap but the people in the next room - sounds like there are about 6 of them - just flipped on the stereo super loud. I called the front desk to see about switching rooms and have now been waiting for a call back for about 20 minutes. So far the news has been "we don't have any other king rooms available..."

Reviews.Title: “Friendy and relaxed - great location too”
Reviews.Author: Simpkins76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel New Orleans from 1-5 May 2009. This was an unplanned, last minute booking through Expedia during a trip to the USA and the purpose was to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. We did in fact book the W French Quarter but there was some confusion during the confirmation over the phone with Expedia. We fully intended to move hotel on arrival, however, having arrived at the W New Orleans we decided immediately to stay. We would agree with previous reviewers that the staff, from the valet parking guys to the check in staff, were extremely friendly. Some hotels of this standard can be a little intimidating but this is simply not the case at the W. Saturday night saw the hotel filled with people dressed up for a big night out at the hotel, but also saw guests in flip flops making their way back from a full day of sunshine and cocktails - again highlighting the relaxed atmosphere at the hotel. We had been concerned about noise from the bar area in the early hours but this simply wasn't a problem. We didn't eat in the hotel at any stage during our stay so can't comment on the food or brasserie area, but both our room and the pool area were great. It would be good to mention that the pool isn't heated however as I wasn't the only guest to get a fright when going for a dip! The only complaint about the pool area is that our room on the 4th floor overlooked the pool and we tried, but failed, to have a siesta in the afternoon on the Saturday as the music was very loud. This didn't seem to be the case on subsequent days so may not have been the norm, The location was perfect for the Mississippi, French Quarter and it is opposite Harrahs, if you fancy a bit of Vegas style casino action, which we did. Easy access to the street cars too, for those who don't wish to walk far. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a bit of luxury and very friendly service. The 12pm check out time was great too and meant we could have a leisurely start to our final day in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Great Location, Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: Waterisbrown
Reviews.Content: The hotel is showing some age and needs some TLC in a renovation but the hotel staff from the time I drove in and was welcomed by the valet car employee to the desk area and bellman, I was impressed with the friendly and at home feeling. First Impression for me was the friendly staff .... the rest will just work out.

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: scbagwell
Reviews.Content: We brought our kids to New Orleans for their first time. It was also their first time staying in a hotel (3 & 2 yrs old). Needless to say I had some doubts about it. But the staff there was wonderful. They made my kids feel special by giving them each a pack of mardi gras beads and a drink when we walked in one day from site seeing. The staff is very professional but also warm. We def plan on taking them back.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love...”
Reviews.Author: Cutie67
Reviews.Content: I always stayed at any one of the W Brands or The Sharaton..but this time we came down for the Jazz Festival. And when we fist came to the hotel we were greeted very nice, the bellman politly grabbed our bags as the doors opened i was just in total aww as i waliked through the beutiful hotel the colors were perfectly put together (my first time at that hotel)...but everything wasnt so lovely it seemed like it took forever just for us to check in to the hotel...but when we finally checkd into our double room it was quite small and the furniture was totally out dated looked like it was time for a make over, the room was fresh and i love the ameneties by Bliss.. i loved my stay and from now on when i come back to New Orleans i wont just come back for the food but for the W hotel Experience because everyone from the valet to the house keeping was so friendly and made our stay more joyful or family loved it and so did we keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: “Simply don't understand all the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: sll31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for jazzfest, and found the hotel to be perfect. Our room, on the 21st floor, was spacious, comfortable and in good decorative condition (it should be noted that I think this was a superior room, and therefore some of the other comments on this site may not be relevant to my experience). Beds superbly comfortable. Maid service was well organized, the room always being cleaned whenever we left the room. Pleasant front desk staff, excellent concierge. The hotel is overtly hip, so if that's not your thing, then try somewhere like the Pavillion, just up the road. But if you don't mind a bit of a 'scene' where you're staying, wouldn't hesitate in recommending this place.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel. Go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: cincra
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews here, they're all true. This hotel is horrible. Don't let the flashy facade fool you, just underneath is a shame to the Westin brand. Dirty hallways and beat-up dirty rooms. Chewed on pen left on the desk. I saw a used glass on a table outside the elevator for 2 and a half days. Charged 2 times in one day for a 1 day internet fee, charged for food I never took out of the fridge, 28 bucks a day to park, this place is a joke. The management here has NO CLUE how to run a hotel and is, like another reviewer stated, more concerned about the occassional celeb that may show up.

Reviews.Title: “The worst service I've ever experienced at a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: amw411
Reviews.Content: The staff is a nightmare and the place is overrun with ignorance. The details should be a priority at this hotel but instead you get harassed and a vacation can quickly turn into a job. This place was awful and we will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read.”
Reviews.Author: mfz52
Reviews.Content: We were put off by some poor reviews on Trip Advisor. We actually only stayed one night and booked the remainder of our stay elsewhere because of the negative reviews we read. Too bad! We found W to be very clean, well maintained, a great value and an excellent location. Next time we travel to New Orleans we are staying the entire time at W!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is so unorganized... not worth even using points”
Reviews.Author: SPGplatinumTenYears
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have stayed here 4 times as the location is great, however, the service is aweful from the management down. The "car service" has never been up and running during any of the 4 time I've stayed here (even though when you call them, they advertize it when you are on hold). They don't guarantee the rooms which they claim you can stay in. Some of the employees are outstanding, but it is obvious that management needs help.

Reviews.Title: “do not ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: aloha25
Reviews.Content: Horrible service. Poorly trained front desk staff. The worst Starwood and W has to offer. Do not stay at the W on Poydras Street. If you want a Starwood property, stay at the W French Quarter or at The Westin Canal Place.

Reviews.Title: “Nope- not it.”
Reviews.Author: AKAPearl
Reviews.Content: This a a very nice location. Approximately 7 blocks from Jackson Square in the French Quarter. It is about 3 blocks from the Riverwalk and right across the street from Harrah's Casino. The lobby is really chic. This is where the positive reviews end. The rooms are REALLY tiny and the walls are REALLY thin. Our bathroom was LITERALLY dirty- floors, vanity, toilet, mirror, etc. One day I put something on the floor just to see if the housekeepers would clean it- They didn't.) Parking is $38 per day. ROBBERY! I would consider others hotels in the vicinity. The rooms are sub-standard for any hotel's standards.

Reviews.Title: “Why sweat the details if the big things aren't so good?”
Reviews.Author: EarplugLover
Reviews.Content: This W is probably the weirdest place I have ever stayed. There are so many excellent little details in the rooms - post-its, ipod docks, wine glasses - but the important things are sorely lacking. During our visit we were truly disturbed by how thin the walls are. You'd start a conversation and end up talking louder to drown out the conversation next door. Then your neighbors would up their volume to hear over you, and so on, until you're practically yelling to be heard. On top of the loudness factor, the TV remote didn't work, the alarm clock hadn't been changed to reflect Daylight Savings Time (which had taken effect what, 5 months ago?), there was dirt under the bed, and no TP in the bathroom! It was hard to get things made right - not because the staff is rude or bad (which they don't appear to be), but because they seem to be severely understaffed - a common problem in post-K New Orleans, but still! Not a big fan of the overpriced Wi-Fi either. We're not likely to stay here again, even though we love the little detail-y things, the location and the extremely comfy bed. Like the placard on the (always empty) concierge desk says, 'whatever.'

Reviews.Title: “Itâ€™s all about looks and nothing else...”
Reviews.Author: JWKCalifornia
Reviews.Content: But, beyond looks, the New Orleans W doesnâ€™t have a whole lot to offer. In fact, there was so little, we checked out early and switched hotels on the second day. The rooms are very small. It was hard to get from one side of the room to the other as the desk and chair blocked the path at the foot of the bed. Iâ€™d understand this in an older hotel but for a modern hotel, I expected more. The closet was tiny â€“ about the size of a small coat closet. Dresser? There isnâ€™t one. We had to use the nightstand drawers. The air conditioner wasnâ€™t working well. We set the thermostat to 60 degrees and couldnâ€™t get the room cooler than the high 70s . The building engineer who checked it said it was working but because the hotel was full, the demand was high. Iâ€™d hate to have been there in the summer when it gets really hot. The service was less than impressive. We called three times over a period of about 8 hours to get the air conditioner checked and the mini bar removed. A call to the hotel manager was what was what it finally took. (By the way, they also wanted to charge me $25 to remove the mini bar items.) When we checked in, the reservation showed us there for three nights instead of four. The woman working at the desk suggested I call down later and get is squared away. She didnâ€™t want to be bothered. No one should have to work this hard. The walls are too thin to afford any privacy. I could hear people next door talking and could tell what they were watching on television. The front desk manager is fully aware of the problem and knows exactly which rooms are problems. (Too bad they canâ€™t or wontâ€™ address it.) Cleanliness? Not great. The towels were stained and looked filthy. The room looked like all they did was change the sheets between guests. If all you want is a flashy New York or Las Vegas look, the hotel has it. If you want a comfortable, quiet, clean room and decent service you need to go somewhere else â€“ anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Swimming on the roof”
Reviews.Author: comedianwit
Reviews.Content: On the other side of Harrah's Casino with a fine view of the Mississippi River stands the W Hotel...newly renovated from Hurricaine Katrina with new windows, some new furniture and new carpeting on lower levels. While not being Antebellum in ANY stretch of the imagination, the W Hotel does bring a sense of New York Posh to The Big Easy. The rooms were cherisable with California King feather beds that you could sink down to the next floor...very soft. The color scheme for our room was black, white, red, and silver which just happened to be the color scheme of our wedding. While the bathroom sink just dripped with nouveau riche style, I personally found it a bit small as sinks go. However, the quality of service available at this hotel was what topped it off as THE BEST for us. From the Concierge, to the desk clerks, to the waitstaff at the second floor restaurant, everyone there was polite, pleasant, jolly, and helpful. At one point, the wife and I approached these two big bruisers who ran security and asked if it would be possible to go swimming after midnight. Not only did they make it possible for us, but they gave us an escort to our personal cabana and brought us a bottle of fine wine and wine flutes to add that extra touch of elegance to our experience. Really above board! The night was clear, the moon was full; and the rooftop swimming pool was all ours! The W Hotel is High Class all the way in my books!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lndylu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. It is a little bit of a longer walk from the Frech Quarter and closer to the Jackson Square. The one and only issue with this hotel is how thin the walls our. We could litterally hear the person in the next room blowing his nose. Most nights this didn't matter, however when we had to get up for an early morning flight this was a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Modern, and in need of Repairs and Updates”
Reviews.Author: J_Points
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other Starwood properties in the past and figured I would try the W on Canal Street on my trip to New Orleans. The service is outstanding. In fact, I would rank the service level at this hotel as one of the best of all the Starwood properties in which I have stayed. Check-in was quick, the valet were very punctual, and the concierge was extremely helpful Unfortunately, the rooms are far below other Starwood properties. At first glance, the rooms are very trendy and modern, but the quality of the room leaves a lot to be desired. The rooms are small, dingy, and in need of repairs. The room in which I stayed was in was in need to a good paint job. In addition, the bathroom needed to have the faucet tightened and secured to the counter; the tiles needed to be thoroughly cleaned; and the wallpaper needed to be replaced for it was starting to bubble and peel. There was also a sizable dent in the drywall where the door to the room met the wall. The bathroom had a similar dent in the wall. There were stain marks on the comforter and the chair. The safety seal for the bottle water in the room had been broken and all the food for sale in the room seemed to be rather old. Overall, the service is what one would expect from a four or five star hotel. Unfortunately, the quality of the room is what one might expect from a two to three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Please read before staying at the W New Orleans. Not what you hope for!”
Reviews.Author: Monique818
Reviews.Content: I was so conflicted about which hotel to choosein NOLA because there are so many wonderful hotels in NOLA. I decide to go by the reviews people had written online. In the end, I chose the W New Orleans because was I thought it was going to be something spectacular for my husband's birthday. I wanted the best of the best. I wish now that people would have posted more honest reviews. Now I will post a more recent up to date review of the property. We stayed there Jan 16, 2009 until Jan 20, 2009. From this experience, I would say that if the W chain is like this, I will NEVER stay at a W hotel again. Maybe other W hotels are better but I warn you...DO NOT STAY HERE. I paid for a upgraded (spectacular) room but what we got was so shocking and far from spectacular. I was so disappointed bec I had wanted this to be perfect for my husbands birthday. The room was an odd TINY shape and it was filled with chipped and dirty old furniture. There was not even room for me to open the suitcases. I could hear the people on both sides of us and the window was small and covered by slates that you could not even enjoy the view I paid extra for. The bathroom was just as bad. The bathroom must have been no bigger then a 4 ft box. There was a little sink and a disgusting tub and toliet. Words can not discribe how awful this room really was and I did not mention the old condition of the rug and dust in and on everything. I went downstairs and said that I was clausterphobic and that I could hear the people on both sides. I said that I could not stay in there. It took some urging but they changed our room to a more normal square shape and told us the walls are thin so there is nothing they can do about the sounds. The new room gaves us more space and a normal size bathroom but, the larger counter in the bathroom still had a sink that was so small that water splashed everywhere when you tried to wash up and it was chipped and old as well. The walls were bare and the mimi bar was lacking in everything. The first room we were in had completely different items in the mini bar. While we were there they never replaced the missing items or added the things that should have been in there. In the room, there were no dresssers to unpack your things and the furnture in this 2nd room was no better then in the first. The first day we stayed there,housekeeping never bother to come clean the room and I had to call and inquire if there even was housekeeping. Then the safe was broken and they sent someone to fix it but when they could not, they would not replace it even though I asked them too. I did not want to let it ruin this trip I had planned but I just could not believe that this is considered exceptional. It was far far far from exceptional. I have stayed at a 5 star hotel and this I would HONESTLY rank as 2 stars. They did not even have q tips and littlle trinkets we like to find in the bathrooms of nice hotels. On a positive note, I will say that I really utilized the consierge people to make up for the disgusting rooms. Most of them were very nice and helpful. I enjoyed bothering them every 2 seconds for things we wanted or places to go. It made me feel better about the price I had paid for this room. I am certainly going to write a letter of disappointment to the hotel management and starwood. There are gorgeous hotels in NOLA and this is not one of them. I also went and checked out the W hotel French Quater to see if that was better and dare I say the rooms were even smaller and double the price. Do yourself a favor and stay at Harrahs if you want a more modern feel or Windsor Court if you want a real 5 star hotel. Even if I had paid $100 night at this hotel that would have been too much. Honestly, there are nicer cheaper 2 star hotels in NOLA that are in better shape then this place. I am sorry to write such a review but if I had read something like this, I would have never stayed there. There is no way around it...the rooms are small, old, bare, dirty, terrible amenties except for the bliss soaps, and over priced. Good Luck. I am now left with a bad taste in my mouth for W Hotels and that is a real shame. This is a terrible and over priced dingy skank hotel. What a real BUMMER, but on a great note the FOOD in NOLA is heavenly. SO eat plenty and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “This Only LOOKS Like a W....”
Reviews.Author: mimsw
Reviews.Content: This property shouldn't keep the W brand. I've booked into this place two weeks in a row, hoping it would be lovelier the second time around. The first time the room assigned was not the room promised..or paid for. I was moved without much of a comment. Then, this trip, I had to move twice. The first move was because the room was again NOT what I paid for...and it was dirty. The next room, the keys didn't work...the third room, finally was okay and the front desk person, Cherie, was very helpful and offered me $100 room service credit. But, then room service was spotty and anything OTHER than "whatever whenever." After a debate with the "wish person" about whether I could order something not on the regular room service menu, I finally got dinner. Breakfast service was downright rude and at checkout, it took 45 minutes to get my car from the mandatory valet service. I'm outta here and you should be, too. The W "Whatever promise puts a higher level of expectation on a property and this one is not prepared to deliver. There is FAR more supply than demand in New Orleans and this property should not be rewarded for it's indifference.

Reviews.Title: “keeps going downhill”
Reviews.Author: jimjade3
Reviews.Content: I really like the W chain. However, the New Orleans W is not their best product. Some hotel rooms make you feel like you were the first guest there. Others make you feel like many people were there before you - they have left stains, prints, dust and other things you don't want to think about. The latter is the impression I got from the W New Orleans rooms. I stayed there a year ago and found large stains on an otherwise comfortable couch. This year I found a similar couch with even worse stains, stained carpeting, stained shower curtain and kind of a solid sheet of dust and stains on a large black shiny wall in the bathroom. I do not obsess on doing white glove testing of hotel rooms. You didn't need white gloves to know something is wrong here. I often wonder if the owner or manager of these hotels would really offer visitors to their own homes couch seating with large stains on it...? Also, the public areas are nowhere near as nice as most W hotels. I just wrote a review of the Atlanta W and it was a great place. On the up side...the staff at the N.O. W tries. They helped me out with bringing a sheet to cover up the nasty couch, brought bandaids, and helped me out with an umbrella. The fitness center is large and well equippped. And...the W Bed is truly amazing. I think it is the most comfortable bed that I have ever tried in a hotel. New Orleans has had some very trying times. Other hotels seem to have remodeled but this hotel just seems to be going further downhill. The location is great - near the Quarter, near the aquarium, near the arts/warehouse district and again the best beds in town. Why they do not do a surface remodel program - repaint. re-cover, recarpet - is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “Spotty service and poor maintenance ruin what could be a nice W”
Reviews.Author: crewfox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W New Orleans for 5 nights in October 2008, while visiting New Orleans to attend a family member's wedding. We chose to stay in a Starwood property since I am a SPG Gold member and stay in their properties often, but I have to say that I agree with many of the reviews on this site and was also disappointed. The level of service one has come to expect from a W hotel simply is not available at this hotel. I also agree the the room interiors needed proper cleaning and significant maintenance to repair stains, scratches, etc. All of our service requests required multiple calls, often requiring us to go down to the reception or concierge in person to get attention. Others in our party experienced similar issues. We arrived at the same time as 4 other family members, and though I had asked for an early check-in, none of our 3 rooms were ready. It was about 2pm, with check-in at 3, but we were told that the rooms would not be ready until at least 4 - 4:30pm. We went for lunch after being assured that "we''ll call you when your room is ready", but never received a call. Around 4:30 we came back, and only one of our rooms was ready (ours). Though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room, when we finally entered the room we realized immediately that it had recently been smoked in, and asked for a room change. Of course we had to wait, but at that point it was only for about half an hour. Other problems during the stay revolved (incredibly!) around our mundane request for an in-room coffee maker. This service is available at this W but apparently rarely requested, as rooms do not come with a coffee maker by default and coffee is served in the lobby each morning. Our initial request for a coffee maker on the day we arrive took 3 calls and over 4 hours, and each day afterwards, the housekeeping staff would ignore the used coffee pot and neither clean it and the mugs, nor restock it with more coffee and supplies. The first day, I thought it must be an oversight, called housekeeping about 3 times, and eventually had it serviced. The next day, I actually WROTE A NOTE to the housekeeper asking her to service it. It was ignored. The third morning, I placed the coffee pot and mugs NEXT TO THE SINK in the bathroom with my note, and yet it was still ignored! I believe this is completely unacceptable in a hotel of this category, and I frankly don't want to be washing dishes during my vacation. Though we complained several times during our stay about the slow and inefficient service, management largely ignored our complaints. The one standout in terms of service at this W is the "Acura Experience" that is complimentary. The hotel has 2 Acura SUVs that will drop you off anywhere within a 6 mile radius, which was very convenient and run by very helpful and friendly drivers. This was one of the highlights of our stay, as it cut down on our taxi fares and helped us and our family move around town very quickly. Several other family members stayed across the street at the Loews Hotel, which was much better in terms of restaurant options (the breakfast/brunch at CafÃ© Adelaide is excellent), size of the rooms (huge vs. tiny at the W), and overall service and care for the property. The next time we visit, we'll stay there. One final note: I wrote to Starwood expressing my frustration with the service upon my return, and to their credit, they investigated the matter and I received several personal emails in reply and was credited starwood points to my SPG account.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hotel a W Should Be”
Reviews.Author: wnbamiamisol
Reviews.Content: We had planned a 5 day stay in New Orleans at the Windsor Court and were arriving a day earlier than planned. American Express Platinum Travel tried to get an additional night with the Windsor Court but being a Saturday night, it was full. The travel agent apprehensively suggested the W Hotel, virtually next door. He stressed repeatedly "it IS a 4 star." Upon arrival by car, we kind of had to look for a valet. It took a couple minutes before a young man said "I'll take care of your car - do you need a bellman?" Actually, since we were only staying for one night, we didn't. Two bellmen nearly fought over us and insisted to take our one shoulder-slung overnight bag. The bellman kept repeating "I'll store your bags until your room is ready." I thought this odd because AmEx Travel had requested early check-in. Mind you, this was about 1:30 and official check-in was 3pm. Had to wait at the desk until the girl finished with two others, both of whom she told to come back because the rooms were not ready. Instead of a cheerful greeting I would have expected, as I stepped to the desk she said "help ya?" while never looking up at me. I handed her my credit card and she entered the info in her computer and then responded "your room is not ready." She then said "the bellman will store your luggage and we will call you on your cell when your room is ready." We left on foot and walked the French Quarter. At a little after 4pm, I received a call that the room was ready. Went back to the hotel and again waited to get my room keys. The girl again said "help ya?" without ever looking up. No recognition that I had been there earlier. Our room was on the 18th floor. I suppose they consider the higher floor the upgrade American Express Platinum is supposed to get. (Also Starwood Gold) The room was tiny. It was the adjoining bedroom to a suite. If we had had 5 suitcases, there would have been no place to open them. At first glance it was nicely appointed. On closer look, the lounger had stains and wear. There was lots of dust around the carpet edges. Two outlets in the bathroom didn't work, so it was impossible to blow dry my hair in front of a mirror. No internet access. No telephone books. No way to find the addresses/phone numbers of restaurants to make reservations. Downstairs, the concierge was continually busy. Unlike other TA reviewers, we found the restaurant the positive experience of the hotel. The food was excellent on the small limited menu and the service was also fantastic for us. The gal who waited on us was very cheerful and funny as well as efficient. The next morning, we were eager to check out and go "next door" to the Windsor Court. We checked out at 9am! The $129 room rate became $179 due to taxes and overnight parking for the car. For the price and location, I would say the W is a bargain. If I had paid more, I would feel I had been ripped off. This W is NOT what the W should be!

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, Whenever...just not here”
Reviews.Author: ChillyAlbertans
Reviews.Content: First trip to NOLA and we were quite excited about our first stay in a W Hotel. I am partial to Starwood and stay in many Westin and Sheraton properties. I have rarely had a problem with this group. As such, we were surprised at the experience at this place. As indicated in other reviews, the front staff were indicativve of what was to come. Three guys out front (one of whom obviously worked for the hotel) watched us get our suitcases from the cab. "Watched" is the wrong word, from ten feet away they must have sensed our presence, because each was full time texting. We were met inside by a friendly young employee who offered to help us with the luggage (and did). We were checked in by another nice young fellow. We asked both of them where we could get food this late (around midnight). The first lad said he knew nothing about the area being new, but Reginald at the front desk highly recommended Pizza Fiesta...a great place for pizza and mexican he said (and noted he ate there several times a week)...yeah sure. He assured us nothing else was open his late. The menu he gave us was for basic pizza without a hint of any mexican. I don't know what his deal was, but he had something to gain by us going there; of that there is ltittle doubt. We declined and ended up wandering over to Harrah's to eat. So off to the room we go, it is tiny, but well appointed. The bathroom was dirty (I mean DIRTY). The chaise lounge was dirty, the room, on closer inspection was run down in general. We called down for pillows...it took two calls. The second call the person answering said that the request was marked as complied with...hmmm. The internet was down. We were assured that it would be fixed shortly...in three days it never worked. We were told, it was available intermitantly, it was on the verge of being fixed and, finally, by the concierge, that it had been down a long tie and was not expected to be up again for days or weeks. I suspect it has been down since October after reading the earier posts. We noted a complete absence of phone books or the standard Where mag etc. There were many little things we were chaffing about (the list is long) and decided to check out that night. We contacted the Whatever people and asked for phone books. We were told that it is Head Office policy not to supply phonebooks!!!! SO, no internet, no phone books.....I told the lady on the phone we were unhappy and planned to leave early. She enquired into what the problems were and assured me that if I gave her a chance she would "work her magic" (her words). Never heard from her again (this was on the morning of the second of three days...the other hotels we contacted were full so we were forced to extend the stay). Called the front again the next day and asked for the Marriott number...when asked (again) why were moving hotels, the employee insitsted I should speak to the on duty manager Allison. I toldsour tale of woe and Allison assured us she would correct the account and that she understood why we were upset. She offered to speak to the Sheraton manager if we moved there (and stayed inside the SPG group). We called the Sheraton, explained the problem and they said they would await Allison's call. I called her back and told her to call. THe next day we walked over to the Sheraton and were told the manager never called.
